VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The volunteers can assist with preparing,serving and/or delivering the food, and clean up.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be 18+

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Together Green Volunteer Days: Project FeederWatch Kick-Off!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: On Thursday, November 13, please join Pickering Creek Audubon Center for our Project FeederWatch Kick-Off! From 1:00-4:00 p.m., we will plant our new native bird and butterfly garden and provide orientation for 2008-2009 Project FeederWatch participants! No experience is necessary, and we will include some bird-watching and identification tips and tricks. Project FeederWatcher is a great opportunity to connect children and families to nature, to learn to identify birds in winter, to actively participate in a citizen scientist program, and to contribute to bird conservation studies. This is the second of six TogetherGreen Volunteer Days events.

SpecialInstructions.p: Project FeederWatch volunteers must be available once per week (on average) from November through April. Volunteers must make observations during office hours, which are Monday-Friday from 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. and on Saturday from 9:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m. Minors are welcome, but children under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an adult.

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: This event occurs from 1:00-4:00 p.m. Long-term monitors may choose their own schedules but must monitor during office hours.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Open House Help
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with various activities at the museum's Holiday Open House. Activities include a cookie walk, gingerbread house making, children's crafts, and assisting visitors.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sign Language Interpreter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Be a sign language interpreter for a deaf exchange student from Nigeria during a mid-term orientation Nov. 15-16.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must know sign language
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Approx. 9-5 on Nov. 15 and from 10-1 on Nov. 16.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Halloween Party assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Play games and hand out prizes at a Halloween party for 3-7 year olds. Come in costume, if you'd like.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Food Drive Volunteers Needed! - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need volunteers ages 14 and up to assist with food drive we are having Saturday and Sunday to assist our low income residents in Montgomery County. We will be collecting food in front of grocery stores in Rockville and Germantown Saturday and Sunday. Must attend 1 hour training on Friday, October 24, 530pm-630pm.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must attend 1 hour training on Friday, October 24 530pm-630pm
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Saturday, 10/25 7am-7pm; Sunday, 10/26 from 7am-7pm. Sign up for one or more shifts on those two dates. Must attend 1 hour training on Friday, October 24 530pm-630pm

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Women Who Care Ministries, Inc. (Approved SSL MCPS)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Blair Beautification Project - Community Service Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come out, have fun, and help beautify Montgomery Blair High School! As part of Community Service Day, volunteers are needed to help with weeding around gardens, bushes, picking up trash and recyclables, replanting grass in areas, and watering newly planted bushes and trees.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9am to 12pm

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Volunteer Center, Montgomery County (Approved SSL MCPS)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Electronic Waste Recycling Event Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed for monthly Green Challenge Free electronic Recycling Event being held this month at Thompson Creek Trail, Tully & Capitol behind Lucky's Supermarket. Volunteers are needed for the following tasks - assisting in the coordination and flow of the recycling event, directing traffic flow and entrance/exit of parking lot, management of data collection for CRT and televisions to ensure that they are from CA and customer service with clients.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: General Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Your time and skills can help a neighbor in need!
Rebuilding Together Silicon Valley is looking for general volunteers with or without any construction skills who are willing to help with home repairs and safety modifications for our Rebuilding Day - October 25, 2008. We are looking for people with a can-do attitude and a willingness to roll up their sleeves and get dirty! We'll teach you what you need to know to help out!
See the Rebuilding Day Event for more information.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: None

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Captain - Race Route Set-Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Oversee two other volunteers in the set-up of the race route. Includes laying cones along entire race route and delivering tables to the mid-way point of the course. Upon completion of the race, work with two volunteers to collect the cones and tables along the course route.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must have your own truck and be able to drive the two volunteers and race route materials.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 7am to 12pm (some break time during the actual race).

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Coordinate efforts of the registration tables on the morning of the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Collection of money; coordination of multiple volunteers; delegation of other duties as needed.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: On Saturday, October 25th volunteers will visit with senior residents from Huron Woods nursing home. Activities will include; painting finger nails, reading, arts and crafts, serving icecream, and putting together puzzles.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must like working with senior citizens

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Family Volunteer Day volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers will do a variety of tasks such as; sorting and sizing clothes for foster youth, make Thanksgiving Day cards, decorate the Do-All Material assistance center for Christmas, and help make tie fleece blankets.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Families are encouraged to volunteer during this event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers are needed from 9am until noon.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Teen Peer Court
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Teen Peer Court is an alternative justice system for youth who are accused of committing non-violent crimes. Volunteers hear real cases and participate in a real court hearing to convict and sentence teen offenders. You can volunteer as an attorney, bailiff, judge or jury. Volunteer at the Santa Cruz Court House or Watsonville Court House.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be under 18
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers must be at the court house by 5:30pm, hearing begins at 6pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Restorative Board Volunteer Training
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Berrien County Trial Court - Community Restorative Board exists to give juveniles a 2nd chance to become worthwhile citizens and make Berrien County a safer place to live, and to help juveniles develop better decision making skills. The CRB will have a training for new volunteers interested in this process. The training will be held at the Niles Law Enforcement Complex Center, 1600 Silverbrook Avenue, Niles, MI at 5:30 p.m. The training is open to youth in high school, adults and seniors. Individuals who want to participate should have an interest in making victims, neighborhoods, communities and juvenile offenders whole again after a 1st time offender commits a crime. If you would like to sign up or need more information please contact Patricia Leonard, Juvenile Probation Officer
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Honest, Dependable, Good Listener, Patient, Thoughtful, Tolerant, and Fair
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 5:30 p.m. until 7:30 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Cleanup around the Long Branch Library and points north - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We will have two groups cleaning up around the Long Branch Area on Community Service Day - we are looking for volunteers to help out the group that cleans up around the Library and the creek going north towards Franklin Avenue. This cleanup will be sponsored by the Sligo Branview Community Association.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Groups and inviduals welcome! Terrain is a little uneven and can be muddy, wear sturdy shoes. Gloves and bags will be provided.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9 to noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Gorgeous Prince Georges Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join us October 18th from 11:00 -2:00 PM as we celebrate the Master Peace Community Garden and Gorgeous Prince Georges Day. We need volunteers to help plant 2-3 dozen trees.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Clean-up of Redland Road at Muncaster Mill- Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Please join us for a quick sprucing up of this busy road east of Gaithersburg! Here\0092s the morning\0092s itinerary:
9:00 AM * Park in the Redmill Shopping Center, at the northwest corner of Redland Road and Muncaster Mill Road * Check in at the Metropolitan Deli (at the Muncaster end of the shopping center) for a FREE cup of COFFEE! * Get your cleaning and safety equipment and road segment assignment
9:15 AM * Groups of volunteers fan out along Redland Road, Muncaster Mill Road, and Muncaster Road if our numbers allow it, picking up litter * Full trash bags will be placed at designated points (Ride On bus stops if available) for subsequent MCDOT pick-up
11:00 AM * Groups return to Metropolitan Deli to return equipment. Enjoy a Value Meal--Sandwich, Fries, and Fountain Soda--on u

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Day Run
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer's will work on race course, water stations, timing and cleaning up. There are lots of opportunity to Volunteer on this day.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteer hours begin at approximately 4:30 a.m for set up and until 11:30 or noon for finish and clean up. Call Andre at the YMCA for details.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Pass water out to runners during the race and clean up cups after the bulk of runners has passed.

Event runs from 5:30 to 10 p.m. Friday
9 a.m. to 10 p.m. Saturday 9 a.m. to 1:30 Sunday

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: 2008 Life if good\00AE Pumpkin Festival
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
WE NEED YOU for the 2008 Life if good\00AE Pumpkin Festival October 25th! The festival will be held at Ladysmith Village in our outdoor amphitheater-- to benefit HomeAid and Project Joy.
On October 25th of this year, will be hosting the 2nd annual Life is good\00AE Pumpkin Festival in our community, to benefit the charitable organizations HomeAid and Project Joy. Last year, our first festival at Ladysmith Village, we raised over $30,000 and we hope to top that this year.
There are two days, October 24th and 25th, that we need your help. While the application I have attached is for Saturday, we will need volunteers all day on Friday the 24th to help us \0093cut and gut\0094 1000 pumpkins in preparation for Saturday\0092s activities. Volunteers that sign up early will get a free Life is good

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Rock Creek Clean Up (MCPS SSL Approved)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Spay Day on October 13, 19, 27th, 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
We provide spay or neuter services to cats and dogs that would not normally be fixed. The criteria we use is qualifying people by income.
We need help checking cats into our "Spay Day" in the morning and then help check the cats out later that day.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Can work well with others, good communication skills, and is orgaized.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We are having a Spay Day on the 13th, 19th and/or 27th. We need help from 7:30am-10am and 4pm-6:30pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Child Care/Baby Sitter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: First Step needs some child care volunteers to watch some kids during its Parent-School engagement evening on Oct. 28 from 6:30-8 at Hamilton Elementary School and on Nov.12 from 6:30-7:30 at Jefferson Elementary school

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help Staff the 1st Annual Harvest Festival - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help man display tables and hands-on history activities, greet and direct visitors, direct traffic and parking, hand out maps, help with set-up and break down of event. Event will feature 19th century crafts and demonstrations, hands-on history activities, hikes and tours, storytelling, artifacts, food and fun. Come see how people lived in 1850\0092s plantation Maryland on this sneak peak of our living history center set to open in 2009.
16 volunteers needed. 8 each shift
RSVP by email menarefoundationdation@aol.com by FRIDAY Oct 24th or call 202.903.4140 by 6pm on Oct 25th.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9am-1pm or 12-4pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Visit Residents & Dismantle Sukkot - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
For the Jewish holiday of Sukkot, little temporary "huts" are built to remind Jews about wandering in the desert for 40 years following the exodus from Egypt and to remember our agricultural heritage and gratitude for the fall harvest.
Volunteers have built and decorated 20 Sukkot, one at each of our group homes for adults with developmental disabilities. Following the holiday, the Sukkot need to be dismantled and stored for use next year. With a group of 4 to 8 adults and teens, the job should take about 20 minutes. If you combine this with a visit with our residents, this could be a delightful afternoon of volunteer service.
This is for both individuals and groups. We will create small groups of interested teens and adults.
Homes are in neighborhoods in Gaithersburg, Rockvil
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: time is flexible - With a group of 4 to 8 adults and teens, the job of dismantling the Sukkot should take about 20 minutes. If you combine this with a visit with our residents, this could be a delightful morning or afternoon of volunteer service.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Great Strides Rye Walk
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a devastating genetic disease that affects tens of thousands of children and young adults in the United States. Research and care supported by the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is making a huge difference in extending the quality of life for those with CF. However, we continue to lose precious lives to CF every day. That's why your help is needed now more than ever to ensure that a cure is found sooner - rather than later. Together, we can make a difference in the lives of those with CF!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Boxes and packing supplies needed (used acceptable)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Station Supervisor
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: There Will be about 10 Halloween-themed games to supervise while the kids are playing. They are all interactive. There will be story telling, Pin the Tail on the Cat, etc. La Raza radio station will be there.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: work well with kids, creative at making signs, outgoing, positive attitude.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Help
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer to assist our organization with our event on April 4th, 2009 at the Phipps Mansion. We need people to assist in finding silent auction items, decoration, registering people at the front door, check attendee lists and take money. We also need people to assist with food and beverage distribution at the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Start finding Silent auction items today!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Had Hatter Tea Party Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist staff with the museum's fall 'Mad Hatter' Tea Party. Serve tea, assist with children's craft activities, and help with set-up and take-down.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Trick or Vote
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Trick or Vote is a Get Out to Vote effort aimed at educating voters about the candidates, amendments, and voter rights; all themed around Halloween. We will be giving out goody bags with candy, promotional items, and most importantly, educational information regarding the General Election. All information is non-partisan and we ask that volunteers wear costumes to pass out information to the attendees of the October 24 Down Town Get Down.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Costumes are optional but preferred!!!!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We ask that volunteers arrive at Down Town Get Down at 5pm for a brief training regarding the material they will be handing out.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: WPS Garden of Lights
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Each night of the event this year we will fill 36 volunteer shifts. This means 540 are needed to ensure the Garden of Lights is a success!
PARKING - Assist with traffic and parking outside in the lots.
ADMISSIONS - Work the cash register at the admission door. (Previous experience with a cash register is helpful, but we will train. Must be at least 18 years old).
GREETERS (Upstairs or Downstairs) - Make the Garden of Lights special for thousands of visitors. Greeters welcome our guests, answer questions and direct visitors. Greeters will be located on both levels of the Visitor Center.
CONCESSIONS - Help make and sell hot chocolate, popcorn and cookies.
WPS Garden of Lights begins Friday, November 28th and runs each Friday-Sunday evening through December 28th. Two vo
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Two volunteer shifts each night: 4:30-6:45 and 6:30-9:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Intake Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Intake volunteers will assist the Intake Team by being responsible for talking with each guest that attends the event. During this conversation, volunteers will ask the guest questions off of the intake form that is provided. The purpose of asking these questions is to help the guest connect with the services they most need and want. After the intake form is completed, the volunteer will hand the guest a map, and will introduce the guest to one of the Escort Services Volunteers.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers must be mentally and emotionally prepared to work with guests who are in need of basic human needs. Sensitivity towards a client's situation is a must. All volunteers must attend a volunteer training.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Training for one hour and will begin at 9:30am with guests arriving at 11am - 3pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Escort Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Escort volunteers will greet each guest after they complete the intake form with the intake volunteer. If the guest would like, the volunteer can walk with them and show them where all of the services they\0092re interested in can be found. The volunteer will introduce the guest to the service providers they want to talk with, answer questions the guest has, and simply listen to and support the guest while they are there. Before the guest leaves the event, the volunteers will let them know about the meal, and encourage them to take the EXIT SURVEY and pick up an essentials bag on their way out.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers must be mentally and emotionally prepared to work with guests who are in need of basic human needs. Sensitivity towards a client's situation is a must. All volunteers must attend a volunteer training.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Training for one hour and will begin at 9:30am with guests arriving at 11am - 3pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Volunteers for the 10th Annual Feed the Community Festival
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteer for the 10th Annual Feed the Community Festival at Lake Ella on Sunday, November 2nd. This is a canned food drive and fundraiser for Second Harvest Food Bank sponsored by Locally Owned Tallahassee. The event will feature live bands, local merchants, local restaurants, children's activities and great prizes from locally owned businesses. The event is set up on the north side of Lake Ella outside Black Dog Caf\00E9.
Set up Volunteers- help to get tables, chairs and tents set up and assist vendors as they arrive.(some lifting of folding tables and chairs required) Shift is 8:00 am-12 noon.
Break Down Volunteers- help to put away tables, chairs and tents and assist vendors as they break down their booths.(some lifting of folding tables and chairs required). Shift is 4:30 pm-7pm

Location.Address1: Front lawn of Black Dog Caf\00E9

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Shifts are either 7:30am-12pm, 12pm-5pm, or 4:30pm-7pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Pumpkin Carvers are needed prior to a Halloween event in Baldwinsville for "pumpkin-lit" trails. Volunteers also needed as guides and to help serve food during event (October 23-26).

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Halloween Nursing Home Visit #2
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Holiday Project gathers volunteers to visit nursing homes and hospitals during the Thanksgiving and Christmas season. According to the National Center for Health Statistics, more than 50 percent of nursing home residents have no close relatives. Our volunteers bring the joy of the holidays to these people. Many volunteers testify that the experience of giving this joy rewards them, here is one such story:
"One woman we visited said that she wasn't feeling well this year and perhaps we shouldn't visit. I think she was feeling a little down that she was alone and didn't appear to have anyone visiting her. We began singing Christmas songs in the room, and the woman took more notice of us and then noticed the dog that we brought. She nearly jumped out of her bed with such joy at seei
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Just bring a good mood!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Rockville Cemetery - Grounds Clean-Up - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help with general clean-up at the historic Rockville Cemetery - this is a 16 acre site with veterans from every war including the Revolution. Rake leaves, clip weeds, and branches, and bag debris. This is an outdoor project that will be cancelled if it rains. Volunteers are requested to bring Rakes, gloves, and wear steady shoes. We are located on Baltimore Road, near the Rockville Mansion and the Croydon Creek Nature Center. From Baltimore Road turn on Avery, park on the street or turn into the cemetery and park along one of the roads in the cemetery. We will meet at the caretakers house - a big white house near the entrance.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help Us Move a Family
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: One of our families is moving out of our program and into permanent housing. They need your help to move to their new home. They are moving from Columbia address to a Ellicott City address on Tuesday, October 21. The time is flexible (evenings ok).
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Ability to lift heavy items.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Time is flexible and evening is fine.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Housing for Homeless Family
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
We have a new family moving in and we need to get their new home ready. Cleaning and painting is needed. The home is located in the Columbia area.
We are doing this on Thursday and/or Friday October 16 & 17, 2008, we can be flexible about the time.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The time is flexible and evenings are fine.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Winter Holiday Food Box Assembly
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
You can help provide holiday meals and cheer for families with limited financial resources that are experiencing an illness and unexpected medical bills. Volunteers are needed to donate and sort food and decorate food boxes for our home-bound patients on Saturday, December 6 from 9:00 a.m until 2:00 p.m.
Families with children 6 and older are encouraged to help with this fun project. Crafty volunteers and younger children will decorate food boxes with Winter and Holiday themes while other volunteers fill the boxes with non-perishable holiday food items.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Families with children ages 6 and older are encouraged to participate.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Food Box Assembly
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
You can help provide holiday meals and cheer for families with limited financial resources that are experiencing an illness and unexpected medical bills. Volunteers are needed to donate and sort food and decorate food boxes for our home-bound patients on Saturday, November 15 from 9:00 a.m. \0096 Noon.
Families with children age 6 and older are encouraged to help with this fun project. Crafty volunteers and younger children will decorate food boxes with Thanksgiving themes while other volunteers fill the boxes with non-perishable holiday food items.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Families with children age 6 and older and individuals are encouraged to help!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Reader Training

RERB is designed to provide engaging and age appropriate events which educate and explore racism with elementary and middle school students in the Boulder community.

Volunteers perform chores such as housekeeping, shopping, laundry, yard work, and minor household repairs. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: House Captain - Rebuilding Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The House Captain is the person in charge on Rebuilding work days and is responsible for planning and managing a safe, quality project that will be a meaningful and enjoyable experience for volunteers and homeowners alike. House Captains are responsible for everything from creating a materials list for the work that needs to be done, to determining how many volunteers are needed to do the work, to purchasing and obtaining donated materials, to overseeing work on the work days.
House Captains must attend Volunteer Leadership Training before the Rebuilding Day.

Rebuilding Day October 25th - 8am-4pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Habitat Restoration for the CA Least Tern
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteers are invited to help maintain a nesting site for endangered California Least Terns at Mariner's Point in Mission Bay. The work party is scheduled for Saturday, October 11, from 9am to noon. We'll be clearing the nesting site of invasive plants so the terns can use the site for nesting and rearing their young. Wear work clothes (long pants, long-sleeved shirt, hat, and sturdy shoes) and sunscreen. If you have them, bring work gloves and weeding tools or clippers. Snacks and water will be provided.
The nesting site is jointly maintained by the San Diego Audubon Society, the City of San Diego, and the US Fish and Wildlife Service. As required by the San Diego Park and Recreation Department, for volunteers 17 and under, a parent or guardian must sign a waiver for each child bef

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: San Diego River Assessment Mission Valley
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
San Diego River Assessment and field data collection. Mission Valley Saturday October 25th and 26th 9-12:30 and 12:30-4 Volunteers will go out in teams to survey invasive plants, trash, and homeless camps along the river. This time we will focus on the length of the river in Mission Valley. We will divide portions of the river into segments that can be surveyed within 2 to 3 hours. Volunteers can sign up for one or more segment(s)during the Blitz. Each segment will have a team of 4 - 6 people assisgned to it including a trained team leader.
No experience necessary, and there are many levels of involvement available. This is perfect for biology and science enthusiasts and a great way to meet other people interested in the environment. Also a great way to see sections of the San Dieg

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Drive the lead car in the front of the race

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Winter Art Dreams! We need your help!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Looking for a way to give back to your community while having a glass of wine?
The second annual Winter Arts Dreams event is coming up on Thursday, November 13 from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Guests are invited to a show exhibiting art produced by Esperanza students and trainees, as well as works by local Chicago artists. For $30.00, visitors will enjoy wine, appetizers and live entertainment, and have the opportunity to purchase holiday cards, cookies, and order Jackie Shen's sensational fudge. Proceeds support Esperanza's mission and the art programs.
As a volunteer, you can have a glass of wine, take a look at the art, and help with registration, coat check, selling art, serving appetizers, etc. We will need many helping hands to run this show, and yours are needed to make this event a succ
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers must be at least 21.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 4:00 p.m. to 9 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Spring Volunteer Naturalist
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with environmental education by leading school groups on hike at the Howard County Conservancy - the county's only environmental education center.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fall Clean Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Painting, cleaning cots, carpets, tables, and chairs,
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:00am- until

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fall Shelter Cleaning Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Cleaning kennels and cages, wiping down walls,. washing windows, minor repairs, yard work, storage organisation, and routine cleaning.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be at least 16 or have a chaperone

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come Volunteer with the Salvation Army in St. Charles during Thanksgiving Distribution, 1pm-4pm, Tuesday November 25th. Many volunteers will be needed to assist with various task during Thanksgiving Distribution. Your task may include greeting and directing clients as they enter the Salvation Army, Distributing food boxes and other various perishable items as needed to complete a Thanksgiving meal, or you may be needed as a designated 'loaders' to help clients load their car.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Families are welcomed to volunteer. Volunteers are asked to be able to lift 50lbs. If you area of service is as a distributor. Volunteers are asked to be at least 14 years or older with parent's permission. As a loader or distributor you may be needed to serve outside, so please dress for the weather.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers are asked to arrive 10 min.'s before your shift starts. Thanksgiving Distribution will be on Tuesday November 25th form 1pm to 4pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: CancerCare 6th Annual Lung Cancer Walk
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
November 2, Sunday, 8:30 AM CancerCare 6th Annual Lung Cancer Walk Town of Oyster Bay Golf Course, Woodbury NY To Benefit: CancerCare\0092s National Lung Cancer Program
The CancerCare 6th Annual Lung Cancer Walk is approximately a 5 mile walking course along the trails of the Town of Oyster Bay Golf Course. We are anticipating 1,000 participants to attend this year and will hold the walk rain or shine. CancerCare welcomes volunteers with a wide range of talent and skills, and we have a number of opportunities for groups of classmates, coworkers, and friends. All we ask is that you want to do something that benefits people affected by lung cancer. Volunteers are needed in the following areas: check-in/ registration, food, water and coffee distribution, incentive distribution, route guards

Location.Address1: Town of Oyster Bay Golf Course

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers will need to report by 7 a.m. or 7:30 a.m. depending on the job assigned.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Lydia Place: Make A Difference Day 2008: Picnic Table Maintenance
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help Lydia Place improve their facility on Make A Difference Day. They would like help drilling a hole into their picnic table so that an umbrella can be fitted into it. Lydia Place will provide a base for the umbrella.
Volunteers will need a hole saw, goggles, and gloves.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Lydia Place.
Lydia Place is a nonprofit, community-based agency serving homeless women and their children.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The picnic table project will run from 9 am to 1 pm.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Whatcom Volunteer Center: Make A Difference Day

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Flu Clinic Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Banish the Flu Bug! Mass Vaccination FREE Flu Clinic!
50 volunteers are needed to assist with flu clinic registration, traffic, clinic flow, set-up, tear down, food pick-up and other duties.
Flu Clinic will be held on Saturday, November 15, 2008 at Soccer Central, Ramsay Park in Watsonville. The Flu Clinic will be open to the public from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM. Volunteer registration will begin at 8 :00 AM and volunteer training will begin promptly at 8:30 AM. Pizza will be provided during the lunch hour and snacks and refreshments will be available throughout the day.
This is the 3rd year in a row that this free flu clinic has been offered to the Watsonville Community. Last year, 1077 participants received a free flu vaccine. This year, our goal is to vaccinate 1700 within a f
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Be flexible and patient.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteer check-in 8:00 AM. Volunteer training will begin promptly at 8:30 AM. Flu Clinic will be open to the public from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM. Volunteers assisting with set-up and tear down will need to arrive at 7:00 AM.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: United Way of Santa Cruz County

A kind and considerate father with medical problems needs help creating a clean environment for his daughter. Please help by organizing, sweeping, dusting, etc.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join us on Saturday, October 25th for National Make A Difference Day--a celebration of neighbors helping neighbors!
We will have a kick-off rally at Dupre Elementary (2008 Ave. T) at 9:30am where there will be coffee and donuts. From there, join us at the Volunteer Center from 10:00am to 12:00pm as we paint our sign and do outdoor gardening and clean-up. Wear work clothes and bring gloves and any gardening tools.
We hope to see you there!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Kick-off Rally at 9:30am. Project completion from 10:00am to 12:00pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need a front desk receptionist to sign folks in, answer phones, direct calls,guide folks to offices. Some typing.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: From 8:30am until 4:30pm lunch at 1:00pm until 1:45pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help the Homeless Walkathon supporting NVFS
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join the NVFS team! All it takes is a few hours of your time. This year, we're encouraging new volunteers to sign up on behalf of NVFS, pay their registration fees ($15 if you are 25 and under, $25 if you are over 25) and WALK on November 22 at the National Mall in DC, to raise awareness about homelessness in our region. You will receive a "Help the Homeless campaign" T-shirt.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers to help visitors at the Las Noches de las Luminarias evenings of enchanted beauty and music Nov. 29 - Dec. 23, 2008. There is a choice between two shifts an evening - 4:30 - 7:30 or 7:30 - 10:30. For more information or to sign up, please contact Pamela Levin (480-481-8166 or plevin@dbg.org.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come and help raise awareness, friends and funds to help every adult in Nassau County write and speak ENGLISH!
Help us sell raffle tickets, set up and coordinate the event and hand out goodie bags.
The day in a nutshell: Over 100 paying guests play Bridge at Temple Emanu-El of East Meadow. We supply breakfast and a catered lunch from Ben's while our guests are involved in 3 hours of duplicate play. There is also a lesson with Michael Kufs of The Bridge School of Long Island.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help the Homeless Walkathon Participant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: NCCF is looking for energetic individuals who are interested in participating in NCCF's Help the Homeless Mini-Walk on our Bethesda Campus. Walk our beautiful nature trail on October 28, 2008 at 4:00 pm and help raise much needed funds for the homeless children, youth, and families in our community.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Registration fees: a minimum of $15 for each youth and $25 for each adult. All registered walkers will receive a 2008 Help the Homeless t-shirt the day of the walk. Please contact Alicia Lee at alee@nccf-cares.org to receive a registration form.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Walk with take place in shifts from 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer at our 3rd annual BBQ to benefit the Albuquerque Opportunity Center for the Homeless
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We have been in operation for five years serving Albuquerque's most vulnerable. As a year-round emergency night shelter for men 18-years and older, we have helped over 3,000 individuals with over 90,000 nights of bed service. To learn more about us, please visit our website at http://www.mhp-nm.org. We will host our 3rd Annual BBQ to benefit the AOC Respite Program on Saturday, October 18. Volunteers needed to help set up and serve food. Food servers should arrive at 4:00 p.m., and set up volunteers should arrive at 1:00 p.m. Volunteers will enter the event at no cost and will enjoy music and Powdrell's BBQ!

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Albuquerque Opportunity Center for the Homeless

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: UNICEF trick-or-treat presenter, helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This fun task involves training in how to teach grade school children about UNICEF and trick-or-treating for UNICEF with the little orange box, and then presenting in a classroom with another volunteer. 30-40 minutes. If you like working with kids this is a great opportunity.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day with Graffiti Removal
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join the staff of the Graffiti Removal Project at the Simpkins Swim Center parking lot in Live Oak or the Sheriff's substation on Casserly Road in Watsonville at 9 a.m. to clean-up graffiti and educate the community about how to take action in their neighborhood. The Graffiti Removal Project works with volunteers year round to effectively eliminate graffiti in the unincorporated areas of Santa Cruz County. The program provides free graffiti prevention packets, organizes community paint-outs, and maintains a graffiti hotline for reporting purposes. Join in the efforts to keep Santa Cruz Graffiti free!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9AM-12PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: American Museum of Radio and Electricity: Make A Difference Day 2008: Volunteer Work Room Development
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The American Museum of Radio and Electricity will be preparing a volunteer space by organizing and moving equipment and tools out of the space. They will also be building shelves, as well as ripping up carpet between kitchen and bathroom areas. Building supplies and some tools provided. Please bring extras if you have them.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with the American Museum of Radio and Electricity.
The American Museum of Radio and Electricity is an interactive museum which offers an educational gallery tour to explain the development and use of electricity, radio and the related inventions.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Be wear work clothes, gloves, and a smile!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The development project will run from 9 am to 1 pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: AmeriCares Day Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: AmeriCares is the largest domestic outreach program undertaken by the AmeriCares Foundation each year. Its goal is to help deserving homeowners remain safely and comfortably in a hazard-free home. The program is dedicated to "raising spirits and restoring hope" through an annual, volunteer-driven, free day of essential home repairs. Come help on Homefront Day by painting, cleaning, and the registration of participants.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:00am-5pm-Hours are flexible

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

The Woodstock Farm Conservancy seeks to protect and recall the heritage and character of Woodstock Farm and Inspiration Point. They seek to promote community awareness and stewardship of the Farm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Pre-Make-A-Difference Day Workday Volunteer!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We're giving you the opportunity to make a difference BEFORE the actual Make-A-Difference Day. Join Story County Conservation as we kick off a week of doing good with a workday at Dakins Lake. Participants will work with staff to remove woody vegetation and haul brush from a remnant prairie. We've got a lot to do to bring back the suppressed prairie, and you can really make a difference by helping out now!

Location.Address2: .5 mile north of E-18 on 710th Ave

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Participants should dress for the weather and expect some physical labor. Long pants, sturdy shoes, and work gloves are recommended (we have a few pairs to loan if you don't have them.)
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 1:00 p.m. Please be on time to go over safety orientation but you may leave early if necessary.

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Computer knowledge, especially with graphic design software and good writing skills
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Project will last until completed and approved by Administration. approx 40 hours

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: For Saturday Masterworks performance "Heartbeats and Rachmaninoff" - Enhance the meaningful music experience of our patrons: greet incoming patrons, answer questions about music being presented, direct patrons to restrooms/concessions/box office, hand out marketing materials (brochures, fliers, etc.) and other responsibilities as needed. MSO Concert Concierges receive complimentary parking and tickets to the evening's concert are provided.

Location.Address1: Cannon Center for the Performing Arts

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers arrive at 6:15pm and assist patrons on arrival until concert begins at 8pm. Volunteers may attend concert compliments of the Symphony, return to stations during intermission, and may return to concert after intermission, if desired.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
These can be done in shifts of 2 to 3 hours or more or all day if the Volunteers would like to stay all day. Here are the positions I need Volunteers for:
Cashiers/Ticket Sellers -- 3 people all day. These will receive the cash for the purchase of a Boarding Pass (admission) to the Expo. These will also exchange the free Vouchers for a Boarding Pass that may be distributed to lucky people throughout the area. The Volunteers that will be doing this job must have some experience in taking money and making change.
Greeters/Ticket Takers/Information Bags -- 3 people all day. These will be just behind the "Cashiers/Ticker Sellers" and their main job will be to greet and welcome the public to the Expo, help them fill out the information on their Boarding Pass which will be u

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: City of Bellingham: Make A Difference Day 2008: Trail Clearing at the Lookout Mountain Preserve: FULL
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
THIS PROJECT IS FULL. There are no more spaces available. Please consider another one of our projects; we'd love to have your help!
Help The City of Bellingham clear a one-mile loop trail. This trail needs brush cleared, small logs removed, and minor drainage repairs. The trail leads to a forested wetland and 40 foot waterfall and is part of the Lookout Mountain Preserve.
Please bring gloves and wear sturdy boots and a rain-or-shine attitude. If there is time, we will explore the Highpoint Trail nearby.
Directions to location will be provided at the kickoff breakfast at Bellingham High School at 8 a.m. Optional transportation is also provided.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day with California Native Plant Society
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join the California Native Plant Society in their efforts to restore native habitat in the parks and protected lands in Santa Cruz County. This volunteer project will provide an opportunity for people to learn about the natural systems that surround them while helping to restore special and wild places. No prior work experience is necessary, just show up at the park. Individual and group volunteers from 8 to 80 years are welcome.
Wear comfortable layered clothing, bring something to drink, and lots of enthusiasm! Work rain or shine, but if things get particularly unpleasant, we call it a day. Tools provided; bring gloves.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 10AM-1PM

SponsoringOrganization.Name: California Native Plant Society - Santa Cruz Chapter - Habitat Restoration

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day With Youthserve
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Spend your day with other teens and families helping to design and prepare arts and crafts materials for an upcoming "Kids Day" Program. Kid's Day is a special monthly event held at the local jail for children of incarcerated parents. It is difficult to have a parent away from home and visiting the jail can feel scary. Kid\0092s Day aims to lighten the burden by creating safe, family friendly activities for children to do with their parents while at the jail. Join Youthserve staff in developing materials for the next Kids Day Event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 1-4PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Slum Doctor Programme: Make A Difference Day 2008: Landscaping and Exterior Clean Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help the Slum Doctor programme improve the Old Foundary facility. National Make a Difference Day Saturday, October 25, 2008 9AM - 1PM
Local Site: The Old Foundry 100 E Maple Street Bellingham, WA 98225
Onsite Coordinators: Laura: The Old Foundry 360.224.3669 Paige: Slum Doctor Programme Phone: 360.224.1644
Effort: Facility Beautification and Maintenance

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Please be dressed to work outside, rain or shine. Children must be accompanied by an adult.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Health Support Center: Make A Difference Day 2008: Festival of Trees Poster Distribution (Lynden)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

At 12:30 pm, pizza and pop will be served at the Health Center in Bellingham; all volunteers who help with poster distribution are welcome to attend.
PLEASE NOTE: This event will take place in Lynden. You will need transportation.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Health Support Center.
Health Support Center provides office and other essential services to self-help support groups, advocacy groups, and/or independent advocates, who serve persons with health impairments or disabilities and/or caregivers of such persons.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: PLEASE NOTE: This event will take place in Lynden. You will need transportation.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The postering project will run from 9 am to 12:30 pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Tree Planting Volunteer (MCPS SSL Approved)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The City of Takoma Park is hosting a tree planting on Saturday, October 18th and we are inviting all members of the community to volunteer their time to help plant a couple dozen young trees.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9 am-12 pm

SponsoringOrganization.Name: City Of Takoma Park (Approved SSL MCPS)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Lydia Place: Make A Difference Day 2008: Flower Box and Bed Planting: FULL
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
THIS PROJECT IS FULL. There are no more spaces available. Please consider another project; we'd love to have your help!
Join Lydia Place for some gardening work to beautify their site. They would like to have some weeding and pruning done, and then some flowers planted in flower boxes and flower beds.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Lydia Place.
Lydia Place is a nonprofit, community-based agency serving homeless women and children.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The planting project will run from 9 am to 1 pm.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Whatcom Volunteer Center: Make A Difference Day

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Non-Scary Halloween Party Team Members
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Up to 20 volunteers are needed throughout the event. Help with food, registration, and games. Shifts are from 11a-1:30p, 1:30p-4p, and 4p-6p. If you want to come out and help with this family friendly Halloween activity, call Andrea Schroeder, 419-422-5415, or email her at aschroeder@campfireusa-nwohio.com.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Up to 20 volunteers are needed throughout the event. Help with food, registration, and games. Shifts are from 11a-1:30p, 1:30p-4p, and 4p-6p. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fall Fest Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers to stand outside and hand candy bags to children who come by trick or treating. Volunteers to run movie room and pass out popcorn. Volunteers to help running a wild volleyball game. Volunteers to guide the children to each activity. Volunteers to help with both set-up and clean-up.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must Like Children Lots of noise ability to be gently firm
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 4:30pm until 8:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day- Children's Activity
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Does your group like to do things for children? For Make A DIffernece Day organize a fall party, play games, host a story time or do acitivties with the chidlrne living in Crossroads Hoemless Shelter.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9am to noon

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Volunteer Center of Erie County

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Health Fair Activity Helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Volunteer and Information Center and Auburn University Montgomery are sponsoring a Children's Health Fair Extravaganza on Oct. 25, from 9:30 to 11:30 a.m. at AUM. The fair is part of Make a Difference in the River Region and includes two hours of fun-filled activities led by the YMCA and AUM students with information about health, nutrition and physical fitness. Helpers are needed to help monitor the kids and activities, guide parents and children, and help throughout the fair.
Volunteers need to arrive between 8:15 a.m. and 8:30 at the front of AUM. In case of rain, the fair will be moved to the gym.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers must be at least 17 years old.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Fair is 9:30 - 11:30 a.m. Volunteers needed 8:30 to noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: General Disaster Volunteer - Information Session
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Learn how you can PREPARE today to SERVE Tomorow

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Volunteer Center Serving Howard County Disaster Program

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Winter Coat Drive - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Collect new or gently used clean coats for elementary and middle school students. Organize coats at volunteer center on community service day. Perfect opportunity for local business to organize coat drive within own organization culminating on Community Service Day.
Community Service Day 2008 Collection Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Coats can be collected by the business organization anytime up until the Oct. 25 deadline.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day Volunteers (Phase 2)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Volunteer Center of Southern Nevada in partnership with United Way of Southern Nevada and the City of North Las Vegas invite you to Phase 2 of our 2008 Make A Difference Day project. Phase 2 of this project will take place on Saturday, October 25, 2008 in North Las Vegas where volunteers will complete projects to revitalize the North Valley community. Volunteers and residents will get their hands dirty while finalizing the prep work and then painting houses, cleaning & painting storm washes, hanging new address numbers and more! All volunteers who pre-register will receive a Make A Difference Day tee shirt.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers MUST pre-register. Participants are encouraged to bring their own work gloves and are REQUIRED to wear closed toe shoes. All volunteers be over the age of 14. Volunteers aged 14-18 must provide a signed consent form and volunteer with a parent or guardian.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Check in begins at 730am. Following check in and announcements, volunteers will be assigned tasks. A barbeque will follow the completion & clean up of the projects.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Church Parking Lot Attendant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Monitor entry of cars to parking lot.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Assertiveness skills

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Pins/Pens Table
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist runners to attach their bibs (numbers) to the front of their shirt prior to the race.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8am - 10am

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Exit Door Greeter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Welcome runners and other members of the community. Direct runners to starting area.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8am - 10am

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Pre-Registration Check-In Table
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Check in runners who registered prior to the day of the event. Distribute runner packets.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8am - 10am

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Annual Dia Del Sol
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Dia del Sol is hosted at a different private property in Rancho Santa Fe each year, and consists of extensive silent and live auctions, gourmet luncheon, guest speaker and Fall fashion show.
Held annually in October, Dia del Sol has an attendance ranging between 300 and 400 people and raised a net record $302,500 for United Cerebral Palsy San Diego in 2007.
This year we will hold the event on October 15th at a beautiful equestrian property in Rancho Santa Fe. Volunteers are needed approximately 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.
We will need volunteers to help with food service; food prep; volunteer food; check-in/check out; beverage; valet parking and shuttle service.
Black bottom/white top/comfortable shoes
Looking forward to hearing from all of you wonderful volunteers.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: United Cerebral Palsy of San Diego County

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project Homeless Connect
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Project Homeless Connect provides the opportunity for volunteers, community leaders, and business organizations to join non-profits, faith-based groups, and social service providers in "connecting" their homeless counterparts to much needed services in a one-stop venue. Volunteers are needed in both professional and agency fields as well as individuals who are willing to act as escorts, helping the individuals navigate their way through the day - this is a great opportunity to make an impact by just being with someone.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Regional Task Force on the Homeless

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MS Bay to Bay Tour 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer for Land Rover Miramar Bike MS Bay to Bay Tour 2008 and support more than 2,000 cyclists as they pedal 30, 100 or 150 miles down the coast to find a cure for Multiple Sclerosis, a disease of the Central Nervous system with no known cause or cure. Choose from many exciting volunteer opportunities over the course of this exciting 2-day event on October 11-12, 2008. Many shifts and positions are currently available, from the start in Irvine, CA, along the course, and to the finish line in San Diego, CA. Raise community awareness for the cause by letting your friends and family know about the event, or volunteer as a group and make a difference now!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer for Land Rover Miramar Bike MS Bay to Bay Tour 2008 and support more than 2,000 cyclists as they pedal 30, 100 or 150 miles down the coast to find a cure for Multiple Sclerosis, a disease of the Central Nervous system with no known cause or cure. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer naturalist/docent training
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Are you interested in getting to know our coastal wetlands and sharing your knowledge with others? Come learn from the experts about the history, flora and fauna of the San Elijo lagoon. Training will also include interpretive skills, and offer practical tips in leading groups of students and adults. After completing the seven week docent program, you will join a dedicated group of Conservancy volunteers who share their knowledge of the lagoon with others and instill the importance of protecting the lagoon\0092s diverse and rare habitats through leading guided nature walks. All experience levels welcome.
Doug Gibson, SELC Executive Director and Principal Scientist, Barbara Moore, co-author of the book Walking San Diego, Denise Stillinger, Mira Costa Professor and Botanist, and Michael Klin

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Carmel Valley Homework Helpers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Homework Helper tutors always bring joy to the children\0092s day when they are given the help they need in order to succeed in school\0097come join us. The kids' education is our future!
Project details: Volunteers will help encourage, motivate, and inspire youth in the continuation of their education by assisting them with their homework. Subjects vary; students range from K-12. No previous tutoring experience necessary!
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 14 with adult, 15 without adult
Turn in a waiver form if you or your guest is below 18 years of age.
If you are signing up gues

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: San Diego Coast Cleaners (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join the fun and clean the beach! Help San Diego Coastkeeper and the Surfrider Foundation preserve one of San Diego\0092s greatest treasures...its coastline.
Their mission: San Diego Coastkeeper protects the region\0092s bays, beaches, watersheds and ocean for the people and wildlife that depend on them.
Project details: Volunteers will work outdoors maintaining the beauty of the beach by removing litter. All supplies are provided, and this project is fun for the whole family.
Project requirements:Join Flex
Turn in a waiver form if you or your guest is below 18 years of age.
Minimum age required: none

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: REI Annual "Get Dirty" Volunteer Project
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join the three San Diego County REI stores for our annual "Get Dirty" volunteer service project in Cuyamaca Rancho State Park.
Join us for the trail maintenance project on Saturday and stay after for a BBQ, optional overnight camping, campfires, and several exciting activities the following morning including orienteering, mountain biking and hiking! Please note that you must bring your own overnight gear, however, lunch and tools will be provided. Plus, all volunteers will receive a free "Get Dirty" REI t-shirt! (while supplies last)
**Registration is required!**
Please contact Customer Service at any San Diego REI for registration and additional information.
Don't miss this great volunteer opportunity and optional fun overnight camping trip!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Light the Night Against Crime 5K
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Race Volunteer
Assist with race set up and/or breakdown, registration, timing, pass out water, and work the finish line and start line, hand out t-shirts and goody bags.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Homeless Count Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteers are needed to help count homeless persons throughout the County and to administer brief surveys. The results are used to secure homeless funding and services.
Must have training before event...Please call for more information.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Many volunteers needed to act as Line Leaders and help lead 65 youth hockey teams during their Torch Lighting Ceremonies. This is a very fun event and many kids will be there.
Minimum age: 13, 11 with adult. Must be dependable and easy-going! Great for individuals or groups!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Homework Helper tutors always bring joy to the children\0092s day when they are given the help they need in order to succeed in school\0097come join us. The kids' education is our future!
Project details: Volunteers will help encourage, motivate, and inspire youth in the continuation of their education by assisting them with their homework and reading with children gently guiding them to develop their reading proficiency.Subjects vary; students range from K-12. No previous tutoring experience necessary!

Minimum age required: 14 with or without adult
Turn in a waiver form

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Location: 5530 SUNSET DR SOUTH MIAMI, FL 33143-5610 Directions:
Description: The Tropical Audubon Society is located in South Miami, on three acres of endangered pine Rockland and Rockland hammock habitats. Help preserve this historic land so it can become an environmental education center for everyone to enjoy.
Be sure to wear closed toed shoes and bring bug spray and a hat.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: California Winter Games Ice Hockey Tournament
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help sell California State Games Merchandise to raise money for the California State Games. Volunteer must be able to work with kids. Numerous shifts available. Locations at Kroc Center, Escondido, UTC, and San Diego Ice Arenas.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

Minimum age 16, 8 with adult.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Stella Nova Dance Company presents "Shine"
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Stella Nova Dance Company is looking for volunteers to assist with concessions in the lobby of the theatre and with our Silent Auction fundraiser on Saturday evening. Performances are Oct. 17 & 18 at 8:00 p.m. Saturday's Silent Auction beginns at 6:00, so volunteers would need to be at the venue no later than 7:30 on Friday and 5:30 on Saturday night. All volunteers receive complimentary admission to the performance.
Minimum age 14.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Beckwourth Homework Helpers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Spend the evening helping students succeed in school...and in life!
You'll be listening to school age students practice their reading skills and helping them to complete math, english and other homework assignments while providing much needed positive encouragement.
No previous tutoring experience necessary - you can help students with whichever subjects you're comfortable with!
Minimum age to volunteer with or without an adult: 16
If you are signing up guests or a team, please limit the size of your group to 3 volunteers.
Click here for homework helper tips.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Monster Manor
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Monster Manor is a non-profit charity haunted house. Each year we rebuild the attraction from the ground up. Volunteers are needed to help with construction of the haunted house. Come when you can and stay as long as you can.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Carlsbad Marathon
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Need to let out a little energy? Run or walk the Carlsbad Marathon or Half Marathon with Fresh Start! You'll be raising money and awareness for a good cause and having a blast at the same time...what could be better? And for those of you who do not wish to run, but would still like to participate, please consider volunteering with us!
Fresh Start Surgical Gifts transforms the lives of disadvantaged children and young people with physical deformities caused by birth defects, accidents, abuse, or disease through the gift of reconstructive surgery and related healthcare services.
To volunteer visit admin.volunteersandiego.org.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: WALK FOR LIFE 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
October 11, 2008 Saturday at Rohr Park, Chula Vista and St. Therese Church at Navaho & College from 8:00-10:30 am
October 12, 2008 Sunday at De Anza Cove Mission Bay Park from 1:00-4:00 pm
This walk gives everyone who believes in pro-life an opportunity to contribute to the \0093hands on\0094 work provided five days a week at our Centers helping pregnant women and mothers with small children. Birthline offers hope and support to over 150 women a month and saves babies from abortion. Birthline is a non profit organization supported by donations and run completely by volunteers. Birthline is a non-political organization and serves clients with compassion and complete confidentiality. Birthline receives no Federal funding. For more information call one of our offices
THE ONLY REQUIREMEN

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Temecula Turkey Trot
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need volunteers to help out before and after the race with set up/clean up, passing out waters, race timing, course spirit, t-shirt sales, etc! Breakfast, t-shirt, goody bags and free event entry to any future sun strides event will be provided to all volunteers. You will also be able to enjoy live music after the race!!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Habitat Restoration at the Tijuana Slough National Wildlife Refuge
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Get outside, give back, and have fun! Join us for a morning of weeding, watering, and planting at the Tijuana Estuary. Meet new people and learn new skills. Volunteers of all ages and abilities are welcomed and appreciated. No experience or special skills are necessary \0096 only a willingness to learn and get your hands dirty. All volunteers under 18 must bring signed permission forms, available by request, and volunteers under 16 must attend with an adult. Volunteers must work in long pants and boots or sturdy shoes and should wear sunscreen, sunglasses, and hats. We will provide work gloves and tools.
For more information or to sign up, please click on the "Have Agency Contact Me" button below.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Tijuana River National Estuarine Research Reserve

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need volunteers to help out before and after the race with set up/clean up, passing out waters, race timing, course spirit, t-shirt sales, etc! You will also be able to enter the pumpkin patch for free and participate in post race festivities...costumes encouraged!!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help hang banners and ready other items on stage

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Justice For Teens
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Teen Court is seeking volunteers to act as Bailiffs, Clerks, Jurors and Advocates. You MUST see the Teen Court Schedule and Description attached. Volunteers must sign in by 4:30PM. Attire must be appropriate for court. Shorts, halter tops, jogging attire, flip flops, sunglasses and hats are not allowed in the courtroom. All electronics including but not limited to cell phones, pagers, Ipods, and hand held games are not allowed in the courtroom.
After registration, you MUST contact: Michaela Blackman Teen Court Case Manager 954-831-1291 MBlackma@17th.flcourts.org
or
Maureen Hoefner 954-831-1291.
You must communicate with Maureen or Michaela before showing up for the volunteer opportunity.

Teen Court is seeking volunteers to act as Bailiffs, Clerks, Jurors and Advocates. You MUST see the Teen Court Schedule and Description attached. Volunteers must sign in by 4:30PM. Attire must be appropriate for court. Shorts, halter tops, jogging attire, flip flops, sunglasses and hats are not allowed in the courtroom. All electronics including but not limited to cell phones, pagers, Ipods, and hand held games are not allowed in the courtroom.
After registration, you MUST contact: Michaela Blackman Teen Court Case Manager 954-831-1291 MBlackma@17th.flcourts.org
or
Maureen Hoefner 954-831-1291.
You must communicate with Maureen or Michaela before showing up for the volunteer opportunity.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Justice For Teens
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Teen Court is seeking volunteers to act as Bailiffs, Clerks, Jurors and Advocates. You MUST see the Teen Court Schedule and Description attached. Volunteers must sign in by 4:30PM. Attire must be appropriate for court. Shorts, halter tops, jogging attire, flip flops, sunglasses and hats are not allowed in the courtroom. All electronics including but not limited to cell phones, pagers, Ipods, and hand held games are not allowed in the courtroom.

or
Maureen Hoefner 954-831-1291.
You must communicate with Maureen or Michaela before showing up for the volunteer opportunity.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Las Olas Wine and Food Festival
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Premier Beverage Company presents the Las Olas Wine and Food Festival being held on Saturday, May 2nd 2008. The festival takes place on Las Olas Boulevard, the most popular street in downtown Fort Lauderdale, known for its fabulous restaurants, trendy shops, and magnificent hotels. The exclusive VIP Reception (a sell out every year) will be held in the VIP Lounge on Las Olas Boulevard (located on 8th Ave.) There will be live music plus festival goers will enjoy signature culinary creations from more than 60 of South Florida\0092s most desirable dining destinations accompanied by 30+ wine tables on the boulevard courtesy of Premier Beverage. The \0093Honorary Chairman\0094 is Marc Buoniconti, Development Advisor for the International Bronchitis Center and Ambassador for the Miami Project to Cure Par

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Climb Miami
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come out and watch the Firefighters climb this 55 story building in full gear!
Climb Miami will be held on Saturday, April 18th 2009 at the Wachovia Financial Center in downtown Miami. Over 1,000 participants will take part in this vertical 55 story race, which is professionally timed and ranked with start times every 30 seconds. After the climb participants enjoy a Post Plaza Party where they receive free food and massages, as well as enjoy live entertainment.
Volunteer Tasks for Climb Miami
Registration Responsibilities: 1. Check in all participants in a timely fashion 2. Collect pledges from participants and hand into ALA Staff 3. Direct participants to the Bib table
Bib Table Responsibilities: 1.Check to make sure participants have paid, and are on the list 2.Once

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Ready or Not Hurricane Preparedness
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This Disaster Preparedness program shows you how you can prepare your home and your family for hurricanes. Topics covered include: Home Fitness, Personal/Family Preparedness, Money Matters and Preparation and Recovery tips.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Grapes for Grades
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
A Fundraiser - Wine & Food Tasting, Silent Auction for the Hollywood Florida Scholarship Foundation to be held October 17, 2008 at the Marriott Hollywood Beach, 2501 N. Ocean Drive, Hollywood 33020.
Volunteers are needed to assist with the set up and monitoring of the silent auction, and to assist vendors with set up/take down. Some lifting willl be required.
After registration you must contact: Pat Chukerman at 954-552-9996 or paperworks813@aol.com

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MTCB Empower Walk
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
EMPOWER = Encouragement, Motivation and Positive Outreach With Effective Results. Volunteers are needed to assist participants during this walk benefitting Middle Tennessee of the Blind. The walk will occur in Centennial Park.
This project is open to volunteers age 16 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Middle Tennessee Council of the Blind

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Teen Only - Helping Hands at LP Pencil Box
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
LP Pencil Box is a free school supply store for Metro Nashville Public Schools. It provides basic school supplies to teachers for their disadvantaged students.
As a volunteer, you will assist teachers in locating needed supplies, help sort donations, restock shelves, and assist in the general upkeep of the store. This project provides you with valuable work skills and experience!
This project is open to teen volunteers age 14 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: 2008 "Step Out: Walk to Fight Diabetes"
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Annual Fundraising Walk Event for the American Diabetes Association on Saturday, October 18, 2008 at BankAtlantic Center Sunrise. This is a signature fundraising event with a goal of $250,000 to be raised for diabetes research, education, and advocacy. Volunteers will receive t-shirts upon registration. Opportunities include handing out water at stations, event set up and break down; assisting in food and entertainment areas: site clean up, registration, and provide directions along route. There is no cost for parking and breakfast is provided.
After registering for this event you MUST contact:
Dawn Seay 954-772-8040 ext. 3053 954-649-5223 (cell) dseay@diabetes.org

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: PVAF Veterans Day Picnic
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Paralyzed Veterans Association of Florida needs 10 volunteers 16 and over to assist at their Veterans Day picnic honoring veterans that allows members to celebrate with their families. The picnic will be held November 8, 2008 from 10:00am - 6:00pm at Snyder Park Caldwell Pavilion, 3299 SW 4th Avenue, Ft. Lauderdale 33315.
Volunteer tasks will include phisically assisting members with disabilities, decorating, at the sign in table and clean up after the event.
After registration you must contact Nikki Baker at 954-565-8885 or pvaf@aol.com

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Paralyzed Veterans Association of Florida, Inc.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thousand Youth March for Humanity
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Humanity Project needs 100 volunteers age 25 and over to assist at it's Thousand Youth March for Humanity to be held November 16, 2008 at a time to be announced (but likey noon). This march of 1,000 or more school children of all ages will be held to make a clear public statement in support of the Broward School Board's new anti-bullying policy - and against bullying in the schools.
Event day tasks will be:Lining up of the students, walking with them during the march to help guide them and deal with any problems, providing water to the students(which will be provided) and, basically, just being there to help the kids in any way they may need. March location: Las Olas Blvd and SE 15th Ave - Broward to SE 15th Ave., south to Las Olas. Parking arrangements will be announced.
Afte

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Field of Food
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
One in six residents in Broward County is hungry tonight. They come from all walks of life. They are your neighbors. Your childrens friends. Your co-workers.
On Saturday, October 18, Volunteer Broward, in partnership with Broward County Schools and The Million Meals Committee presents the first annual Field of Food at Lockhart Stadium in Fort Lauderdale. Lockhart Stadium is located at 5201 NW 12th Ave in Fort Lauderdale, FL 33309
With the collection of one million pounds of food as our goal, this is the largest one-day food drive ever initiated in Broward County. Volunteers are needed to assist in making this event a success!
You can make a difference. Join us. Help us feed the hungry in Broward County and make history\0085of hunger.
The power of one feed

On Saturday, October 18, Volunteer Broward, in partnership with Broward County Schools and The Million Meals Committee presents the first annual Field of Food at Lockhart Stadium in Fort Lauderdale. Lockhart Stadium is located at 5201 NW 12th Ave in Fort Lauderdale, FL 33309
With the collection of one million pounds of food as our goal, this is the largest one-day food drive ever initiated in Broward County. Volunteers are needed to assist in making this event a success!
You can make a difference. Join us. Help us feed the hungry in Broward County and make history\0085of hunger.
The power of one feed
