VolunteerOpportunity.Title: 2008 Women Build
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Habitat for Humanity of Broward's Women Build promotes the involvement of women in the construction of safe, decent affordable homes in partnership with families in need. Hundreds of Broward County women have already built more than 40 homes and will build eight more homes this year.
So, get your hands dirty and join Habitat Broward as they continue to build a "legacy" of empowering families to break out of the cycle of poverty and restore their hope for a brighter tomorrow. All tasks are construction tasks and may require you to be on the roof. Up to 100 volunteers 16 and over are needed. Volunteers 16 or 17 require a parents signature. The next "Build" will be at 2300 SW 45 Street, Dania Beach 33312 over a period of 6 days as follows:
Day 1: Saturday, September 6, 2008 (Trussi

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Habitat for Humanity of Broward, Inc.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Miracle League Buddy
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Be a buddy during the game for a Miracle League player to ensure their safety and enjoyment. Plan on showing up at ballpark 15-20 minutes in advance of the game you register for in order to participate in the buddy orientation and in order to meet the Miracle League player you'll be buddying for.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need volunteers to remove broken storm windows and install new ones, also need to replace broken window panes, weather-strip and or caulk external doors/windows and repair rotting window frames on a couple of windows (kitchen/bedroom). Volunteers need to bring own tools and work gloves.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Snug-As-A-Bug (Solano)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need volunteers to install ceiling tiles in basement living area, replace broken window pane(s), install lock on sliding glass door, and mow lawn.

Volunteers are needed to help with Cedar Hill's Plant, Rain Barrel, Book & Baked Goods Sale! Many jobs are available--Set out plants, arrange books, sell baked goods, etc. 2 shifts are available, 9am-12:30pm & 12:30pm & 4pm. 6 volunteers are needed per shift. Minimum age is 16.
Cedar Hill is a beautiful and unique center for interfaith spirituality, ecology and earth education located in north Forsyth County. For more information about Cedar Hill, please see their website at www.discovercedarhill.org.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers, 14 and older, are needed to ensure the success of the Cumming Christmas Parade. VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers, 14 and older, are needed to ensure the success of the Cumming Christmas Parade. Catch the Christmas spirit on Saturday, December 1st as the City of Cumming, the Chamber of Commerce and the Community Connection once again host a Christmas Parade down Market Place Blvd. to welcome in the holiday season. VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need volunteers to do basic yard clean-up, Light mowing/weed-eating, weeding, light trimming and bagging of such debris.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need volunteers to assist in the Forsyth County Lions food booth during the 2008 Cumming Fall Fair & Festival at the Cumming Fairgrounds. Volunteers will be required to assist with food preparation, packaging and selling. Volunteers are not required to, but may, work the entire shift noted in the schedule.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: North County Elementary School
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age with an adult is 8 with an adult.
North County Elementary School's mission is Academic Excellence: Curriculum which challenges the intellect of each student to aquire knowledge, concepts, and skills necessary to become thinking, productive, and responsible citizens.
Revitalize this North Miami elementary school by painting murals and landscaping the exterior of the campus.
Location: 711 NW 207th Street Miami Gardens, Fl 33056
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Film Screening- Lioness
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
PLEASE NOTE: This is NOT a volunteer project. It is a film screening. You will get hours for attending.
ITVS and the INDEPENDENT LENS 2008-09 SEASON A Film Festival in your community!
How did five female Army support soldiers--mechanics, supply clerks and engineers--end up fighting alongside the Marines in some of the bloodiest counterinsurgency battles of the Iraq War? Directors Meg McLagan and Daria Sommers give an intimate look at war through the eyes of the first women in U.S. history sent into direct ground combat, despite a policy that bans them from doing so. Through harrowing personal stories, these women candidly share their experiences in Iraq as well from their lives back home to form a portrait of the emotional and psychological effects of war.
Film Coordinator: Judi

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Trailblazers at Hattie Bauer Hammock
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The minimum age for this project is 8 years old with an adult. Hurricanes destroyed the hiking trails at the former Orchid Gardens. Volunteers will clear the overgrown trails so the park can be enjoyed again. Exotic plants also will be removed. VOLUNTEERS MUST WEAR LONG PANTS AND CLOSED TOED SHOES! Bring a hat, bug spray, and sunscreen. Location: 26815 SW 157th Ave. Homestead, FL 33031 Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15-9:00)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HOM Volunteer Leader Training (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Would you like to be a part of HOM\0092s leadership team? Then become a Volunteer Leader (VL)! VLs are an important part of Hands On Miami\0092s Flexible Program, helping to organize and lead volunteers at each project. Without VLs, all the wonderful things that Hands On Miami does would not be possible. Being a VL is a great way to meet new people, gain new experiences, and discover your potential, as you make a difference in the lives of those we serve.
Hands On Miami is looking for a few good Volunteer Leaders (actually more than a few!). Every time you see \0093Volunteer Leader Still Needed\0094 in the newsletter, this is a project that may not be able to take place. We need you to step up and fill this role! Being a VL is a great resume-builder and allows you to develop leadership, organizational

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Minimum age for this project is 8 with an adult. Take a boat to the uninhabited islands located in Biscayne Bay, just off the coast of Coconut Grove. While there, volunteers will collect trash that otherwise would pollute Biscayne Bay.
Location: 2620 S Bayshore Dr Miami, FL 33133
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Vizcaya Museum and Gardens
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

Volunteers will help the recovery by removing exotic species and trash in Vizcaya's mangrove forest and estuaries. Vines that are choking Vizcaya's Hammock Forest also will be removed to promote regeneration of the forest community.
Location: Vizcaya Museum and Gardens 3251 S Miami Ave Miami, FL 33129
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)
In addition to breakfast volunteers will also receive a free yoga instruction by Ganesha Michael Shapiro from 8:00-8:30! He is a certified Kundalini Yoga and Meditation Instructor. His classes and full/new m

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sandor Weiner School of Opportunity
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 10 years old with an adult. The mission of Sandor Wiener School of Opportunity is to serve children who exhibit severe developmental delays and medical issues. It's purpose is to provide them with individualized and intensive classroom learning experiences combined with a full complement of therapeutic interventions and environmental access to technology. Volunteers will help renovate the school grounds painting murals and landscaping the school's grounds.
http://www.sandorwienerschool.org/
Location: 11025 SW 84 St Cottages: 5, 6, & 7 Miami, FL 33173
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am) All volunteers please meet at Cottage #5.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
THIS IS A YOUTH VOLUNTEER CORPS SITE ONLY!!! The age limit for this project is 12-18. Help revitalize an art in public places installation; fins from nuclear subs that have been converted into art. Also remove debris from the 79th Street Causeway coastline, landscape a native plant garden, and remove harmful exotic plants. *Youth under 18 MUST download the "Minor Waiver Form" from the main HOM Day webpage. You must bring the form completed with a parent/guardian signature to your project on Nov. 8th.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 12 with an adult. Touching Miami with Love provides help for families with broken homes in the Overtown area by providing hope, opportunities and support. Do your part to improve the facility by painting a mural and beautifying the facility.
http://www.touchingmiamiwithlove.org/
Location: 711 NW 6th Avenue Miami,FL 33136
Saturday, November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am \0096 12:30pm Volunteers please meet in the parking lot.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: History in the Making @ VA Key Trust
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 12 with an adult. Make history come alive! The Historic Virginia Key Beach Park was once the official beach and park for African Americans. It was closed in 1982, but in 1999, volunteers began work to reopen the park as a memorial to its role in Miami's history. The park reopened in 2008. Help preserve a piece of history by cleaning the hammocks and shoreline and planting some native trees in the area.
*PLEASE NOTE* 1. Dress (weather) appropriate (this project is outdoors and you will get dirty). WEAR LONG PANTS!! 2. Wear closed-toe shoes. 3. Bring sunscreen and mosquito repellent. 4. Bring a hat. Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am) Location: 3861 Rickenbacker Causeway Miami,

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Virginia Beach
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 12 years old with an adult. Volunteers will assist the staff of Virginia Key with transplanting native trees and removing exotic plants as they are currently involved in the restoration and preservation of the 15 acre Hammock area located on Virginia Key. This has involved the removal of invasive exotic vegetation and restoring native plants to the area.
*PLEASE NOTE* 1. Dress (weather) appropriate (this project is outdoors and you will get dirty). 2. Wear closed-toe shoes. 3. Bring sunscreen and mosquitoes repellent. 4. Bring a hat. 5. Bring a refillable water bottle (we will provide the water) Location: 3701 Rickenbacker Causeway Key Biscayne , FL 33149 Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (8:15-9 is registration and breakfast)

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Virginia Key Beach Park (City of Miami)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Hobie Beach Clean-Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 8 years old with an adult. It is estimated that 100,000 marine mammals and turtles are killed each year by plastic, cigarette butts and straws that are washed into the Bay and ocean. Be part of the solution by removing debris that would otherwise float into the Biscayne Bay and could endanger the lives of the sea life that live there.
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (8:15am-9:00am is registration and breakfast) Location: 4299 Rickenbacker Causeway Key Biscayne, FL 33149
*PLEASE NOTE* 1. Dress (weather) appropriate (this project is outdoors and you will get dirty). 2. Wear closed-toe shoes. 3. Bring sunscreen and mosquito repellent. 4. Bring a hat.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Crandon Park Beach Clean-Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The minimum age for this project is 6 with an adult. Clean up trash and litter on the shores of Crandon Beach and the Biscayne Nature Center. Additional work is needed to spread mulch and plant native plants within the area.
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (8:15-9:00 is registration & breakfast) Location: 6767 Crandon Blvd. Miami, FL 33149
*PLEASE NOTE* 1. Dress (weather) appropriate (this project is outdoors and you will get dirty) 2. Wear closed-toe shoes. 3. Bring sunscreen and mosquitoes repellent. 4. Bring a hat.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Crandon Park and Biscayne Nature Center

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Roots in the City
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Minimum Age: 10 with an adult The Roots in the City garden was started in 1998 to help transform the depressed urban landscape into a community of gardens, blooming flowers and shady trees. Over the years, Roots in the City has planted vegetable gardens that the local residents may freely use with the goal of providing its residents of Overtown with a more enjoyable place to live. Hands On Miami volunteers will play a vital role in maintaining and adding to the garden and this amazing project.
Address: Overtown Vegetable Garden NW 3rd Ave. and 14th Street
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Miami River Restoration
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

Together we will be planting over 300 plants and painting to help beautify this area. Address: 114 SW North River Drive
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

Florida Baptist Homes provides safe, stable homes for boys and girls who have been neglected, misdirected, abandoned, abused or caught up in family turmoil. Volunteers will make the facility feel more homey by landscaping the area around the fence that surrounds the grounds.
Location: Florida Baptist Children's Homes 7748 SW 95 Terrace. Miami, Florida 33156.
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

Location: 7275 SW 124 Street Pinecrest, FL 33156

Directions: Take US 1 to SW 124 Street in Pinecrest. Turn east and continue until you reach the facility.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Haulover Beach Clean Up

Location: 10801 Collins Ave Miami, FL. 33154
Date: November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15am-9:00am)

Saturday, November 8th, 2008 Time: 8:15am - 12:30pm (breakfast and registration is from 8:15-9:00)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Historic Virginia Key Beach Park Trust Renovation (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help maintain the historic Virginia Key Park by helping them clean their Mangrove Wetland, a newly discovered 55-acre wetland full of red mangroves, black mangroves, and migratory birds. Volunteers will clean the urban debris from this area, which can destroy the Wetland. Family-Friendly: minimum ages with an adult is 10. (12-15 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Iron Fork Prep Shift
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: First shift: Volunteers will assist with the preparation of the event by setting up tables, event loistics, etc

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: The House That Marjory Built (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed to help care for the lawn at the historic Marjory Stoneman Douglas cottage in Coconut Grove. Ms. Douglas built the cottage in 1926 and she lived there for seventy years. The outside area of the cottage, which is now a designated historic monument and managed by the Land Trust, is in need of some upkeep. Family-Friendly: minimum age with an adult is 7.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Tree Planting at the Bufferlands
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This isn\0092t your everyday planting! Volunteers for this day will have the opportunity to participate in many different activities. We will be planting 50 acorns, native shrubs and grasses, and 150 small trees. Bring your cameras and binoculars as the Bufferlands are a great place to see migrating birds and other interesting wildlife.

This event is in conjunction with the 36th Annual Environmentalists of the Year Awards.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Binational Health Week
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Binational Health Week events provide immigrant workers and their families with medical screenings, healthcare referrals, treatment services, and information about disease prevention. Come and help us in handing out nutrition information, conducting food demonstrations and physical activities (hula-hoop, jump roping and playing out-door games) to these low-income families.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Binational Health Week events provide immigrant workers and their families with medical screenings, healthcare referrals, treatment services, and information about disease prevention. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Build It! Habitat Houses 2009
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
BUILD HOMES FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES. Volunteers are needed to help Habitat for Humanity build homes for families in Sacramento County. Tasks range from clean-up, painting, landscaping, framing, digging, and installing doors and windows - and other miscellaneous duties. If you are the person who doesn't mind doing a variety of tasks with a cheerful attitude - WE WANT YOUR HELP!
You do not need tools or construction experience to volunteer although any construction knowledge is welcome!
The address shown on this project is not the construction site. We don\0092t receive the project location address until about 3 days before the project date. All project locations are within the Sacramento County. You will receive an email with the project location.
Wear old clothes th

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Acoustic musician
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Need acoustic (non-amplified) musicians to play at the weekly Urban Farm Stand events. This fun weekly event is part of a food access project to bring convenient access to healthy locally grown fruits and vegetables to low income and underserved communities. We are looking for performers to help make the events more lively and fun for participants. If you play an acoustic instrument or have other performance skills (juggling, clown, etc.) and would like to share those talents, this is the project for you. You can commit for just one time, or multiple weeks. Play for a short while or the entire time. It's up to you.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Arden Tree Day
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This event is one of dozens of re-greening efforts throughout the county with the Sacramento Tree Foundation\0092s NeighborWoods Program. We\0092ll be out in the community working side by side to not only create shade for this neighborhood, but build community unity! This is a great event for families and small children. Lunch will be provided. We need lots of motivated volunteers to make this planting a success so sign up now!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Un-Decorating
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Please help us come take down Christmas at the Ronald McDonald House. We decorate 5 buildings and put up 7 trees.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project Birthday
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help brighten the lives of the less fortunate by providing full birthday parties for homeless children! If you love working with kids, this creative project proves exciting and rewarding.
Join us at one of our monthly parties, currently being held at St. John's Shelter for Women & Children, Family Promise and the Women's Overcomers Shelter at Calvary Christian Center.
Space is limited and this project fills up quickly so sign up soon to reserve your spot!
Minimum Volunteer Age: 6
Volunteers under 18 years old MUST submit a youth waiver prior to attending the project. In addition, children 13 years old or younger must be accompanied by their parents in order to participate.
We also provide birthday party kits at Volunteers of America and My Sister's House. I

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Haunted Hayride Tractor Driver
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Nashville Zoo at Grassmere is seeking volunteers to help make Ghouls at Grassmere the most exciting place to be this Halloween. A not-so-scary event, guests enjoy treat stations, games, mazes, tactile rooms, and other activities in a safe, family-friendly environment.
The Haunted Hayride is one of the most popular activities during Ghouls at Grassmere with as many as six tractors running the route at one time. A Bog Monster, Witches Shack, Toxic Trailer, Ghost Town and more come to life on this hair-raising hayride route! Volunteers drive the success of this attraction, and we need you to get on board!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Light the Night is the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's annual fundraising walk. Volunteers are needed to assist with all aspects of the walk including registration, kids activities, food area, and decorating.

Sales from the Thriftsmart store supports other nonprofits including Mercy's Children's Clinic, The Belize Project, African Leadership, and New Hope Academy.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Candlelight Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Event Description: The Heritage Society's 46th Annual Candlelight Tour showcases eight of Houston's oldest historic structures trimmed to perfection in traditional 19th century d\00E9cor. The flicker of candles carefully set out specifically for the event illuminates Sam Houston Park. As visitors tour the park, they will find that each of the structures offers a different variety of family-friendly entertainment including everything from storytellers to local children's choirs. Additionally, The Heritage Society Museum will feature What\0092s Cookin\0092? Two Centuries of American Foodways exhibit in the museum gallery exploring different cultures through the food they eat. Children may also visit with Santa, play in the snow, enjoy a holiday story reading, and make crafts at Santa's Workshop.
Vol
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Minimum age for volunteer: 14, 18 to be in VIP room
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 6:30-9:30pm, volunteers arrive for check in at 6:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help Transform Farm for Harvest Festival - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Menare Foundation will host volunteers for the annual Community Service Day Project at our headquarters at The Button Farm Living History Center in Germantown on Saturday October 25, from 10am to 4pm. Volunteers will be put to work helping us transform our farm for our annual Harvest Festival which will be held the following day October 26. Volunteers are needed either of both days.
Volunteers will do gardening, landscaping and brush clearing work; set up signage, tables and stations for our exhibitors; and help set up historical displays. Other tasks will include painting, planting and small construction projects most of an historical nature, which will help us depict an 1850s Maryland plantation environment. Work is suited for 4th graders through adults. Youth 16 and under must be
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 10am-1pm or 1-4pm. Volunteers for Saturday may work the entire day or either shift.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fall Tournament Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Athletes from all over Wyoming will be traveling to Casper to compete in bowling, cycling, equestrian and soccer at various venues around Casper.
Special Olympics Wyoming is in need of volunteers who are interested in helping with registration, timing events, keeping score, hosting the hospitality area and various other duties. Anyone willing to volunteer some of their time on October 15th, 16th or 17th is encouraged to contact the Special Olympics Wyoming office at 235-3062 to sign up for a shift.
Special Olympics Wyoming is a not-for-profit organization providing year-round sports training and competition in a variety of Olympics-type sports for children and adults with intellectual disabilities.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Choose a shift that works for your schedule

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Office Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

STATUS: VOLUNTEER

HOURS: 4 HOURS PER WEEK (SHORT TERM)
SUMMARY OF DUTIES:
Provide clerical support to the Office Manager by assisting with new filing system for board documents. Volunteer is needed during business hours but can arrange hours to fit own schedule.

SKILL AND EXPERIENCE PREREQUISITES:
\0095 Experience in clerical/administrative environment. \0095 Good computer skills with Microsoft office applications. \0095 Experience using a photocopier/scanner and shredding machine

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Montview Elementary Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Businesses, organizations and individuals sponsor Montview Elementary School for JA-in-a-Day. Volunteers present JA's elementary school programs to students grades K-6 in one school day.
The students get the same benefit of the traditional program all in one day! Should you want to consider doing service and saving on fuel mileage...this is the opportunity for you!
The kids are great and the staff is very supportive!!!
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: One time training. In person or on-line!!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 6:30 to 2:30. THis event psans the school day.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Community Shelter Make A Difference Day Projects
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Support the services of New Community Shelter, a temporary shelter for men and women, by planning a special recreational activity, preparing an evening meal for the residents, or doing fix up projects (plumbing, carpentry, painting, yard work) at the 301 Mather Street building. Contact Janet VanDreel at 437-3766 or at janetv@newcommunityshelter.org to discuss how you can help.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Receptionist
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need a smiling face to greet our visitors and answer our phones. This would be an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys working with people. We are willing to work with the person's available hours. We would primarily need someone from 9am-noon or 2-5pm, Monday through Thursday.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We would primarily need a volunteer 9am-noon or 2-5pm, Monday through Thursday.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Food/Toiletries Collection for Bethesda House - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Collect breakfast cereal and basic condiments (sugar, ketchup, etc.) and/or collection of basic toiletries (soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc.) At Bethesda House, homeless men with mental health problems find the resources they need to help them participate in the process of creating paths that lead to self reliance and stability.
Set up a collection at your school, workplace or church. You can drop off your collection on Community Service Day weekend, or any time.
Community Service Day 2008 Collection Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Anytime

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Spanish Speaking volunteer needed!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Community Services Agency has been serving the community for over 50 years. Every year we have a Holiday Sharing Program, where we make the holidays a little brighter for those in need. Please come and help us to register clients to receive for toys for their children through our annual Holiday Toy Distribution Program. FLUENT in English and Spanish required .
Shifts are:
Monday Dec. 1 st 5:00pm-8:30pm
Tuesday Dec. 2 nd 5:00pm-8:30pm
Wednesday Dec. 3 rd 5:00pm-8:30pm
Walk-in Reg. Thursday Dec. 4 th 9:00am-11:30am OR 1:30pm-3:30pm
For more information please contact Alison Hopkins ahopkins@csacares.org www.csacares.org
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Minimum age 16 Bi-lingual required (Spanish/English Speaking)
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Monday-Wednesday 5:00pm-8:30pm Thursday 9am-11:30am OR 1:30-3:30pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Parents Night Out Helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We host several evenings a year where Parents can go out and have a good time and leave the children with us! We usually host around 60-70 children per time. We break them into groups based on age. We need 5-6 chaperones per age group. You will help them through the night by chaperoning them. They see a movie, have dinner, eat a snack, attend an educational class and end the evening with games.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: None
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: This event runs from 6-10. We need volunteers who can work this time period completely so they can stay with their one group the whole time.

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments:
This years festival is scheduled to run from 12:00 PM to 5:00 PM. Volunteers are currently needed for all festival positions and activities. Set-up will begin at approximately 10:30 AM, and we are requesting that all volunteers arrive no later than 11:30 AM, if possible. Clean-up should be completed before 5:30 PM. Any and all assistance is welcomed and appreciated!
If you would be interested in volunteering at the museum for this fun-filled event, please reply to this message with your intentions before Sunday, October 12, 2008. And if you know anyone else who may be interested in volunteering for this or future museum events, please pass this message along to them with our appreciation.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Little Paint Branch Park and Cherry Hill Road Community Park, Beltsville. Meet at the Beltsville Community Center parking lot. There are full indoor toilet facilities and a large seating area for lunch. We will continue the wonderful progress accomplished the last three years by the Americorps workers, General Electric Volunteers, Robert Goddard French Immersion and Montesori Elementary School, Washington Quaker Work Camps, and World Bank volunteers at Little Paint Branch Community Park.
Our day will include natural history and special features of the park, methods and reasons for the project to control the spread of invasives. Native flowers and other plants will be identified as we work to rescue them. There will be a sign-in and safety orientation with handouts. Gloves and tools a

set up and breakdown referee soccer games (ages 8-14) lead activities in arts and craft booths (art skills are not required) lead relay races paint faces (art skills are not required)

Again, we take groups up to 25 people and the event is weather permitting as the activities will take place in the fields. The Group Coordinator would need to fill out the Group Volunteer Application for the group which they can access from our website at www.redwiggler.org \0096 there is also the Group Volunteer Description Page and Tips for Volunteers.

Road to Recovery is a volunteer-based program in which volunteers are trained and provide rides for cancer patients to and from their treatments.
We are looking to pilot our new program in Longmont, Colorado within the next few months, and need an intern who can help us market and implement this program.
Any students or recent college graduates interested in or with backgrounds in marketing, public relations, sales, or non-profit organizations would be a great fit for this position.
This position will involve: -Making cold calls to local businesses explaining the program -Making presentations to local businesses -Coordinating the p

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We have a need for volunteers to help with our Spooktacular Science days a Sci-Quest. We will give specific activities for each booth to carry out.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Sci-Quest, the North Alabama Science Center

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Make A Difference Day is a national day of service focused on helping others -- a celebration of neighbors helping neighbors. People from all over the United States come together on this day to make a difference in their communities. Everyone can participate. Created by USA WEEKEND Magazine, Make A Difference Day is an annual event that takes place on the fourth Saturday of every October.
This year Make A Difference Day will be on Saturday, October 25th. Meet at Dupre Elementary for a kick-off rally at 9:30am to enjoy coffee and donuts. From there volunteers can choose which project they would like to participate in.
Volunteer opportunities include:
Dupre Elementary School: Volunteers will be planting flowers around the school marquee as well as other campus clean-up and beautif
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments:
Kick-off Rally begins at 9:30am on the front lawn of Dupre Elementary located at 2008 Avenue T. Coffee and donuts will be provided. (We will meet in the gym if it rains.)
Volunteer opportunities are available from 10:00am to 12:00pm and 1:00pm to 3:00pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Invasive Species Removal
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Gardeners or anyone looking for some outdoor activity can help remove invasive species, like buckthorn and honeysuckle, from the Green Bay Botanical Garden to make the gardens look their best. If you would like to offer your assistance, contact Gretchen Lane at 491-3691 x 113 or at glane@gbbg.org.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Zoo Boo
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Zoo Boo is an enchanting evening of fun. Costumed volunteers are needed to hand out candy at Treat Stations scattered throughout the zoo. Help with the Haunted Hayride, hand out food to volunteers or collect tickets. Help is also needed setting up decorations. Volunteers should come dressed in costume. Any costume will do, scary or not!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 4:30 - 8:30 pm Hayride volunteers - no later than 9:00 pm. Friday and Saturday, October 10 & 11, 17 & 18, 24 & 25.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Terror on the Fox Haunted House
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come help to raise money for area youth by being part of this spooky Green Bay tradition! Ticket Takers are needed to validate admission tickets, and actors will be made up in make-up and costumes to spook the guests in the Haunted House. Instructions will be given to the actors.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments:
Actors - 5:30 pm to Midnight Ticket Takers - 6:30 pm to Midnight
October 3, 4, 10, 11, 16 thru 31.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Health Fair
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Community Health Fair is held at the Door County YMCA Program Center in Sturgeon Bay and organized by the Door County YMCA and the Parish Nurses Network of Door County. The health fair is free and open to the entire community with information for all ages to learn more about staying healthy and ways to take care of any current health needs. Local businesses will be on hand to share health-related information and offer interactive free health screenings.

Please help monitor games and have fun with the children of Toberman Neighborhood Center.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Children\0092s Book Drive for the Montgomery County Family Justice Center - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Montgomery County Commission for Women will be collecting children\0092s books in honor of the county\0092s 22nd Annual Community Service Day. Books will be used for the establishment of a children\0092s library at the Montgomery County Family Justice Center set to open early in 2009. The Center will serve as a "one-stop shop" for victims of family violence and their children, where critical services will be co-located.
Members of the community may donate NEW children\0092s books at the Commission for Women office located at 401 N. Washington Street, Suite 100 in Rockville. Donations may be left at the front desk during regular business hours. The Commission for Women is open Monday, Thursday and Friday 9 am \0096 5 pm and Tuesday and Wednesday 9 am \0096 9 pm. Only NEW books will be accepted for don
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Books can be donated during regular business hours. The Commission for Women is open Monday, Thursday and Friday 9 am \0096 5 pm and Tuesday and Wednesday 9 am \0096 9 pm.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Commission for Women, Counseling and Career Center (Approved SSL MCPS)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: American Red Cross: Make A Difference Day 2008: Office Prep and Paint: FULL
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
THIS OPPORTUNITY IS FULL. No more spaces are available; please consider some of our other projects. We'd love your help.
Help the Mt. Baker Chapter of American Red Cross improve their facility. Volunteers are needed to prepare and paint an office at the Mt. Baker Red Cross headquarters.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Mt. Baker American Red Cross.
The American Red Cross helps prepare communities for emergencies and keep people safe every day through awareness, prevention, and response programs.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Please wear clothing suitable for painting.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The painting project will run from 9 am to 1 pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: z (Project Filled) Farm Maintenance - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
At Great and Small Therapeutic Riding we need some minor repairs, light carpentry work, and general maintenance to complete on the farm prior to winter setting in.
The highest priority project is rehanging the wooden shed windows on the horse run in sheds in the fields. The windows are more like small wooden doors that are opened to feed the horses. We also need a tape fence run across one of the pastures.
We will supply any necessary tools and supplies for the projects.
The additional work would involve minor repairs and general clean up before winter.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: AASHE 2008 Conference on Sustainability - Event Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteers are needed for AASHE 2008, a large environmental sustainability conference at the Raleigh Convention Center taking place from November 9 - 11. This year's conference theme is "Working Together for Sustainability - On Campus and Beyond" and volunteers are needed to help bring that vision to reality! Volunteers are needed for a variety of tasks from conference set-up to guest registration - free access to the rest of the conference and food are just some of the perks for volunteer participants.
Volunteers will play an essential role in customer service, greening efforts, and ease of operations at the Conference & Expo.
Example volunteer positions include:
* Conference set-up * Coat and baggage check * Green Team (waste diversion efforts) * Registration
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Two 6-hour shifts over the course of the conference (November 9 - 11).
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Conference takes place Sunday, November 9 through Tuesday, November 11 with shifts throughout the days. Volunteers gain free access to the remainder of the conference, which includes an eco-job fair.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This project is to enlarge Crossway Community's beautiful Children's and Community Gardens by constructing 4 or 5 new raised bed frames, tilling the necessary ground, filling with soil, and framing with planks of wood (3\0092 by 10\0092). These garden beds are used to grow vegetables and flowers, used by the women at the transitional home, for communal meals and activities. A team of volunteers from Montgomery County\0092s Dept of Environmental Protection is committed to this project and will also install 3 Rain Barrels to manage water on the site economically.
We need a sponsor to help make this project a reality! Two options for sponsorship:
- Your group could donate supplies for the work that our team from DEP is doing; about $200 for fencing materials for expanding the fence around the comm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Clean Up at Broad Acres Park - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come meet your neighbors and get involved as you help us clean up Broad Acres Park and park land surrounding Northwest Park Apartments and Forest Park Apartments.
The Northwest Park Oakview Weed & Seed Program, the State\0092s Attorney\0092s Office of Montgomery County, partnering organizations and local residents, will be gathering together to celebrate Community Service Day.
Broad Acres Park is currently under renovation and we need volunteers to help clean up the surrounding areas in preparation for its completion in the Spring. Please join us as we gather to launch a new Weed & Seed Initiative called \0093FRIENDS OF BROAD ACRES PARK\0094.
This is a rain or shine event! Volunteers should dress to get dirty. Plan to wear long pants, boots and gloves.

We\0092ll celebrate with traditional music and dance, vibrant art activities and authentic Mexican food. Hands On Miami will email a sheet to you which you have to put on your dashboard. Parking regulations will not be enforced from 8AM until 1PM, if you have the sheet in your car. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Keeping Up Parks & Nature Areas
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Sacramento is gifted with many parks and nature areas that provide us a refuge. Parks are an integral part of the cultural identity of The City of Sacramento and remain one of the few places where families, residents, and visitors can go to relax, reflect, and recreate with no entrance fees or other costs.
Keeping up our beautiful parks, trails, and nature areas is not possible without the help of dedicated volunteers like you. Show that you care and be a responsible citizen of Sacramento by helping to preserve, protect, and beautify parks, facilities, natural areas, bike, pedestrian and equestrian trails for present and future generations.
Between March and November, volunteers will have a chance to participate in tasks such as removing invasive plants and cleaning various park

SDG&E is one of 2-1-1 San Diego\0092s partners and they would like to conduct a survey with 1,100 of their medical baseline customers in back country areas that could be affected by SDG&E\0092s power shut-off program. They want to be prepared for neighborhood power outages and disaster related issues by utilizing 2-1-1 as a place for San Diegans to get updated information; as well, 2-1-1 can voice caller concerns to SDG&E. These are not \0093telemarketing\0094 or \0093sales\0094 calls! This is our opportunity to advocate for our clients.

Your final step would be making sure all necessary documentation/paperwork was updated and provided to the refugee family, and the child\0092s public school.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Children's Grief Center of NM Volunteer Training 10/18 & 10/25/08
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Children\0092s Grief Center of New Mexico provides free grief support for children ages 5 \0096 18 and their caregivers, as well as young adults age 19-25 years, who are grieving the death of a loved one. Groups are facilitated by dedicated, compassionate volunteers. Our next training is October 18th & 25th, from 8:30am \0096 5:00pm on both days. Lunch will be provided. Volunteers must pass a criminal background check, complete the training, and commit to one year of service. The training is accredited with 13 CEUs for psychologists, counselors, and social workers. The cost is $45.00 for volunteers and $175.00 for all others. Please call Carmen at 323-0478 or email her at carmen.land@childrensgrief.org to register. For more information, please check us out on the web at: www.childrensgrief.org.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Training will be from 8:30am - 5pm on October 18th & October 25, 2008. Both training sessions must be attended in order to receive full credit. Deadline for registration is October 15, 2008.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Presidential General Election - Ballot Inspection
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Job Description: Sitting Position
Open the BALLOT CARTON, and check the contents, which should be: Voted paper ballots, voted ballots with Write-ins. Remove the rubber banded ballots with Write-Ins voted and place in a box designated. Fan the deck of voted ballots checking the front and backs for any Write-In votes. Secure Write-in ballots with a rubber band and place them in a designated box. While fanning the ballots check for any that has Damaged or \0093Spoiled\0094 written on them or the word MAIL in red printing at the top of a ballot. Anything else in the ballot box is extraneous material that will be removed, a Sequence number written on each piece and placed in the extraneous material box. Close the Ballot Carton securely containing only the voted ballots and put out for the

SponsoringOrganization.Name: County of San Diego Registrar of Voters

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Presidential General Election - Ballot Runners
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Job Description: Standing and running Position
Once ballots are cleared from the ballot inspection area they need to be transported to the memory card match area. These positions are designated as \0093cross country runners\0094 you will be on your feet the entire night moving boxes of ballots using rolling carts to the memory card match area about 100 feet round trip. You and 5 others will move about 1697 ballot cartons over a period of 3 hours. You should be in excellent health to do this job.
This volunteer position starts November 4 at 8:00 PM and ends November 5 at 3:00 AM.
Training will be provided at start time 8:00 PM until 9:00 PM.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: County of San Diego Registrar of Voters

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Poverty Simulation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Dear Community Member,
According to the U.S. Census Bureau, 37.3 million Americans, including 18 million children under the age of 18, live in poverty every day. In PD16 (which includes the counties of Caroline, King George, Spotsylvania, and Stafford and the City of Fredericksburg), it is reported that over 18,000 of residents live in poverty. Many more have incomes above the poverty line, but their incomes are still low enough to qualify for programs like Food Stamps and Medicaid. The recent economic downturn has seen unemployment rates rise and the use of emergency food pantries increase.
The Stafford County Office of Virginia Cooperative Extension would like to invite you to serve as a volunteer on November 7, 2008 for the Community Action Poverty Simulation. This FREE simulati

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bikes for the World Afternoon Shift - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help load a container of approximately 450 used bicycles, plus valuable bike parts, destined for Africa or Central America. Bikes are essential for getting to work, and delivering health and education services in rural communities. Loading the container will involve rolling the bikes out of the barn into the container, packing the bikes into the container, carrying boxes of parts, and doing some minor work to compact some of the bikes including lowering seats, turning handlebars, etc.
Wear clothes that can get dirty. Closed shoes, no sandals. Bring work gloves if you have them. We'll supply cold drinks and light snacks. this is a "rain or shine" event. The exposure to the elements is minimal, but participants should come prepared for cool and/or wet weather.
Entrance to locati
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: There will be two shifts for this project - this is the AFTERNOON SHIFT : 1 pm -5 pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Senior Women Build
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This unique project offers women age 50 and over to come and learn about construction and landscaping while helping a family obtain safe, decent, affordable housing. The concept, created by Habitat for Humanity in Mobile County\0092s CEO, Brenda Carson Lawless, is simple. \0093We want 100 Senior women to build 1 home in 100 days,\0094 Lawless said. \0093It\0092s a great opportunity for us Senior women to show we can do big things together!\0094 The build will begin with a special kickoff weekend on November 20-22, during which the women will frame the entire house. About 50 volunteers will be needed on that day, and 20 every week day and Saturday following the initial build weekend. You must sign up for a day in order to participate, so do it now! VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

We need adult volunteers to help with this project on Community Service Day: Trimming the low hanging and broken branches on the trees on the Sanctuary grounds. Pressure washing and painting a large outside dog kennel. Putting up fence extensions on our wooden fence - have to drill holes and screw extensions onto the fence then add the wire. Scraping off flaking paint and painting trim around two Sanctuary entrance doors.
We will provide all the tools and materials needed ... except we need our volunteer team to bring a hand saw or other tools for the tree trimming. And we have a power-washer but we would love to have a volunteer bring the expertise on how to use i
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: I would like to start at 10am for donuts and coffee and a review of the projects that have to be done, then get started at 10:30am until done - likely 4 or 5 hours I would think.

Project Northstar is a non-profit organization whose fundamental mission is to help children who are homeless or disadvantaged overcome barriers to a quality education. Partnering with parents, educators, donors and diverse volunteers, we provide one-on-one tutoring, mentoring and enriching activities to students in grades 1-12 to help pave the way to success in school and life. We strive to be a beacon - a north star - by which children can find their way to a better, brighter future.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Yacht Sitter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
**TEST ONLY** Need qualified volunteer to yacht sit for 2 months in the Caymen Islands. Volunteer may utilize the on board helicopter to visit the nearby island towns for local food and nightlife. Pilot is included so no flying experience necessary. Food and drink available on board. May bring several guests with them to keep them company for the duration of the yacht sitting.
Private jet will provide transportation from local airport to Caymen Islands. No experience necessary. Bring swimsuit and tropical clothing as temperatures range between 70-90 degrees.
Successful volunteer assignment will enter into volunteer pool for other house sitting locations in Paris, London, and Vienna.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be easy going and willing to spend money

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Restore Native Plants at Bald Mountain Scenic Area
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Restore Native Plants at Bald Mountain Scenic Area on October 18 (Free Lunch!) Boulder County forestry staff has worked hard at improving Bald Mountain\0092s ponderosa pine forests. Over 35 acres have been treated to improve wildlife habitat, decrease fire danger to neighboring homes, and restore forest ecosystems. Now that the heavy work is finished, we are looking for 30 volunteers to help us restore the area with native grasses. Revegetation is a vital component of this project, as it will increase habitat quality, prevent soil erosion, and keep invasive weeds from taking over. Volunteers will use rakes, shovels, and other hand tools to spread and rake native seed into disturbed areas. Come back in the spring to watch your carefully sowed seeds grow into healthy native plants. Minimum ag
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Minimum age is 12 with adult supervision. This project runs from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm and free lunch will be provided! Please register by October 16 by e-mailing WildWorkVolunteers@BoulderCounty.org or calling 303-678-6216.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: This project runs from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm and free lunch will be provided! Please register by October 16 by e-mailing WildWorkVolunteers@BoulderCounty.org or calling 303-678-6216.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We will host the Boo Ball on Saturday, October 25, at the Marriott Pyramid Hotel. The following charities will benefit from the event: APS Education Foundation, A New Day Youth & Family Services, Namaste Child & Family Development Center. Thirty (30) volunteers needed to help with registration, and provide live and silent auction support. Shifts available between 8:30 a.m. and midnight. Variety of duties available: oversee silent auction; collect tickets; provide information to guests; escort guests to tables; process auction item payments; run errands; set up tables/chairs/decorations; set up auction items; set up & run golf putting green; assemble/box/secure remaining auction items; collect/sort auction bid sheets; take photos; and present the military colors. We will provide refr
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Shifts available

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fairy Tale Hike Volunteer - Brookside Nature Center - Community Service Day 2008 (MCPS SSL Approved)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed at the Brookside Nature Center to dress up as their favorite fairy tale character, and tell stories as families hike through the nature center grounds on a lovely fall afternoon. This is a nice alternative for young children to attend, compared to all of those very scary Halloween activities out there!
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Enjoy telling stories, dressing up, and working with families with young children
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The hikes start at 3 pm, but we need you there at 2:00, goes until 6:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer at National Hispanic Council on Aging Conference
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The 2008 National Hispanic Council on Aging Annual Conference will be held at Hotel Albuquerque at Old Town during the month of November. Volunteers needed November 3-7. Variety of tasks to include: assist with set-up and registration; distribute evaluation forms; greet and assist attendees; serve as runners, etc. Volunteers will receive free registration and/or tickets to various events. Anyone who completes a total of 20 hours of volunteer service will receive a full conference registration! We invite you to visit our website at http://www.nhcoa.org and join us in supporting and celebrating our Hispanic older generation.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Mayor's Office of Volunteerism and Engagement

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Backcountry Forest Restoration on October 11 & November 8
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Backcountry Forest Restoration on October 11 & November 8 (you can volunteer one or both days) Enjoy your time at beautiful Heil Valley Ranch, while helping restore healthy forest and meadow ecosystems. We will use handsaws and loppers to thin unhealthy ponderosa pine stands. The work we will accomplish is part of a larger restoration plan that will re-establish natural forest systems and improve wildlife habitat. Minimum age is 12 with adult supervision. This project runs from 12:00 pm to 4:00 pm. Please register by October 9 or November 6 by e-mailing WildWorkVolunteers@BoulderCounty.org or calling 303-678-6216.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Minimum age is 12 with adult supervision. Please register by October 9 or November 6 by e-mailing WildWorkVolunteers@BoulderCounty.org or calling 303-678-6216.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: This project runs from 12:00 pm to 4:00 pm. Please register by October 9 or November 6 by e-mailing WildWorkVolunteers@BoulderCounty.org or calling 303-678-6216.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Assistance
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The 4R Recycling Round Up celebrates America Recycles Day 2008 and will have trash-to-treasure activities and recycled content goodies for the kids. Everyone can make a pledge to recycle and be entered to win cool prizes including a kid\0092s bike.
MMWA joins other community sponsors at the Halloween Harvest event on October 24, 25 and 26, 2008 at the Children\0092s Zoo in Saginaw. This event is a safe and fun filled experience for children and their families featuring train and carousel rides, educational activities and lots of treats and goodies.
VOLUNTEER TASKS \0095Help children make a craft \0095Hand out treats \0095Assist with entry forms for prizes \0095Assist with Eco-quiz
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must like working with children and interacting with the public. This is an outdoor event. We will be in a large tent so will be protected from the rain although the tent will not be heated so dress for the weather.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Friday, October 24/3:45 p.m. \0096 8:00 p.m. Saturday, October 25/3:45 p.m. \0096 8:00 p.m. Sunday, October 26/2:45 p.m. \0096 7:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Landscaping at Stepping Stones Shelter - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Sponsor part of our landscape by purchasing plants and putting them in. Stepping Stones Shelter is in a historic farmhouse on a half acre of land. We have a great landscaping plan that has been donated with lots of details for various parts of our property. We need your help to make it a reality. Your group can sponsor part of this overall landscaping plan by meeting with our Executive Director in advance to review the plan and select a portion to sponsor - it might be a flower bed, or a group of shrubs - then purchase the plants and come out and plant them on Community Service Day.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Time is flexible

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Arthritis Foundation: Make A Difference Day 2008: Teeshirt Folding and Preparation: FULL
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
THIS OPPORTUNITY IS FULL. No more spaces are available; please consider some of our other projects. We'd love your help.
Join the Arthritis Foundation in preparing for their winter event. This fun project involves working indoors folding Jingle Bell Run t-shirts and organizing them by size. This is a wonderful project for larger groups or families. We have about 3,500 shirts to fold!
Snacks will be provided.
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Arthritis Foundation.
The mission of the Arthritis Foundation is to improve lives through leadership in the prevention , control and cure of arthritis and related diseases.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Please note that this will be an indoor activity.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. Teeshirt folding will be from 9 am to noon.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Whatcom Volunteer Center: Make A Difference Day

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Dismas House: Carpentry
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We serve those on probation and parole with transitional living and social services. Our website address is http://www.dismashousenewmexico.org. Five (5) volunteers needed on Friday, October 24, 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. One of our houses is old and is not very energy efficient. For example, it has an open basement which allows heat to escape during the winter months. Our windows are single pane and heat also escapes. Volunteers with carpentry skills sought to construct a door to cover the entrance to the basement; a well cover; and window frames that we can cover with insulation during the winter months. Volunteers should bring a circular saw, gloves and heavy shoes. WE WOULD APPRECIATE DONATION OF PLYWOOD.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Carpentry skills.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Niles Costume Contest @ Your Library Registration Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The library is seeking a group of six to eight people who enjoy working with children and know how to have fun!
Volunteers will work during the Second Annual Niles Costume Contest @ Your Library which will be held 2:30pm - 4:00pm on Saturday October 25. Last year, we had over 150 adorable children in scary, cute, funny and ridiculous costumes register for the contest. Volunteers will assign each child a number, answer questions about the contest and do general "kid wrangling." You will be very busy for about an hour and a half, but we will provide you with food and chocolate. Volunteers are encouraged to dress appropriately for the occasion - big shoes and a red nose would be just right. To find out more about this opportunity, call Nancy Studebaker at 269 683 2989 or e-mail to n
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Love to laugh. Enjoy the chaos of 150 kids in costumes going in 150 different directions. Willing to create and wear a silly costume.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers should plan to arrive around 2:00pm. The event is over at 4:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Disaster Volunteer Training
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Ready When the Time Comes (RWTC) is a program of the American Red Cross. The purpose is to prepare teams to be ready immediately to help in a time of a local, large-scale disaster. RWTC volunteers serve as \0093reserves\0094 that can be called when disaster response requires more than the normal corps of chapter volunteers.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 6 pm - 9:30 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Bernalillo County Council of PTAs (BCCPTA) Clothing Bank: Collection Drive (children's clothing)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We provide school clothes to any APS student that needs clothing to attend school. Our website address is http://www.bccpta.org. We are in constant need of new underwear and socks for the 3,000+ students we serve each year. A clothing drive would be helpful to our clothing bank. Financial assistance via a "fundraising drive" is also helpful so that we can purchase specific sizes of clothing. A "coat" or "jean" drive would also be very helpful. ITEMS SHOULD BE NEW OR GENTLY USED. Please contact us to arrange for delivery.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Bernalillo County Council of PTAs (BCCPTA) Clothing Bank

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We take in abused, neglected and unwanted horses, rehabilitate and retrain them as necessary and find them new homes. Additionally, we educate horse owners and potential horse owners about appropriate horse care. Our website address is http://www.wncr.org. 8-10 volunteers needed on Saturday, October 25, 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. WE ARE FLEXIBLE ON DATES, AND WILL ACCOMMODATE VOLUNTEER GROUP'S SCHEDULE. Volunteers will build a three-sided shelter to house ranch equipment (e.g., tractor). MATERIAL DONATIONS WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED, BUT THE BARN WILL GO UP REGARDLESS. THE COST OF LUMBER AND METAL ROOF IS APPROXIMATELY $1,800. We will provide refreshments and lunch. Minimum age: 15

Our website address is http://www.talkingtalons.com. Ten (10) volunteers needed on Saturday, October 25, 9:00 a.m. to noon. This project is to paint a stucco wall using a paint sprayer, and to paint a shed with rollers and brushes. The stucco wall is 2' high and 30' long. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Theater Usher for Teatro Vision
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Teatro Vision will be presenting our 25th anniversary season of plays beginning this October with "La Casa en Mango Street" a Spanish language adaptation of Sandra Cisneros' classic book.
This is one of three plays being produced this season, and one of the biggest needs for our plays are for volunteer ushers.
Volunteer ushers are asked to commit to a 3 hour shift and assist with taking tickets, showing patrons to their seats and handle any customer service issues during the performance.
Ushering is a very important task but is a great opportunity to meet new people, interact with audiences and get to see a play for free!
Bi-lingual Spanish speakers are highly desired.
Time commitments are from 6:45-9:45pm for shows Thur-Sat and 12:45-3:45pm on Sundays. Volunteers are ne
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Spanish speakers are desired because of the diversity of our audiences, although not a requirement

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nooksack Salmon Enhancement Association: Make A Difference Day 2008: Streamside Habitat Restoration
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join Nooksack Salmon Enhancement Association and the Chums of Terrell Creek for the kick off of our fall work party season on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008.
Help restore streamside habitat for salmon from 9am \0096 12pm, then stick around because the Chums of Terrell Creek are sponsoring a BBQ lunch after this work party.
We\0092ll bring the tools and gloves \0096 all you have to do is wear sturdy shoes and weather-appropriate clothing. So bring your friends, your family, and your enthusiasm and we\0092ll see you at the creek!
Directions: From I-5 North, heading toward Blaine, take the Grandview Rd. exit and head west.
Turn right at the stop sign at Jackson Rd. Parking is available in the parking lot at the Birch Bay Bible Community Church on the left. Cross Jac
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The work party will be from 9 am to noon.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Whatcom Volunteer Center: Make A Difference Day

It is out of this center that A Wider Circle will furnish the homes of 4,000 local chidlren and adults in need this year - with the first families coming to select furniture on Community Service Day!

Businesses, organizations and individuals sponsor an Elementary School for JA-in-a-Day. Volunteers present JA's elementary school programs to students grades K-6 in one school day.
The students get the same benefit of the traditional program all in one day! Should you want to consider doing service and saving on fuel mileage...this is the opportunity for you!
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Training course that will last around 90 minutes.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: This is an event that last from 7:30 till 2:30. One time at various schools. You can go only once if you like.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Xcel High Bridge Event
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Great River Greening is entering its 11th year of work at the Xcel Energy plant. This year, 300 volunteers will plant trees, seedlings, and shrubs in order to close a gap in the forest canopy in an effort to help ensure the ecological health of the surrounding floodplain forest and Mississippi River. The planting will help ensure the health of a rich diversity of plant and animal life. The closed canopy will also help improve wild bird habitat and encourage the return of endangered bird populations. The project as a whole helps protect the water quality of the Mississippi River which positively impacts the entire metro area water shed.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Home weatherizer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
On Nov. 1, 100 volunteers are needed to weatherize the homes of low income, elderly and disabled people. Do simple tasks such as put plastic over windows, weather strip doors and windows, and caulk holes. These small tasks can save a lot of money on energy bills.
This is a great team-building experience. Grab your fraternity, sorority, church group, co-workers, etc., and form a team of 4-5. (One person should be designated the lead volunteer).
Choose a shift on Nov. 1, either 8:30 a.m.-noon or noon-3:30 p.m. Each team will weatherize 2 homes in Story County.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Lead volunteers should attend a training session on either Oct. 25 from 9-10:30 a.m., or Oct. 30 from 6:30-8 p.m.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Choose a shift - 8:30 a.m.-noon, or noon-3:30 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Costume Contest @ Your Library / Activities Assistants
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The library is seeking groups of volunteers (3 or 4 in each group) who enjoy working with children and know how to laugh and have fun! Volunteers will work during the Second Annual Niles Costume Contest @ Your Library. Volunteers will be needed from about 10:00am - 4:30pm on Saturday October 25. Last year, we had over 150 adorable children in scary, cute, funny and ridiculous costumes register for the contest. Volunteers will assist with games and activities for the children and do general "kid wrangling." You will be very busy, but we will provide you with food and chocolate. Volunteers are encouraged to dress appropriately for the occasion - big shoes and a red nose would be just right. To find out more about this opportunity, call Nancy Studebaker at 269 683 2989 or e-mail to nstude
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must enjoy working with children, love to have fun and ideally, being willing to wear a silly costume.

These hangers will be a way to let County residents know about the services available from both the Association and from Montgomery County for those who may be struggling with dementia or may be a caregiver. There will also be information on county services on this door hanger. This would be a GREAT event for schools, scouts, faith communities or volunteer groups.(This opportunity is not approved for Student Service Learning)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nokesville Christmas Bird Count
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Christmas Bird Count, a national survey led by the National Audubon Society, captures a snapshot of bird populations in early winter and helps focus attention on the plight of wildlife nationwide.The Nokesville survey area includes habitats that are unique in Northern Virginia.
You don't have to be an expert birder to participate in the count. More eyes help spot more birds and the Christmas Bird Count is an exciting opportunity for beginning birders to connect with others and learn more about both birds and important habitats.
Volunteers can also participate by counting and recording backyard birds at feeders on the count day.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Birding enthusiasts of all skill levels welcome!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Count participants meet at Merrimac Farm at 6:30 a.m. to form teams, then depart for team count area. Participants who wish to join a team later in the day should make arrangement in advance by calling 703.499.4954 or alliance@pwconserve.org.

Saturday October 25th: Come help deliver meals, groceries, and friendship to those awaiting these vital services (Sorry, kitchen help on Saturday October 25th is already full!)
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions:
To work in the kitchen packaging meals, young volunteers aged 14-17 must be accompanied by an adult.
To work in the kitchen, slicing and dicing, volunteers must be 18 years of age the day of their volunteer activity.

Friday October 24th, The Food & Friends kitchen needs volunteers from 830am-Noon.
Saturday October 25th, Delivery Volunteers are needed from 930am- 130pm.

We desperately need toiletries, clothing & undergarments, flip flops (shower shoes), and bed linens for twin-sized beds. This is the perfect project for groups of people that can't get together all at once. Spend October collecting donations then drop them off on or around Make A Difference Day.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
To provide support and organization to the Colorado Student Assessment Program (CSAP) testing efforts and environment.
Key Responsibilities: Breakfast/Snack distribution Possible test proctoring and/or classroom assistance Attendance assistance; possible home visits (with Manual High School staff member) and/or wake up calls Hall monitoring Post-test document control (counting, sorting and packing)
Benefits: Working with and engaging students Providing an enriching learning experience for all students Providing students with the means to continue their education beyond high school Working with diverse populations Networking and connecting with other volunteers Implementing and supporting the Manual High School mission statement: Doing what it takes to keep student sin scho
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Qualifications: Experience supervising youth in a school setting Reliable and well organized Ability to connect and work with diverse populations

Semi Annual Household pollutant Collection - Twice a year, The M.e.t. collects household pollutants for proper disposal. This can include old paint, ammunition, oil, and other toxins/pollutants. Volunteers will direct traffic, dispose of pollutants, collect survey information, and other various tasks.
For more information on The M.e.t. or the Household Pollutant Collection, feel free to check out their website at: www.metrecycle.com

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Phone Bankers and Canvassers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers will be phone banking or canvassing in the Tallahassee community to ensure constituents are educated on the information that will appear on the General Election ballot.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Canvassers need to have reliable transportation and be able to walk/stand for long periods of time. Everyone must be open minded, culturally sensitive, and comfortable with one-on-one interactions.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Haunted Armory Ghosts, Goblins and Go-fers...
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help the children and families of Nebraska National Guard members have a happy Halloween this year by assisting at the 4th Annual Haunted Armory. Volunteers are needed to set up, tear down, haunt the halls and facilitate games and activities.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You must contact Karen or Michelle prior to coming to the event in order to gain access to the Armory!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The event runs from 5:30 to 8:30, but volunteers are needed from early afternoon until approximately 10pm to set up and tear down.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Nebraska Air National Guard Family Readiness Center

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Winter Solstice Planting at San Francisquito Creek with Save The Bay
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Friday, December 19 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Free
In partnership with the City of Palo Alto Baylands Nature Preserve
Winter is planting season at Save The Bay! Celebrate the upcoming Winter Solstice by planting native seedlings like mugwort and sticky monkey flower into this unique wetland area that was saved from development in the 1950's. Help us take advantage of the wet season and in doing so restore critical wetland habitat for Bay wildlife. Think about it as giving a gift back to the Bay for the holidays!
No experience necessary, all ages welcome. Gloves, tools and all instruction are provided. Each event is led by Save The Bay staff, who are certified in CPR and Wilderness First Aid and all site projects have been planned to insure safety.
Due to the sensitive nature of
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: To register: www.savesfbay.org/bayevents 510-452-9261 x119

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Captain - Clean-Up Crew
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Oversee the clean up efforts of volunteers at the completion of the race
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 11am - 12pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Salvation Army volunteers needed to plan and give Hoilday Parties
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Salvation Army needs volutneers to help with planning and giving 6 Holiday parties and dinners. There are 4 senior parties. Two after school parties and one Friday evening event for the family shelter. Need ideas, organization,shopping, and preparing... set-up and clean-up. And being a host at the party.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Creative, organized, like people, like parties. need 5 volunteers for each party
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We will plan times and dates as a group

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer to help Salvation Army Red Shield with sorting and packing of food and toys
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help with sorting of toys into gender and ages. And checking toys for recalls. Packing for specific families.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: bending, lifting, standing. Ability to resist playing with toys, lol.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 4:00pm until 7:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Field of Food
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
One in six residents in Broward County is hungry tonight. They come from all walks of life. They are your neighbors. Your childrens friends. Your co-workers.
On Saturday, October 18, Volunteer Broward, in partnership with Broward County Schools and The Million Meals Committee presents the first annual Field of Food at Lockhart Stadium in Fort Lauderdale. Lockhart Stadium is located at 5201 NW 12th Ave in Fort Lauderdale, FL 33309
With the collection of one million pounds of food as our goal, this is the largest one-day food drive ever initiated in Broward County. Volunteers are needed to assist in making this event a success!
You can make a difference. Join us. Help us feed the hungry in Broward County and make history\0085of hunger.
The power of one feed

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Kid Street is a non-profit charter school for at-risk children. Kid Street would like help weeding the garden and parking lot, please bring any gardening tools that you have.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9:00am - noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Thursdays in the Park
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: November 13 Volunteer Thursdays in the Park \0096 Sycamore Restoration Site at One Mile Recreation Area (2:00 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.). Volunteers will remove invasive plants, plant native plants, and remove litter and more. Meet at the Sycamore baseball field parking lot.

Location.Address2: Acres at One Mile Rec in Lower Park

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 2:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Meet at the West End of Annie\0092s Glen where Orient Avenue and East 1st Street intersect (just east of the Camelia Way Bridge).

Location.Address1: Annie's Glen -- park where Orient Ave &

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Taylor Mountain School is a new school in the Kawana Springs district. Help out with general weeding & grounds clean-up.
