VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Nature Coast Volunteer Center and United Way of Citrus County will once again collaborate for the "Day of Caring on Make A Difference Day!" scheduled on October 25th. We invite you to join us in partnership for this year's highway 44 clean up project and other initiatives.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Family Volunteer Day Bell Ringer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: You will have the opportunity to join together with your family while you help support the Tri-Cities Salvation Army during the Red Kettle Campaign this Christmas Season. With your partnership you will assist us with our efforts in raising funds to help support programming for families in need, activities for seniors, adult and youth that come form low in-come/single parent homes with in the Tri-City Community. Your volunteer position will consist of bell ringing in one of the many locations with in the Community. While you spend valuable family time together.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Ushers and Box Office Workers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Front of House volunteers needed for performances of Side Man at Sturgeon Bay High School
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Performances Thurs. - Sat. are at 7:30; Performance on Sunday is at 2:00. Ushers are to arrive 1 hour prior to show time

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Indian Arts & Crafts Association: General Office Tasks
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: 2-3 volunteers needed on Friday, October 24, 9:00 a.m. to ??. Volunteers will update our artist files (update files with images, correspondence, reports, etc.); update point system cards for artist/exhibitor show history; database entry with updated artist information. We will provide all supplies. Will provide refreshments. Minimum age: 17

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD N.M. Parent & Child Resources/Michael's Place: Painting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We offer services to children with special needs in our inclusion childcare and treatment foster care program. We offer the following services: childcare, treatment and traditional foster care, foster parent training and adoption services. Our website address is http://www.nmpcr.org. Six (6) volunteers needed on Saturday, October 25, 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Rooms measure: 16x20, 16x17, 8x28, 24x28, 13x15, 11x11, 13x20, 12x13 and 8x11. Volunteers will retouch paint in classrooms and restrooms. We will provide paint and lunch. WE WULD APPRECIATE DONATION OF PAINT BRUSHES, ROLLERS, PAINTING TAPE. Minimum age: 16

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Archery Assistant/Instructor for kids with autism
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with the coaching of youth with austism in bow and arrow instruction at Chalstrom's Archery Center on Rice Lake Road.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: archery experience preferred

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wood Stork Festival - Clean-up Crew
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help to clean up the park after the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Festival runs from 11am - 6pm - clean-up after the crowd clears out.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bell Ringer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: You will have the opportunity to help support the Tri-Cities Salvation Army during the Red Kettle Campaign this Christmas Season. With your partnership you will assist us with our efforts in raising funds to help support programming for families in need, activities for seniors, adult and youth that come form low in-come/single parent homes with in the Tri-City Community. Your volunteer position will consist of bell ringing in one of the many locations with in the Community. This opportunity is wonderful for High School students needing to complete service hours, Community Service Workers, Families, Church groups, congregations, Schools and Organizations. You may block out a two hour time slot for yourself or a whole day for your group.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: All we ask of volunteers is to be friendly. Children under 14 years of age must be accompanied by an adult. You are welcomed to volunteer with a group 1 group = 1 volunteer. We are seeking 5 volunteers per 26 locations 1 volunteer per shift . Please dress appropriate for the outside elements
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Individuals may choose a 2 hour time slot between 10am to 9pm Christmas Eve Day (12/24/08) shift will be between 10am-6pm. Large Groups may block out a whole day. PLEASE JOIN US ON NOVEMBER 22, 2008 FOR FAMILY VOLUNTEER DAY. NO SHIFTS WILL BE AVAILABLE ON THANKSGIVING DAY, NOVEMBER 27

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Performances on Thurs - Sat. are at 7:30, Performance on Sunday is at 2:00 - Ushers should arrive 1 hour prior to show time.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Halloween Hike Actors & Trail Guides
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed to help with one of Story County Conservation's largest annual events. Actors and guides are needed for this non-scary alternative to typical Halloween Activities. "Has-beens and Wannabees" will bring Iowa symbols like the old oak, the geode, and the wild rose to life through skits along the hike. Guides help direct groups of 30 hikers to each of the skits on a marked trail. Individuals, groups, or families work well as skit participants and guides.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be willing to traverse some uneven ground if a guide. Volunteers must contact SCC by September 23 to get costumes and skits ready - your help is sought on that too. Volunteers are required to attend the rehearsal/pizza party on October 14 at 6:00 p.m.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: See additional requirements for more information about preparation time. Hike times are scheduled every 10 minutes from 5:30 -8:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Receptionist
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Looking for assistance at our front desk. Volunteer will answer telephones, take messages, greet visitors and assist with small clerical projects.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: good phone skills

SponsoringOrganization.Name: KGNU-Community Radio for Boulder, Denver and Beyond

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD ARCA: Painting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Twenty-five (25) volunteers needed on either October 24 or 25, 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. to paint doors at our offices located at 11300 Lomas N.E. We will provide all materials and lunch.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Downtown Child Care Center (1503 Sixth Street): Collection Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Our year round preschool is in need of art supplies (watercolors, markers, glue, construction paper, etc.). We would also appreciate your used computer and copy paper for the children to draw on.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wood Stork Festival - Ticket-takers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Duty consists of taking tickets at the entrance to the festival.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Experience nice, but not required. Must be able to attend a meeting prior to the event - date and location of the meeting will be posted closer to the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Festival runs from 11am - 6pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wood Stork Festival - Booth Attendants
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: There will be several booths set up at the festival. These booths will need volunteers to man them. Duties will include passing out information and souveniour sales
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Experience nice, but not required. Must be able to attend a meeting prior to the event - date and location of the meeting will be posted closer to the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Festival runs from 11am - 6pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Emergency Preparedness Exercise Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The City of Alexandria and Arlington County need you to volunteer to help test our ability to deliver medications to residents during a public health emergency. Volunteering takes about 30 minutes on Saturday, November 8, 2008. Just walk into one of the five exercise sites between 9:00 a.m. and noon to pick up simulated medications for yourself, your family and any neighbors you would assist in the event of a real emergency.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Would like as many people at 9:00 a.m. as possible but people can come as late at 12:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Trick or Treat Street!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
With fall just around the corner it\0092s time for one of the Children\0092s Museum of Denver\0092s most fun filled events of the year! Trick or Treat Street is taking place October 29th, 30th, and 31st and we are looking for fun loving volunteers to help us with this spooktacular event.
Your volunteer participation is needed to make this unique and fun event a huge success! We are seeking more than 500 volunteers to help with jobs such as greeting, checking in guests and members, monster carnival attendants, stroller valet, candy house attendants, arts and crafts facilitators, costume characters, and so much more! We have multiple shifts to choose from and they fill up quickly so please sign up soon. Here are the available shifts:
October 27 and October 28th (SET UP SHIFTS) 9:00am- 1:00
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions:
To volunteer for this event, applicants MUST:
Be 16 years of age or older unless accompanied by an adult guardian Complete and submit a volunteer application Be able to sit and/or stand for 2-4 hours at a time
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Three shifts each day between 8:30am and 8:30pm. The set up shifts on Monday and Tuesday work a little differently and the breakdown shift on Saturday is only for 2 hours!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sweeney Todd Crew at Theatre Memphis
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Assistant Stage Manager (all rehearsals & shows) 1-3 Floor (all Shows) 1 Pin 0-2 Spot 1 Sound (all Shows) 0-2 Dressers
Assistant Stage Manager Assists the Stage Manager. Manages the backstage area during tech & performance
Stage (Floor) Crew Responsible for moving props & scenery during the show.
Pin (Rigging) Crew Flies the hanging scenery during tech and performance.
Spotlight Technician Runs the follow spot during tech and performance.
Sound Technician Runs the sound cues, sound & microphone levels during tech & performance
Dresser Helps keep the dressing rooms neat and organized. Helps with difficult costume changes.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach you.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sweeney Todd Usher at Theatre Memphis
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Shows patrons to their seats before the performance starts.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach you. While it is preferable for the consistency of the show that crew members are available for all the listed dates, it is only mandatory to be available for half. Please visit the Theatre Memphis web site at www.theatrememphis.org
Everyone who volunteers with Theatre Memphis will get a comp voucher for a free ticket to the shows for which they have helped.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Orientation for New Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: If you are wanting to volunteer for Lakeland's Hospice please come to our orientation training. You will learn about the different areas you can volunteer for in our program and how important of a role you as a volunteer play in our Hospice program.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Sign up starts at 9:00 am at our Hilltop location. Training starts at 9:30 am. Lunch will be provided if you call ahead to reserve your spot.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Food Setup and Food Server
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Food Setup: Setup dining area and serving area.
Food Servers: Serve food from buffet line to needy and homeless guests to our monthly Loaves & Fishes luncheon.
Other tasks may include: washing dishes, taking out trash, busing tables, cleaning tables.
You are very welcome to work both jobs or just one.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Be able to stand for 4 hours.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Setup takes place 7:30am-10am Serving takes place 10am-2pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation - Broward Outreach Center
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer Broward New Volunteer Orientations to be held at Broward Outreach Center every Tuesday.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bug-a-Boo Activity Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help us during our Halloween celebration. Help at a variety of stations to share fun, buggy activities including crafts, bug eating, games, and more.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Enjoy working with people. Outgoing & friendly.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Bug-a-Boo Event runs from 10-4 pm. 2 Hour shifts: 10-12 pm, 12-2 pm, 2-4 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Childcare at the Women's Resource Center (WRC) (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help brighten the day for children living in the Transitional Housing Program at the Women's Resource Center! Just a little of your time will give these mothers a break and time on their own to receive counseling or attend classes.
Their mission: dedicated to providing the highest quality supportive services, counseling, shelter and education to women, men and children involved in or threatened by domestic violence or sexual assault.
Project details: Volunteers will provide critical childcare support for mothers who have been threatened or victimized by domestic violence. Activities may include reading, singing, arts & crafts and playing games.
Project requirements: Join Flex

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: College Avenue Senior Center Lunch Service
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join the seniors at the College Avenue Senior Center (CASC) for a warm meal and a smile during their noontime lunch program!
Their mission: to serve the older population by providing a warm environment that assists seniors in continuing to live independently and remain involved in both the community of San Diego and the local Jewish community.
Project details: During the first half hour, volunteers will serve lunch and drinks for individuals over the age of 60 who come to the center. During the second half hour, volunteers will chat and socialize with clients while clearing and cleaning tables.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 16 with adult, 18 wi

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Jewish Family Service of San DIego

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Brown Baggers (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Each week over 140 people rely on the support of Flex Volunteers to see them through the weekend.
Project details: Volunteers will help put together food packages for people who are homebound due to HIV/AIDS.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 12 with adult, 14 without adult
Turn in a waiver form if you or your guest is below 18 years of age.
If you are signing up guests or a team, please notify the team leader in advanced and limit the size of your group to 2 volunteers.
Please note: By signing up for projects and not attending, you may be depriving someone else of the opportun

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come and enjoy the afternoon knitting in a cozy cafe with other volunteers!
Their mission: Volunteer San Diego creates lasting community impact through meaningful individual and group volunteer action.
Project details: Your blankets, hats, gloves, scarves etc. will then be donated to those in need: hospices, animal shelters, senior homes and more! All levels of knitting experience are welcome to attend, but you must know the basics.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 16
Turn in a waiver form if you or your guest is below 18 years of age.
What you will need to know

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Crafts For A Cause (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
What better way to spend your weekend afternoon than at a coffeehouse working on craft projects that will be donated to a wonderful cause?!
Their mission: Volunteer San Diego creates lasting community impact through meaningful individual and group volunteer action.
Project details: As a volunteer at this project, you will have the chance to relax in a comfortable cafe environment while working on crafts such as bookmarks for children, cards for hospice patients or placemats for seniors. We will then donate your creations to the appropriate community organization.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: any with adult (youth should be supervised), 14 without a

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: San Diego Food Bank (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join us (and get a workout!) as we sort and package food to be distributed to the homeless, homebound, seniors, and others. Without the efforts of Flex Volunteers, this food would never find its way into the hands of those in need.
Their mission: To provide food to people in need, advocate for the hungry and educate the public about hunger related issues.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 6 with adult, 14 without adult
Turn in a waiver form if you or your guest is below 18 years of age.
If you are signing up guests or a team, please notify the team leader in advanced and limit

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Meals at Merle's Place (FF)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Bring a smile and plenty of positive energy to help prepare and serve an evening meal to guests at 'Merle's Place'!
Their mission: To promote mutual understanding and respect among the member faiths; to deal with issues which affect the religious community; to share the members\0092 concern for these problems; to voice these concerns when, by common consent, the members feel that moral leadership is needed; and to implement programs for basic needs, social services, counseling, and economic development which will empower the disadvantaged in our community.
Project details: Volunteers will serve meals and afterwards will help clean the room.
Project requirements: Join Flex
Min

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Serra Mesa Homework Helpers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Many San Diego youth need help with their homework! Tutors always bring joy to the children\0092s day when they are given the help they need in order to succeed in school. The kids\0092 education is our future!
Project details: Volunteers will help encourage, motivate, and inspire youth in the continuation of their education by assisting them with their homework! Subjects vary; students range from K-12. No previous tutoring experience necessary. If you're patient and love working with kids- this is the project for you!
Project requirements: Join Flex
Minimum age required: 14 with adult, 16 without adult

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Servers, Cashiers, \0093Go-Fors\0094, decorations, prep, and clean-up
The Boys & Girls Club of Vista seeks volunteers to assist with our special youth awards luncheon Saturday October 27th, 2008. We need help from 4pm-11pm. Shifts can be staggered for one to two hours.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Tally Center Volunteers for Presidential Election
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
After the polls close, volunteers will assist with the unpacking of election boxes delivered by the Sheriff Reserves; verify precinct and sequence numbers on the official ballot boxes; participate in the inspection procedures of the official ballot boxes to ensure the precinct and sequence numbers are logged on the Inspection Board Log; file ballot boxes in the storage area.
Minimum age 18, 16 if accompanied by adult. Hours needed 9:00PM - 1:30AM. Prolonged standing and walking; frequent bending, squatting, and lifting (up to 20lbs).
A criminal background check is required.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: County of San Diego Registrar of Voters

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Feeding America San Diego (formerly Second Harvest Food Bank for San Diego)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help combat hunger by sorting through donated products at the Second Harvest Food Bank. A great opportunity to meet new people. Fun for everyone-- "anyone can volunteer!"
Their mission: to feed the hungry, to advocate, to educate.
Project details: Volunteers will be sorting donations into categories for local non-profit agencies and help get donated products cleaned, inspected, and ready for distribution.
Project requirements: Join Flex

October 18, 2008 2PM-12AM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Feeding America San Diego (formerly Second Harvest Food Bank ) FF
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help combat hunger with Feeding American San Diego! Great opportunity to meet new people. Family friendly and youth friendly opportunity.-- "anyone can volunteer!"

Project details: Volunteers will sort through donations and organize them into categories for our Agencies. The more food we sort, the more families get fed!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join a fun filled evening of arts and crafts with the 4-to-10 year olds staying at the Polinsky Center!
Their mission: to ensure that children have as normal as environment during their transitional period.
Project details: Volunteers will provide some much-needed attention for these children during their temporary stay at the center.

VOLUNTEERS ARE NOT PERMITTED TO BRING GUESTS TO THIS PROJECT. We want to make sure that site staff members are comfortable with knowing just who is on site.
What you will need to know before attending the project: Please note that there is a dress code for volun

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Feed the Homeless
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join the kitchen crew as we help prepare and serve meals to the 800 men, women, and children that live on the streets of Downtown San Diego!
Their mission: to help our neighbors in need break the cycle of homelessness and poverty by promoting self sufficiency through an innovative continuum of care, multi-disciplinary programs and partnerships that come together in the spirit of our CREED to teach, learn from and challenge our neighbors and one another.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Beautified Nature Walks for Teens!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come join a San Diego Natural History Museum scientist (or trained volunteer) on a different type of nature walk! By learning more about local plants and animals in a guided nature walk and actively restoring the natural beauty, you will be helping save the environment in small but important ways! We hope you will continue discovering the local nature and applying your environmental knowledge.
Their mission: To interpret the natural world through research, education and exhibits; to promote understanding of the evolution and diversity of southern California and the peninsula of Baja California; and to inspire in all a respect for nature and the environment.
Project details: Volunteers armed with tools (gloves, trash pickers and bags) will remove the littered clues of h

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Litter Prevention Campaign (CLPC)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Organized late in 2007, CLPC is a collective initiative of volunteers committed to the acronym: E.A.R.T.H; Early Attention for Right Treatment of Home. CLPC was develop as a (1-2 year) collaborative project to engage local residents, the school board, city councils, local churches, other non-profits and local businesses in eco-friendly activities. Rather than just accepting litter as a part of modern life or blaming someone else for it, we are TACKLING the issue from all angles to include action, awareness, and education.
Volunteers will be asked to promote the mission/vision of the organization; help organize events; educate and bring awareness to self and/or the public on the effects of litter in our community; pick-up debris around heavily littered swales, parking areas, etc. (equipm

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Spend your Saturday morning helping students succeed in school...and in life! You'll help students with reading, math, or whichever subjects you're comfortable with. No previous tutoring experience necessary!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Surfrider Beach Cleanups
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The San Diego County Chapter of the Surfrider Foundation and San Diego Coastkeeper, coordinate cleanups two times a month. On the second Saturday, we cleanup a North County San Diego beach (Oceanside to Torrey Pines), and on the fourth Saturday of every month we cleanup a beach in South County San Diego (La Jolla to Imperial Beach). To help out, all you have to do is show up. For all beach cleanups, please wear comfortable clothes, closed-toe shoes and sunscreen. We provide the gloves, bags, hand sanitizer and other essentials for cleaning up trash.
All volunteers are welcome to participate and must sign a liability waiver, but volunteers under 18 MUST have a parent or guardian present at the beginning of the cleanup to sign a liability waiver before the minor can participate or they c

Their mission: to advance low-income women's economic and social development and to encourage self-sufficiency through career development and employment retention.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers answer phone during the KPBS Radio Pledge. Some computer skills and customer service skills are a plus.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Watershed Monitoring Training & Monitoring Event
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
San Diego Coastkeeper is looking for members of the community interested in helping us gather data to improve and protect San Diego\0092s waters.
We ask that participants be over 18 years of age, or that they have a parent or guardian accompany minors for the field component of the watershed monitoring activities.
Water Monitoring Training is available once a month on the following dates. The location rotates between the San Diego Coastkeeper office in Point Loma (PL) and a North County location (NC) which is still being determined.
April 19\0096 Point Loma (Coastkeeper\0092s offices) May 17\0096 Point Loma (Coastkeeper\0092s offices) June 14- Lake San Marcos (North County) July 19\0096 Point Loma (Coastkeeper\0092s offices) August 16\0096 Point Loma (Coastkeeper\0092s offices) September 20 - Lake San M

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Reading to Children/Rocking Babies
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed in the Early Head Start & Head Start Pre K program. Ages of children are infants to 5 years old. Volunteers can rock babies, read to the toddlers and play with the children during small group play. Minimum age is 18 for individuals & 14 accompanied by a parent/guardian.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Petco Dog Adoption Days 3rd Saturday of Month
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Every 1st and 3rd Saturday of the month we hold "Adoption Days" where HSFC pets are transported to the Petco located in Cumming, Ga. in hopes of finding good, loving, and permanent homes!
New to volunteering with the Humane Society of Forsyth Co.? Please visit the Volunteer Now link on our web page. There you can fill out an application before the event. We look forward to hearing from you!
Note: Saturday's 11 - 3 (double check www.forsythpets.com volunteer calendar for possible cancellations.)
Exisiting volunteers, those who have attanded our volunteer orientation, can contact Angela Morris at: sean_ang@bellsouth.net or Deb Torbitt at: dtorbitt@hotmail.com

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Petco Dog Adoption Days - 1st Saturday of Month
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Every 1st and 3rd Saturday of the month we hold "Adoption Days" where HSFC pets are transported to the Petco located in Cumming, Ga. in hopes of finding good, loving, and permanent homes!
New to volunteering with the Humane Society of Forsyth Co.? Please visit the Volunteer Now link on our web page. There you can fill out an application before the event. We look forward to hearing from you!
Note: Saturday's 11 - 3 (double check www.forsythpets.com volunteer calendar for possible cancellations.)
Exisiting volunteers, those who have attanded our volunteer orientation, can contact Angela Morris at: sean_ang@bellsouth.net or Deb Torbitt at: dtorbitt@hotmail.com

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Game Time! (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join the kids at the Holtz Children Center at Jackson Memorial Hospital for a morning filled with games. Show your skills in Charades, Pictionary, Chess and more! No matter what-you're bound to have a great time at GAME TIME! For volunteers 18 and over.

Location.Address2: 1611 NW 12th Avenue, Children\0092s Hospital Center\005CnHoltz Center/East Tower 6A

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Here's Hope! (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Free on a Thursday night? Play games and enjoy after dinner refreshments with the residents of Here's Hope at the Salvation Army. Here's Hope serves clients living with HIV/AIDS. Volunteers MUST be 21 years and older.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fun Night at Arch Plaza (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join HOM for an evening of board games, BINGO, movies, refreshments, and more with the seniors residing at Arch Plaza. Arch Plaza is a nursing and rehabilitation center making a difference in people's lives and providing high quality care.
Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 11. Spanish and Haitian Creole speaking volunteers especially welcome. (7-10 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Storytelling and Snacks at MRM! (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join the residents at the Miami Rescue Mission's Center for Women and Children and spend an evening reading and enjoying healthy snacks with the children!
Only female volunteers are allowed to participate.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Arsht Center Volunteer Orientation (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: This orientation is required for all HOM volunteers interested in being ticket takers and/or ushers at Arsht Center for Performing Arts. At the orientation, volunteers will learn about the Arsht Center and the roles they will play as volunteers. The volunteer leader will also go over details of the project, benefits, and attire. Following this orientation, volunteer must attend an additional training session with the center. Performances for the month will be announced at the orientation. Training sessions and performances are not HOM projects.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Threads (FX) (YVC)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Grab your knitter looms, needles, crochet materials and join us in making hats and scarves for individuals undergoing cancer treatment at The Wellness Community in Greater Miami. The Wellness Community provides free psychological and emotional support for people with cancer and their families. Experienced and non-skilled knitters are welcomed to participate\0097no experience needed! Volunteers must bring their own materials. This project is open to active and pending volunteers. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 13. (10-12 volunteers)
Please Note:Volunteers must bring their own needles, looms, cotton yarn.This project is open to active and pending volunteers.
YVC FRIENDLY: Youth volunteers can attend this project without an adult, if they are already a member of the Youth

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nails at HHSB (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Hebrew Home of South Beach seniors enjoy our visits when volunteers provide simple manicures and great conversation. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 11. Spanish-speaking volunteers especially welcome. This project is perfect for first time volunteers. Experienced volunteers are also welcome!
Please Note: Parking passes are available at the front desk (even though receptionist is usually not there.) After volunteers park, go directly to the 2nd floor, the Activities Room.
PLEASE NOTE: It is mandatory that volunteers confirm with their VL that they will attend the project, either through email or by phone. If you do not confirm, you will be removed from the project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HHSB Arts & Crafts (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join HOM at the Hebrew Home of South Beach for a fun morning of arts and crafts with the seniors who reside at the home. Volunteers and residents will enjoy sweets. Spanish-speaking volunteers especially welcome. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 11.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: The Barnacle Project (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Support the Barnacle Historical State Park by spending a Saturday morning cleaning up the shoreline and the mangroves. Volunteers will also remove exotic plants from the habitat. Family-friendly: all ages with an adult.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bake Someone Happy at RMH! (YVC Friendly)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The missing ingredient is YOU! Come join us for an evening of fun in the kitchen baking Grandma's recipes with the kids at RMH, "a home away from home" for children who are patients at local hospitals.
YVC FRIENDLY: Youth volunteers can attend this project without an adult, if they are already a member of the Youth Volunteer Corps Program. To be a member of the YVC, please attend a HOM101 Orientation.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Adopt North Shore Park (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Put on your gardening gloves and join us at North Shore Park to help restore one of Miami\0092s few remaining native hammocks. Remove exotic plants, mulch, landscape, and help maintain this environmentally precious northern part of Miami Beach and a true Florida legacy. This is a family-friendly project. Minimum age with an adult is 12. (8-15 volunteers)

SponsoringOrganization.Name: City of Miami Beach - Community Resource & Outreach Division

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bear Cut Beach Clean-up (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteer and help keep our beaches clean. The Bear Cut Nature Preserve is an important area for nesting sea turtles, migratory birds and mangrove habitat. Help us beautify and protect this unique environment. Family-friendly: all ages with an adult. (8-15 volunteers)
Volunteers should dress weather appropriate and must wear toe-closed shoes. Bring a hat, sunscreen, and bug repellent.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: BINGO at Fair Havens (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join the senior residents at Fair Havens for an afternoon of fun. Bring your children, as the seniors love spending time with young volunteers. Minimum age is 15 accompanied with an adult. Spanish-speaking volunteers especially welcome.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Beauty Parlor at Fair Havens (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Fair Havens seniors enjoy our visits when volunteers provide simple manicures and great conversation. Who knew the beauty parlor could be so much fun? Family-friendly: all ages with an adult.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Cowboys and Cowgirls (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help kids with disabilities ride the horses at Good Hope Equestrian Center and learn the basics of being a stable hand to the children! No experience needed. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 14. (6-8 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Miami Rescue Mission (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Dish up some cheer and a hearty lunch to the men, women and children who have no place to call home. Volunteers will also help with kitchen set-up and clean-up. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 17.
PLEASE NOTE: This project is no longer YVC Friendly, beginning in August. Please contact Lucia Goyen at 305-646-7255 or Lucia@handsonmiami.org if you have any questions or concerns.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Zoo Beautification (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help MetroZoo maintain the gardens and exhibitions at the park. After volunteers are done re-planting and doing various tasks to help beautify the zoo, they are welcome to enjoy and walk around the Miami Metro Zoo! Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16. (20-25 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Pelican Harbor Clean Up (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come out for a fun-filled beach clean up day! Volunteers ride out in a boat to Pelican Harbor to clean up our beautiful bays and beaches. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 8. (25-50 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Botanical Garden (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a green oasis in the heart of South Beach. Bromeliads, orchids and tropical palms thrive, along with other exotic plants. Volunteers will help with gardening activities. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 12.
Project takes place outdoors. Sunscreen and mosquito repellant are recommended.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bedtime Stories (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers will visit the Salvation Army shelter for homeless children to read bedtime stories and make sure their dreams are sweet. Experienced volunteers are also welcome! Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16.(8-10 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: All-Aboard Story Hour (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: As part of the All-Aboard Tutoring program, enjoy stories and crafts with children at Community Partnership for the Homeless. These kids are eager to read and you can help them learn! (3-6 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Habitat for Humanity (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Take part in the worldwide effort of Habitat for Humanity! From painting walls to laying sod, you can help a low-income family realize the dream of owning a home. No experience needed. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16. (7-9 volunteers)
1. Bring basic hand tools: a hammer, work gloves, and nail apron. These are not provided on site, and you will need them. 2. Arrive at 7:30 AM and plan to work until 3:30 PM, taking \00BD hour for lunch. 3. Wear modest, cool apparel and closed-toe shoes. 4. Engage in safe work habits. 5. Habitat is a drug-free, alcohol free workplace. Possession, use or distribution of controlled substances or alcohol is prohibited under Habitat\0092s program. 6. NO publicity of any kind is permitted without the express permission of Miami Habitat, and

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Habitat for Humanity of Greater Miami

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Let's Play BINGO! (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: You\0092re invited to a fun time at the Miami Jewish Home & Hospital for the Aged. Come share your laughter, as we play BINGO with some terrific seniors. Family-friendly: all ages with an adult.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Miami Jewish Home & Hospital for the Aged

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: McLamore, Munchies and More (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The abused, abandoned and neglected kids at the McLamore Center always enjoy our visits. Popcorn and movies, arts and crafts, or healthy snacks\0096what a delicious way to have fun! Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16.
PLEASE NOTE: It is mandatory that volunteers confirm with their VL that they will attend the project, either through email or by phone. If you do not confirm, you will be removed from the project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project Leader Training
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help Volunteer Broward expand our Hands On Programming by becoming a Volunteer Project Leader.
As a Project Leader, you will provide the leadership necessary to make our projects meaningful and enjoyable! You will serve as the liaison between Volunteer Broward, our volunteers and the non-profit agencies that we serve. If you have a lap top computer, please bring it with you to this session.
Taking you LAPTOPS will be a welcomed asset.
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Crafty People needed at Schott Communities
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Description of Project: Join other crafty people who enjoy food, fun and fellowship while making crafts for our annual craft show (held in Nov. each year). Crafters meet at our agency every Wednesday from 9am \0096 12 noon with a free lunch included.
Description of Volunteer Tasks: Various and different types of crafts you help to make in preparation for our annual craft show/bake sale each November. If you like to instruct a craft idea that would be fine also.
After registering, please contact: Nancy Vidaurre (954) 434-3306; ext. 101 nvidaurre@schottcommunities.org

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Creative Helpers needed at Schott Communities
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Date & Time: Every Tuesday from 10am until 12noon.
Description of Project: A new program being offered to our members who are disabled..
Description of Volunteer Tasks: Volunteers needed to aide existing craft instructor working with our disabled population.
After registering, please contact: Nancy Vidaurre (954) 434-3306; ext. 101 nvidaurre@schottcommunities.org

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Agency Workshop
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: VOLUNTEER BROWARD is hosting a workshop to help you manage your volunteers! Be a part of this growing phenomenon. Learn how to handle your volunteers with expertise. We'll show you how!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Friends Ranch Clean-Up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Friends Ranch is in need of volunteers to come out and assist with the maintenance of this horse rescue facility. Volunteer tasks include: filling horse drinking buckets, sweeping out stalls, and loading hay and debris onto spreaders. Work can be broken up into shifts from 10am to 5pm. First time volunteers should report after 1pm on Saturdays. Work is physically demanding so volunteers should be prepared.
On Saturdays the gate is open and volunteers should arrive anytime from 10AM until about 5PM for the initial visit at which time you will receive the volunteer packet and all needed information regarding the volunteer program and your assignment to specific tasks and times that are compatible with your needs and schedule. Sunday hours the gates are open from 9:00

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Florida Research Institute for Equine Nurturing, Development and Safety, Inc

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: New Volunteer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
This is an informative one-hour session for anyone who wants to join Volunteer Broward. Learn about our history, our programs and how to get involved. You must attend an orientation before volunteering for any Volunteer Broward projects.
If you are under the age of 18, you must attend the orientation with a parent or guardian.You will not be able to register online. Your parent/guardian can sign up and bring you -or- you can both just show up! No RSVP needed!
We invite you to join with us to fight hunger and homelessness throughout Broward County. YOU CAN HELP BY BRINGING TWO CANNED OR DRY NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS TO THE ORIENTATION SESSION. As a way to thank you, you will be eligible for a half price discount on Volunteer Broward t-shirts.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Hope Lodge Game Night
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
A simple game of bingo can provide a welcome break when you're dealing with an illness. Come out and share in some fun with the residents of the American Cancer Society's Hope Lodge. Hope Lodge provides free temporary housing for cancer patients receiving outpatient treatment at Nashville hospitals.
This project is open to volunteers age 17 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Dinner at Hope Lodge
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Hope Lodge provides free temporary housing for cancer patients receiving outpatient treatment at Nashville hospitals. Volunteers will provide and share a home-cooked meal with patients to help make their stay more comfortable. Each volunteer for this project is required to provide a menu item for the meal. Project coordinators and volunteers will work together to plan a menu.
This project is open to volunteers age 17 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Critter Care
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join other animal-loving volunteers in caring for the animals at the Nashville Humane Association. Work may include walking the dogs and cleaning cat and/or dog cages, so be sure to wear your grubby clothes and closed-toed shoes! Volunteers must be at least 16 years old to participate in this project.
This project is open to all volunteers age 16 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Making CARES Packages
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Assemble food bags for clients of Nashville CARES. This is an important service that helps people living with HIV/AIDS to manage their lives more effectively. Your effort here is very important because two food bags feed one person for two weeks!
This project is open to volunteers age 13 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project C.U.R.E
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Project C.U.R.E. collects new, surplus and overstock medical supplies, sorts the items, and ships them to almost 100 countries including North Korea, Cuba, China, Russia, Vietnam, numerous countries in Africa and South America, and nearly every nation in Central Asia. Your good work here at home makes a huge impact miles away.
Volunteers will sort supplies in Project C.U.R.E.'s warehouse. There may occasionally be a need to move boxes weighing 20-25 pounds. All volunteers should wear closed toe shoes to this project. This is a great project for a group of friends, co-workers, civic or faith organization.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Job Zone (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are invited to participate in hands-on projects about the job exploration process at Regis House, a program for court-appointed teens. Help them find a better future! (2-4 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Hang Time (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed to come \0093hang out\0094 with kids at Regis House, a program for teens with substance abuse problems. Activities include playing cards, games, or just having fun. If you\0092d like to be a role model for some great kids, this is your project! (2-6 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Good Times at the Miami Bridge (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come spend an evening at the Miami Bridge shelter for runaway teens. Activities include ping-pong, board games, or arts and crafts. Your visit will truly make a difference in the lives of these teens! Volunteers must be 21 years and older.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Career Night at Regis House (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Do you have a great career or hobby and a story to go with it? Join us as we share details about our jobs at Regis House, a program for teens who have become involved with the juvenile justice system. Please bring along tools of the trade so that they get a hands-on experience. Technical and vocational jobs especially welcome! Your story will brighten their future! (2-4 volunteers)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Art Time (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: If you like to express yourself in artistic media such as macaroni, crayons, and glitter, then join us for Art Time. The kids at Jackson Memorial Hospital look forward to your visit and some fun! For volunteers 18 and over.

Location.Address2: 1611 NW 12th Avenue, Children\0092s Hospital Center\005CnHoltz Center/East Tower 6A

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Animal Lovers (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help provide a better home for the cats and dogs at the Humane Society! Activities include bathing, walking, playing, and giving special attention to the animals at the shelter. Male volunteers are encouraged to attend. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16. (7-10 volunteers)
ATTIRE: Please make sure to wear long pants and closed-toed shoes to the project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fun Galore at RMH (FX)( YVC- Friendly)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Ronald McDonald House is a \0093home away from home\0094 for families of children who are patients at local hospitals. Come join us for an evening of games! Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 12. (4-6 volunteers)
YVC FRIENDLY: Youth volunteers can attend this project without an adult, if they are already a member of the Youth Volunteer Corps Program. To be a member of the YVC, please attend a HOM101 Orientation. Jackson Map

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Women's Bead Connection
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Spend some creative time with the women at St. John's Shelter. We will make jewelry and provide a relaxing social activity for women at the shelter.
St. John's Shelter for Women & Children is a United Way Certified Agency.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: St. John's Shelter for Women & Children

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Urban Farm Stand - Alkali Flat
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are looking for volunteers to help run our exciting new Urban Farm Stand and Community Marketplace. This food access project will bring convenient access to healthy fruits and vegetables to low income communities with little to no access to fresh produce. Volunteer opportunities include helping with setup and take down of equipment, tables, produce, etc. and interacting with the community, staffing the information table, and helping engage community members in fun activities (e.g., nutrition quizes, giving away stickers, etc.) Will also be working with youth iterns.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bingo!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteers must be 18 years of age or older in order to participate in this project.
If you will be using our volunteer opportunity for a community service project or will need documentation of your community service hours, you must complete an interview in person with the volunteer coordinator prior to the start of your term of service.
Did you know there are over 30,000 people in the Sacramento area who are blind or have low vision? Society for the Blind is the Sacramento Region\0092s only full service agency serving blind and visually impaired people of all ages.
Be part of the excitement and help raise funds for Society for the Blind at the Sacramento Bingo Center!
All volunteers must contact the project leader after registering to volunteer.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sort-N-More at Sac RAFT
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Sacramento Resource Area For Teaching's (RAFT) mission is to provide teachers and those who teach children inexpensive materials, lessons, activity kits and resources to encourage hands-on learning in the classroom or community group.
Sacramento RAFT opens every Saturday from 9:30AM to 4:00PM so teachers can shop for materials for their classrooms. We are looking for volunteers to work in various positions around our warehouse helping to give great service to our teachers.
Some of the volunteer tasks include: Greeting, membership assistance, floor assistance, baggers, computer/tech Sales, sticker and retail assistance, helping with lamination, book-making, copying, die-cutting; shelf-stocking, helping customers load their cars."
Lunch will be provided.
Minimum Volunteer

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Keeping Up Parks & Nature Areas
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Sacramento is gifted with many parks and nature areas that provide us a refuge. Parks are an integral part of the cultural identity of The City of Sacramento and remain one of the few places where families, residents, and visitors can go to relax, reflect, and recreate with no entrance fees or other costs.
Keeping up our beautiful parks, trails, and nature areas is not possible without the help of dedicated volunteers like you. Show that you care and be a responsible citizen of Sacramento by helping to preserve, protect, and beautify parks, facilities, natural areas, bike, pedestrian and equestrian trails for present and future generations.
Between March and November, volunteers will have a chance to participate in tasks such as removing invasive plants and cleaning various park

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Habitat For Humanity
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteers must be 18 years of age or older in order to participate in this project.
Join us as we volunteer with Sacramento Habitat for Humanity. Wear comfortable, durable clothes and close-toed shoes. Space is limited and this project fills up quickly so sign up soon to reserve your spot!
You do not need tools or construction experience to volunteer although any construction knowledge is welcome!
When signing up for this project, please be flexible.
We don't receive the project location address until about 3 days before the project date. All project locations are within the Sacramento County. Although we have the start time at 8:30AM, on some dates, start time may vary depending on the weather.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Outdoor Work Party
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join us in our monthly outdoor work party to trim small trees and bushes, pull weeds, pick up trash, etc. Help keep the grounds at Ronald McDonald House beautiful for all of the children who are currently undergoing treatment.
Minimum Volunteer Age: 12
All volunteers under 18 years old MUST submit "HOS Youth Waiver" to Hands On Sacramento Office prior to the project date. In addition, volunteers under 14 (13 years or younger) MUST accompany an adult volunteers to the project location. The HOS Youth Waiver is located under "Youth volunteering" section of our website.
Contact info@handsonsacto.org if you have questions about Youth Waiver.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sharing the Bounty
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Minimum Volunteer Age: 14
Volunteers under 18 years of age MUST submit a youth waiver prior to signing up for this project. In addition, volunteers under 14 years of age must be accompanied by an adult (18 years or older) in order to volunteer. The waiver can be downloaded from "Youth Volunteering" section of our website.
Volunteers help serve plated hot dinners to hungry guests at St. Philomene's. Volunteer tasks include set up, serving food & drink, clean-up and dispensing bread bags.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project Birthday
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help brighten the lives of the less fortunate by providing full birthday parties for homeless children! If you love working with kids, this creative project proves exciting and rewarding.
Join us at one of our monthly parties, currently being held at St. John's Shelter for Women & Children, Family Promise and the Women's Overcomers Shelter at Calvary Christian Center.
Space is limited and this project fills up quickly so sign up soon to reserve your spot!
Minimum Volunteer Age: 6
Volunteers under 18 years old MUST submit a youth waiver prior to attending the project. In addition, children 13 years old or younger must be accompanied by their parents in order to participate.
We also provide birthday party kits at Volunteers of America and My Sister's House. I

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Pet Friendly Social Hour
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
If your dog or cat revels in non-stop attention, bring them out for a visit with the residents of Green Hills Health and Rehab Center. While your pet enjoys love from the residents, you can engage in wonderful conversation with the residents and hear stories of their past. Everyone's day will be a bit brighter!
You must bring a copy of your pet's current vaccination record to leave on file with the center.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Green Hills Health and Rehabilitation Center

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Soup Stop
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Hunger is a real issue for many in our city. The Salvation Army is fighting the situation by providing a hot soup, snacks, and beverage to those living on the streets.
Volunteers will prepare soup in the Salvation Army's Canteen Truck then serve folks from the truck which will be parked on Second Avenue North.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Host at the Senior Concert
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Bluebird Caf\00E9 hosts a free monthly concert for senior citizens. Seniors from Senior Citizens, Inc., Jewish Community Center and other senior residences enjoy being treated to a free live performance. Volunteers will help seat the guests, serve refreshments and enjoy the concert with the seniors.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bingo Party at J.B. Knowles
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
The residents of the J.B. Knowles Home for the Aged love to play Bingo! They look forward to this activity and the companionship that our Hands On Nashville volunteers bring. Volunteers are asked to bring simple refreshments or $1-2 gifts to be used as prizes.
This project is open to volunteers age 13 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Joseph B. Knowles Home for the Aged

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Loaves and Fishes
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Loaves and Fishes, a program of Holy Name Catholic Church, provides services to individuals who are homeless and in need. In addition to providing hot meals three times a week, they provide healthcare in partnership with St. Thomas mobile Health Clinic.
During this project, volunteers will spend the morning preparing lunch then assist in serving more than 100 homeless individuals.
This project is open to volunteers age 13 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Game Night
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
If you enjoy playing games like Spades, Rummy, Scrabble, or Checkers, then Metro Nashville Bordeaux Hospital is the place to be. The residents love to play board and card games, and they need friends like you to be a challenging opponent. Volunteers help transport patients to the game room, assist with game setup and scorekeeping, play games and make new friends.
This project is open to volunteers age 16 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Dinner at Nashville Safe Haven Family Shelter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Prepare your favorite dish and share it with the families at Nashville Safe Haven Family Shelter, a facility where families in transition can find housing together. Your gift of time and food has a tremendous impact on the people in the shelter.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Serve It Up at the Mission
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Looking for a great way to provide a meal and a little hospitality? Come on out and serve dinner at the Nashville Rescue Mission. The Mission is an emergency shelter for homeless men. By the end of this project, you\0092ll be taking home a smile of your own.
This project is open to volunteers age 16 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Dinner at Dismas House
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help prepare and share dinner with the residents of Dismas House, a transitional home for ex-offenders. The residents greatly appreciate and benefit from this time of conversation - almost as much as the volunteers do! Volunteers will prepare food provided by Dismas House.
This project is open to volunteers age 13 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Cooking It Up at Ronald McDonald
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Prepare dinner for the families residing at Ronald McDonald House while their children receive medical services at Vanderbilt Hospital. By filling the house with pleasant conversation and the aroma of a home-cooked meal, volunteers can help the residents feel more comfortable during their stay away from home.
Volunteers are expected to provide one or two dishes to supplement the food available at the house. Project Coordinators, together with volunteers and the agency contact, choose the menu for Cooking It Up.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bookworm Paradise
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Join the fun as the Donelson Public Library clears shelves during their monthly book sale held in the basement of the Donelson Branch Library. Volunteers are needed to straighten shelves and count/bag book purchases. Sign up for the entire time or a partial shift. The 2nd Saturday Booksale benefits the Summer Reading Program for the children of Davidson County and includes all 20 Branch Library's plus the Main Library.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Helping the Hungry
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Every Thursday night those in need in the West Nashville area know they can get a hot, delicious meal at West Nashville United Methodist Church.
Volunteers will prepare a hot meal with food provided by Nashville's Table and will serve it in the church's dining room. Volunteers will also set-up the dining room and do simple clean-up at the end of the meal.
This project is open to volunteers age 16 and older. All volunteers under the age of 18 are required to bring a signed Volunteer Release Form with them to each project.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Tour Group Leader
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The group leader will guide tour groups along the tour path for our annual fall fundraiser, the Costume Twilight Tour. Your job will be to keep tour goers on the tour path. Information about Elmwood will be provided so you can tell your group interesting facts about the cemetery.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: This job requires long periods of standing and walking.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The event is from 5-7:30pm. We will need volunteers from 4:15 until 8:00 or 8:30.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Food Sorting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Sort donated food in different categories to use for food baskets given to families at Christmas.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Food Packing Shift 1
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Pack food baskets with donated food items for Christmas distribution.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Registration
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist people to complete applications for Christmas Angel Tree gifts.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: 7-10 volunteers needed per day.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Gift Sorting - Shift 1
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with sorting Christmas gifts for Angel Tree program at Joy Center warehouse
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Wed. & Fri. - 8:30am-12:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Stockings For Foster Kids
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Circle of Care Child SHARE (Shelter Homes: A Rescue Effort) recruits and supports families and individuals who foster or adopt a child in DHS custody. Individuals or groups are needed to provide various items for the Christmas stockings that children of various ages will receive at the annual Christmas party. This is a great opportunity for children\0092s groups to give to other children.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: A list of suggested items and amounts needed will be available 11/10/08, with all items being returned by 12/8/08.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Painting and Roof Work
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are in need of some painting and roof work at our center ASAP. We had a unexpected roof problem and water damage. Transitional home for mothers and children. To help them find affordable housing, computer training, job skills, counseling. The average stay is 6 months to one year.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Time flexible - Help needed ASAP

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Hannah's Aftercare And Rehab Center, Inc.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Motorcycle Toy Run
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Serve coffee/hot chocolate at starting line, 56th & Riverside. . Accept donated toys from riders at finish line, downtown.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Snow Magic on Main volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Experience the feeling of an old-fashioned hometown festival with our holiday open house. The festival will kick off with a tree lighting ceremony in Tom Evans Park. Plus, children and families can enjoy a nostalgic horse drawn sleigh ride and visit with Santa! *Volunteers are needed Nov. 20-Nov. 23.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Times to be announced

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Each year Manna's premier event is the Friends of Manna Silent Auction and Reception. This event began 13 years ago when some "Friends" of Manna held a small fundraiser at a bar in DC's Shaw neighborhood. Friends of Manna has now blossomed into a major networking event for the DC real estate, banking and non-profit community. Last year's event was attended by 300 people and raised over $180,000 to help support our mission of providing affordable homeownership housing for the residents of DC.
One of the key elements to the success of this event are the volunteers who dedicate their time and energy. Volunteers help with everything from set-up, registration, coat-check and silent auction check-out. And volunteers are encouraged to attend the event for free before or after their shif

It is a weekend of rallying together 100+ volunteers to refurbish 200+ computers that will end up in the homes of hardworking, underprivileged K-12 kids. The next Geek-A-Thon will be at the new Lenovo Fulfillment Center in Greensboro, sponsored by Lenovo. The following shifts are available:
A.) FRI. OCT. 17TH FROM 3 PM - 5 PM (Initial Setup)
B.) FRI. OCT. 17TH FROM 5 PM - 9 PM (Initial Setup/Triage)
C.) SAT. OCT. 18TH FROM 9 AM - 1 PM (Refurbishing Session 1)
D.) SAT. OCT. 18TH FROM 1 PM - 5 PM (Refurbishing Session 2)
E.) SUN. OCT. 19TH FROM 9 AM - 1 PM (Refurbishing Session 3)

You don't have to work every weekend, or even one whole weekend, but you'll probably want to. Dress in costume and try your darndest to spook riders on the Fright Express. Put makeup on monsters. Assist young children on the hayride. Assist with game set-up. TIME: 5 p.m. Volunteers under age 16 must be accompanied by parent, guardian or teacher/sponsor. Dinner is furnished.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: z (PROJECT FULL) Bikes for the World Morning Shift - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help load a container of approximately 450 used bicycles, plus valuable bike parts, destined for Africa or Central America. Bikes are essential for getting to work, and delivering health and education services in rural communities. Loading the container will involve rolling the bikes out of the barn into the container, packing the bikes into the container, carrying boxes of parts, and doing some minor work to compact some of the bikes including lowering seats, turning handlebars, etc.
Wear clothes that can get dirty. Closed shoes, no sandals. Bring work gloves if you have them. We'll supply cold drinks and light snacks.
Entrance to location is from corner of Piccard and Grand Champion Drives, at the rear of the farm. You can use the address 1199 Grand Champion Drive for GPS or
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: There will be two shifts for this project - this is the MORNING SHIFT 9 am -12:30 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Calvary Women's Services is participating in a 5K Walk for the Homeless in Washington, DC on November 22, 2008. A volunteer is needed to register for the walk (www.helpthehomelessdc.org), dress up like Santa Claus, and distribute our holiday wish list & candy canes to walkers.
The annual walk for the homeless is an imperative part of our fundraising and our holiday wish drive also keeps the organization going throughout the year. Without Santa Claus, and the kindness of our monetary and in-kind donors, there would be no holiday season for the homeless women we serve.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:30 am to 12:30 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: USHERS/FLOW MANAGERS FOR EVENT
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: St. John's Community Services, a non-profit serving people with disabilities in DC needs volunteers on 11/06/08 between 5pm-10pm to ensure smooth movement throughout the building for concert guests attending our 140th anniversary concert/ art show at DAR Constitution Hall. Volunteers will assist in seating guests, especially those with disabilities, and direct/assist persons with disabilities to restrooms/concessions. Orientation on site (limited parking; metro accessible). Volunteers provided food and free tickets to art show and the Blind Boys of Alabama concert on 11/06/08. To volunteer, please contact Thalia Simpson-Clement, tsimpsonclement@sjcs.org or (202) 274-3423.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help the Homeless Walkathon supporting NVFS
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
For more than 20 years, the Fannie Mae Help the Homeless Program has brought together caring and committed individuals to work toward preventing and ending homelessness in our region. Please join tens of thousands of your neighbors for the 21st Annual Help the Homeless Walkathon
Join the NVFS team! All it takes is a few hours of your time. This year, we're encouraging new volunteers to sign up on behalf of NVFS, pay their registration fees ($15 if you are 25 and under, $25 if you are over 25) and WALK on November 22 at the National Mall in DC, to raise awareness about homelessness in our region. You will receive a "Help the Homeless campaign" T-shirt.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Santa Claus
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Calvary Women's Services is participating in a 5K Walk for the Homeless in Washington, DC on November 22, 2008. A volunteer is needed to register for the walk (www.helpthehomelessdc.org), dress up like Santa Claus, and distribute our holiday wish list & candy canes to walkers.
The annual walk for the homeless is an imperative part of our fundraising and our holiday wish drive also keeps the organization going throughout the year. Without Santa Claus, and the kindness of our monetary and in-kind donors, there would be no holiday season for the homeless women we serve.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:30 am to 12:30 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Whatcom Land Trust: Make A Difference Day 2008: Invasive Species Removal & Trail Clearing (Custer)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Join Whatcom Land Trust in preserving our special county; help with trail clearing, removal of invasive species, and general site clean up. Be prepared to be outdoors!
This event will take place on Make A Difference Day, Saturday, October 25th, 2008, organized by Whatcom Volunteer Center and prepared in collaboration with Whatcom Land Trust.
The Whatcom Land Trust works to preserve and protect wildlife habitat, scenic, agricultural and open space lands in Whatcom County for future generations by securing interests in land and promoting land stewardship.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You must wear clothes appropriate for the weather and outdoor work.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The free continental breakfast kickoff, sponsored by the Whatcom Volunteer Center, will start at 8 am at Bellingham High School. The clean-up project will run from 9 am to 1 pm.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Whatcom Volunteer Center: Make A Difference Day

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Rosebud Parade Preperation

Prep work includes making flowers and crowns and bundling streamers that will be used for the children to decorate their "floats" on the day of the parade. The Rosebud Parade allows children in the community the chance to participate in their very own parade while at the same time raising funds for Kidspace Children's Museum. In addition, the Rosebud Parade exposes the community to the mission of Kidspace Children's Museum.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Organized, independent worker. Artistic abilities a plus, but not required.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Kidspace is open from 9:30-5 everyday

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Angel Tree hosts will set up a tree at the location of their choice, then either bring the gifts to The Salvation Army or contact us to pick gifts up.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Adult Literacy Tutor
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
JOIN PARTNERS IN READING Do you enjoy reading and helping others? Imagine that you could not read your prescription or write a check. Consider a richly rewarding volunteer opportunity as a tutor in the adult literacy program, Partners in Reading of the San Jose Public Library. Work one-to-one or lead a small group with English-speaking adults, who read or write below the ninth grade level, to achieve their learning goals. Sign up now for the January 14 orientation and for the training on January 17 and January 24. Advanced registration is required.
Training, instructional materials, and on-going support are all provided free. No experience is necessary. Required commitment of two hours per week for at least six months. Call the San Jose Public Library at (408) 808-2361 to pre-regi
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be able to read and write at the 12th grade level or above and meet for at least two hours per week at any San Jose Public Library branch.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments:
Tutor Orientation Wednesday 1/14/09 6:00-8:00 p.m. Tutor Training Saturday 1/17/09 and 1/24/09 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. at the Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Library.
Tutor Training meets only at these times, but tutoring sessions are flexible once you are matched with an adult learner.
All sessions are required. Please register in advance.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Partners In Reading, San Jose Public Library

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Toys Needed for Hundreds of Children
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Donate new, unwrapped gifts for children not going home for the Holidays. Young children in our Adoption/Foster Care program; adolescent boys and girls at The Sanctuary, our Shelter for Runaway and Homeless Youth.
Please deliver gifts by December 14th.
- Adopt a Cottage by giving each boy a gift (12-15 boys to a cottage) OR one cottage gift to be shared (ping pong table, Entertainment Console, Sony PlayStation, DVD, CD Player, Pool table, etc.) Please deliver gifts by December 17th.
- Donate gifts suitable for mothers, fathers and siblings that the boys can wrap and take home for their families. These gifts will be put in our Santas Store, when youngsters buy gifts for their family members. We especially need gifts for dads and older siblings. Please deliver by December

House parents and professional support staff provide special care to these youth. They will be having a Thanksgiving Party on Tuesday, November 25th at 4:30pm at 14 Oakland Avenue and a Christmas Party on Tuesday, December 23rd at 4:30pm at 56 Davis Avenue. You can bring homebaked goods and holiday treats.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Volunteers- Distribute food for Thanksgiving
