Volunteers needed for Thanksgiving Dinner Distribution! Come volunteer to give out those boxes of food to the poor and homeless. 6 volunteers needed this day to help distribute all day.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Salvation Army of White Plains

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Albuquerque Rescue Mission: Collection Drive (Toiletries)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are a Christian ministry that provides food, shelter, training, clothing, education, mentoring and Biblical counsel to the homeless and near homeless population in the Albuquerque area. Our website address is http://www.abqrescue.org. Have your group collect toiletries that will be given to our clients. Examples of needed items include: toothbrushes, toothpaste, bath soap, shaving cream, disposable razors, shampoo, deodorant, lip balm, combs, tissues, shoelaces, hand/body lotion. NOTHING that contains alcohol or aerosol items.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help us Pack up our Beautiful Junk Sale-----The proceeds help the Jeffco Action Center and feed the hungry of Jefferson County
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need your groups help on Saturday, October 20th after 3:30pm. We have to pack up any left over product. This event is inside the Exhibition Hall at the Jefferson County Fairgrounds. We are very flexible. This is a great opportunity to help out a non-profit and receive volunteer hours for your group or yourself.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You must beable to be on your feet during your shift.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The sale ends at 4pm, so we need volunteers 4:00pm to about 6:30pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: ------Help us Set-Up our Beautiful Junk Sale----Proceeds from the Sale help us Feed the Hungery in Jefferson County
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need your or your groups help on Wednesday, October 17th, morning prefered but very flexible. You would be helping us set up and display items for sale on tables inside the Exhibition Hall at the Jefferson County Fairgrounds. This events helps us raise money for our Food Bank. It's fun and if you work 3 hours or more, you're able to purchase items yourself before the sale. Individuals and groups up to 60 people
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Able to be on your feet.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Very flexible this day. We prefer morning help but all day is great too. Please call for more details. 303-237-7704 ext 243----Ann Vorick is the Manager of Volunteer Programs

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Staff
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help Needed for Pet Adopt-A-Thon and Fall Festival The Prince William SPCA is looking for volunteers to assist with an event on October 18th. Volunteers are needed in the evening on Friday, October 18th for set up and all day on the 18th. Tasks include setting up tables, decorating, giving out information, working various booths, manning registration and operating children's games and activities. Pet lovers, teens, girl/boy scout troops, and 4-H members are welcome. To help, please contact Angie at volunteercoordinator@pwspca.org or through the hotline at 571/222-0033.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Under 18 must have guardian/parent/leader with them.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers needed 10/17 for set up from 4-9 PM. Volunteers needed all day 10/18 from 8 AM -5 PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Food for Thanksgiving!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Donate traditional Thanksgiving side dishes as well as other canned goods or dry goods like stuffing mix, cans of cranberry sauce, yams, peas, pumpkin, peaches, boxes of mashed potatoes, biscuit mix, rice, pasta, and gravy mix. Baskets are given to families for the Holiday. Please deliver food by November 14th.

Our website address is http://www.abqrescue.org. Have your group collect clean blankets that will be given to our clients.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Life Skills Meeting Discussion Leader
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Life Skills meetings help to further the residents\0092 learning and can be a lot of fun. Life Skills sessions can be on virtually any topic, but should be engaging enough to hold the interest of about twenty adult individuals. Topics in recent weeks have included money management, poetry, and employment. Topics presented can be on a subject area in which the speaker has training or education, is well knowledgeable.
This would be a great way for any person to obtain service hours, practice speaking and leadership skills or to simply give back to their community.
Volunteers are needed each Tuesday from the community to share their knowledge with our residents. This can be done with one or more persons and can be done as a lecture, discussion, presentation, small group discussion, et
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Our meeting is from 6-7pm. Please be punctual.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nurses needed!!!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: One of the largest drive-thru flu clinics in the nation and an emergency preparedness drill all in one! Nurses needed--come help your community and vaccinate the public. Volunteers will receive a free flu shot at the end of the day for their time, lunch is provided.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Nurses need to provide proof of licensure
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: volunteer arrival 8:30 am, ending approximately 3:30-4:00pm

This is an outdoor event, so volunteers should wear comfortable clothing, closed-toe shoes, hats and sunglasses. Volunteers must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time. Shifts available on both days: Friday: between 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., AND Saturday: between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. We ask for a minimum 2-hour commitment. This is an excellent famliy volunteer opportunity. Appropriate for volunteers age 12 and older.

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Report to registration table on Call Street (behind the Star Metro/TalTran bus station) at 8am. Plan on staying until noon.

We need twenty-five (25) "Kitchen/Cleaning Welcome Baskets for our clients. Have your group put together 1-25 baskets. We suggest laundry baskets filled with kitchen items and household cleaning agents, OR bathroom items and laundry cleaning agents. Baskets can be dropped off at the Adelante parking lot, 3900 Osuna N.E., on Friday, October 24 between 10:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Between 10:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Duke City Marathon will take place on Sunday, October 19. The race will start and end at the Albuquerque Convention Center, 401 Second N.W. Two hundred (200) volunteers needed between 6:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. on that day. Volunteers will be strategically assigned to locations throughout the course. VolunteerOpportunity.Title: 4-H Exploration Days
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Each year in June MSU hosts youth from across the state to experience three days of campus life! Youth stay in college dorms and attend fun, educational sessions during their stay. Adults are a very necessary part of this experience and can offer their services in a number of ways: Instructors - adults who are willing to teach sessions from building a bird house to canoeing, to caring for a beef project. County Conference Assistant - one female and one male adult are required from each county to serve as a communication link between the State 4-H Office staff and the county participants during the event. Chaperons - are required on a ratio of 1 to every 10 youth for both sexes (i.e. adult males for male youth; adult females for female youth). Chaperons may participate in the session
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 24/7 for three days

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Nicodemus Wilderness Project: Environmental Clean-up
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We provide volunteer opportunities that empower youth to help save the environment while they develop important leadership skills. To learn more about us, please visit our website at http://www.wildernessproject.org. 10 volunteers needed on Saturday, October 25, 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Volunteers will help with: 1) trail building; rehabilitation & soil erosion control; 2) native habitat restoration and side trail closures; and 3) trash clean-up and exotic vegetation removal. The project will take place at Piedra Lisa Open Space Trail (just south of the east end of Candelaria Road). We will provide: trail tools, equipment, refreshments, water and t-shirts. Children and teens (individuals and groups) are highly encouraged to participate. Volunteers should dress for the weather. Wea

Location.Address2: S. of the E. end of Candelaria Road

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Snowflake Ball
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Put on your dancing shoes Friday evening and join the Social Club for special needs adults from 7 - 9 pm on Dec. 12 for the Snowflake Ball. This swinging evening will be held in Rolling Meadows. Volunteers must be 16 years and older.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: North West Special Recreation - Special Olympics

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sunday in the Park
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers are needed to assist with children's games, supervise the pumpkin patch, and dress in costume for the Trick-or-Treat Trail for this annual family celebration of fall at Centennial Park. Join us and take in the sights, scents and sounds of an autumn afternoon!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Two shifts; 10 am - 2 pm or 2 pm to 6 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Angel Tree Gift Distribution
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Work takes place in a warehouse setting. Volunteers stay on the move picking up gifts and bringing them to check-out
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: must be able to walk, bend and pick-up

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Salvation Army - Mobile Area Command

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer - A Day of Bridge - Friday, November 7, 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Come and help raise awareness, friends and funds to help every adult in Nassau County write and speak ENGLISH!
Help us sell raffle tickets, set up and coordinate the event and hand out goodie bags.
The day in a nutshell: Over 100 paying guests play Bridge at Temple Emanu-El of East Meadow. We supply breakfast and a catered lunch from Ben's while our guests are involved in 3 hours of duplicate play. There is also a lesson with Michael Kufs of The Bridge School of Long Island.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Great Jack-O-Lantern Blaze Pumpkin Scoopers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Great Jack-O-Lantern Blaze, an exciting Halloween event at Van Cortlandt Manor, features a sea of 3,000 glowing jack-o-lanterns carpeting the historic landscape. Historic Hudson Valley is looking for volunteers to help launch this thriller! We will need volunteers to help us cut open and scoop pulp and seeds out of each pumpkin to prepare it for carving. The preparation of the pumpkins will take place approximately 5 days before the event. Please call to discuss volunteering on specific dates.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: minimum age is 8 with parental supervision
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers are needed for at least 3 hours between 9:30am and 2pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Blood Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The need for blood is urgent! The next blood drive at the ARC Westchester Chapter will be Friday, December 19th

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Great Jack-O-Lantern Blaze Pumpkin Lighters
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Great Jack-O-Lantern Blaze, an exciting Halloween event at Van Cortlandt Manor, features a sea of 3,000 glowing jack-o-lanterns carpeting the historic landscape. Historic Hudson Valley is looking for volunteers to help launch this thriller! We will need volunteers to help light votive candles inside each of 500 pumpkins every night of the event. Please call to discuss volunteering on specific dates.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: minimum age is 8 with parental supervision
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers are needed from 3:30pm to 6:30pm (3 hours prior to the event).

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Holiday Meal Servers

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Salvation Army - Mobile Area Command

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Senior Luncheon Assistant September
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help with the Senior Luncheon held at First Baptist Church on September 18. Duties could include decorating, serving food/drinks, table set-up and take-down.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers needed for set-up and clean-up as well as actual event. Set-up can begin as early as 8am. Clean-up can run until 2:30pm. Luncheon itself runs from 10am to 1pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteers Needed for Making Strides Against Breast Cancer 5-Mile Walk
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
HOPE STARTS WITH US!
More than just the name of an event, Making Strides Against Breast Cancer refers to the vital progress the American Cancer Society has made in helping people survive breast cancer through its unique programs and funding of ground-breaking research. But there is more to do. Join Making Strides Against Breast Cancer to help continue lifesaving progress so no one has to suffer from this disease. With your help, we will continue to make strides and change lives.
Since 1993, nearly 4 million walkers across the country have raised more than $280 million through Making Strides events to help fight breast cancer. Last year alone, dedicated supporters like you raised more than $50 million nationwide to help the American Cancer Society continue fighting breast cancer and
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Most volunteers will be needed somewhere between 7:00 am and 1:00 pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Angel Food Volunteer Worker
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Exciting opportunity to help distribute food to over 800 families one Saturday each month. Angel Food Ministries provides over $75 worth of restaurant quality food (and over 10 lbs of that is meat) for just $30. This program is designed to help those people and families who live paycheck to paycheck. Varied tasks and duties available.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9:30 to 11:30 unload truck 12:00 to 4:00 distribute food

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Gingerbread Extravaganza Greeter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide visitors to the Volusia Mall Gingerbread Extravaganza with information detailing the Gingerbread project and the charities it will benefit. You will greet visitors, hand out flyers, explain the project and the charities it will benefit.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Holiday season enjoyment
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Shifts are from noon - 3 pm and 3 pm - 6 pm daily to change closer to Christmas from noon - 4 pm and 4 pm - 8 pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
There are many exciting ways for volunteers to support Making Strides Against Breast Cancer of Westchester 2008. This is a great way to fight back against breast cancer and provide hope to all people facing the disease. Making Strides Against Breast Cancer is more than just a walk - it describes the amazing progress made to defeat this disease. Volunteers are needed for setup, clean up, first aid, refreshments, registration, walk-paper distribution and office support. Volunteers can also work the survivor tent, and be greeters/cheerers. Volunteers are needed at check in, product sales, and water stations.
Go to www.cancer.org/stridesonline for information and to register online or go to Westchester.Strides@cancer.org.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: must be over 16
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: registration 9am walk starts 11am

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Chefs Auction Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Work in registration, silent and live auction, greeting guests and check out.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Set-up Noon to 5:00 p.m. Event volunteer help needed 5:00-10:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Group project - Landscaping
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are looking for a group of volunteers to come and beautify our campus in Dobbs Ferry. This may include mulching, planting, pruning, weeding, etc.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: willing to work outside and get a little dirty

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: WHUR 96.3 Food 2 Feed- Food Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide supporters with information about the food bank and distribute promotional materials.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Masquerade
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come help our staff run a Masquerade event at The Historic Roosevelt Ballroom at the Philipsburgh Building, Yonkers, NY. This event is a costume party prior to Halloween and will help raise funds to support our residential program for children. The event is from 5-11:30 pm. Volunteers are needed to greet, sell raffle tickets, and help with set up. Come enjoy the fun and volunteer at the same time.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: The minimum age for this opportunity is 18. Helping at a fundraiser. Be willing and flexible to help out at this fun event which runs from 5:00 - 11:30 p.m.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers needed in shifts between 12:00 noon and 11:00 PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Camp Dragonfly Cabin Sitter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide companionship to small group of children from 9:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. on Friday and Saturday nights during the camp. Location: Camp Swatara, Bethel
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must be 18 or older; compassionate; willingness to listen and befriend a child. Recruitment begins in January and training is scheduled for April 25th, 2009 at Camp Swatara in Bethel.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Recruitment begins in Jan, however, cabin sitters are needed 05/29/09 and 05/30/09 from 9:30 pm to 11:00 pm at Camp Swatara, Bethel.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Presenters Needed to Support Youth With Disabilities
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Employment Works Youth Initiative supports transitioning youth with challenges and barriers to employment. We are looking for volunteers for our next program that starts October 6th to help the youth gain the skills and knowledge for obtaining employment. This curriculum engages youth with a variety of learning opportunities facilitated by local businesses, volunteers and Employment Works staff. As a volunteer you would help facilitate the Employment Course where youth are provided with job seeking skills. Topics include interviewing, job searching, resume building, application completion and understanding what to expect from employers during a job search. If you are interested in this great opportunity to impact future employees please email Jennifer Ross!!!

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Employment Works- High School High Tech

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Santa's Helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help the children at a residential center choose gifts for their parents/siblings at Santa's Store. This event is held on Thursday, December 11th from 12:30- 6:00 - any time you can give would be appreciated.This is a wonderful holiday experience. We fill the gym with donated holiday gifts for the kids to take home to a mom, dad and siblings. Training: none for this event but overview of program given. Activity Type: Working with clients/caregiver, Other
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: The minimum age for this opportunity unchaperoned is 16. The minimum age chaperoned is 12 . Interest in helping children around the Holidays
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Set up begins at 12:00 noon and the event runs until 6:00PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Computer Recycling
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: 2 day computer recycling drive. Must be able to lift computers from cars and load into semi.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Lifting over 20 #
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 12:00 - 4:00 both days

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Sunday, September 13, 2009 from 1-5:30 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HOMEWARD Hospice Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Experience the many rewards of being a hospice volunteer in homes, nursing facilities, and at the Isreal Family Hospice House in Ames. New Hospice Volunteer Training for Mary Greeley Medical Center HOMEWARD will take place at MGMC on November 1 and 8 from 8-4. Volunteers must attend all sessions. Training will cover all aspects of hospice concept, care, and additional services. Questions? Call 515-239-2210.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Preregistration required. Application, interview, and background check must be completed prior to training. Applicants also must be at least 18 years of age and have a desire to give back, listen, and comfort others. Persons experiencing a recent loss are encouraged to wait one year before volunteering for hospice.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Training: November 1, 8 8am-4pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: National Youth Service Day Project - Spring Gardening!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Work with other teens on a garden project at the beautiful Rockwood Mansion. Tools and fun will be provided. Help the Rockwood gardener with her favorite Spring chore - mulching! Meet in front of the Rockwood Mansion (note the mulch pile right there!) Follow the signs to the small parking lot near the carriage house/conference center or walk up the hill from the big lot and around to the far side of the house.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You must be able to work outdoors. Bring work gloves, close-toed shoes, a rake if you have one and your lunch.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Arrive by 12:30. Project will be completed by 3:30

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: General office knowledge, computer knowledge and the ability to type
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Healthy Families is a program 9-5, M-F. Your help at any time and for any amount of time will make a difference.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers work in booths for various sales like books & food (i.e. bratwurst), and give tours around the festival. A fun event that features different aspects of German Heritage entertainment (including German beer and a German band).

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: None however please indicate if you are bilingual in the comments section

This opportunity is best suited for volunteers 18 years and older with great imaginations!

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Durham Parks & Rec Dept - Edison Johnson Cntr

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Great American Beer Festival, America's oldest and largest beer festival, is dedicated to educating the consumer about the vast spectrum and quality of beers currently produced in the United States. Volunteers assist in all areas including set up, beer pouring, merchandise, security, volunteer coordination and more.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Event Task Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer needed for various tasks
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Time & Date are subject to change. This event usually is 6-9pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: CFC Data Entry Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer will go through CFC (Combined Federal Campaign) applications and enter information into Access database. This can be done anytime after April 16 and will be a short term project lasting about 15-20 hours. This can be done everyday for a week, or spaced out a bit more according to your availability. We have other data entry projects in our office, so if you enjoy this one and are looking for something more long-term, we invite you to stay for one of our other opportunities.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Attention to detail. Comfortable with computers. No need to "know" Access; we can train you how to enter the data.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We are very flexible and can work around your schedule during business hours (8:30-5:00)

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Easter Egg Hunts start at 1pm. Volunteers needed to arrive by 12:15pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nutcracker Audience Survey Leaders
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: * Dress is business formal (i.e. no blue jeans, please!) * Please arrive promptly * 2 Survey Leaders will be stationed at a small table in the lobby. During intermission, we will ask you to actively (but politely!) engage audience members in fulfilling a survey. * Since this job takes place right in the middle of Nutcracker performances, then Ballet Lubbock will give you 2 complimentary tickets for another weekend performance time. * Materials (surveys & pencils) and a few \0093talking points\0094 will be provided, to aid in your work and to help you explain to others why it is so valuable to fulfill an audience survey.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nutcracker Ushers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: * Dress is business formal (i.e. no blue jeans, please!) * Please arrive promptly * Inside the Civic Center Theatre, you will help audience members locate their seats * A seating chart will be provided (since seats are reserved) * You should also be prepared to assist people in getting up and down the stairs that lead to their seats * Ushers should be able to act quickly: once the performance starts, then latecomers need to be seated as quickly and accurately as possible. * Being good at giving directions is a definite plus! * At the conclusion of your volunteer service, you are welcome to claim an unoccupied seat to watch the performance!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Help with kids on their day off!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Leap into fun on your day off of school from 10am-3:30 Tuesday November 11th with special needs children. There will be bowling, eating lunch at McDonalds & going to a movie. Volunteer pay their own way for lunch and movie. Transportation will be provided

SponsoringOrganization.Name: North West Special Recreation - Special Olympics

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nutcracker Program Passers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: * Dress is business formal (i.e. no blue jeans, please!) * Please arrive promptly * Program passers will stand at the doors between the Civic Center theatre foyer and the actual theatre * Greet each person who passes you into the theatre, and offer them a program book * Help maintain traffic flow by directing people to consult the ushers (inside) for seating assistance * At the conclusion of your volunteer service, you are welcome to claim an unoccupied seat to watch the performance!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nutcracker Ticket-takers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: * Dress is business formal (i.e. no blue jeans, please!) * Please arrive promptly * Ticket-takers will stand at the doors on the threshold of the Theatre foyer * Greet each person who enters * Request each person\0092s ticket, read the printed date, tear at the perforation, and return the larger portion to the audience member * At the conclusion of your volunteer service, you are welcome to claim an unoccupied seat to watch the performance!

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers needed in various roles for this fun evening. The Forsyth County walk is an easy stroll through Old Salem beginning in Corpening Plaza. Walks are also held at Tanglewood Park in Clemmons, Fourth of July Park in Kernersville, and Walkertown Civic Park.

School group dismissal will be announced, so you will just need

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Sidewalk Volunteer--Star City Holiday Parade
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help make the Star City Holiday Parade a litter free event. Fifty volunteers are needed to work a one to two block area along the parade route to provide an easy way for people watching the parade to get rid of their trash. It's a rewarding experience as you'll receive a lot of "thank you's" and you'll still get to watch the parade. Registration by November 1 will help us order enough sweatshirts. We ask all volunteers for a $5 contribution toward to cost of the sweatshirts, of which Pfizer Inc pays the other half.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Ability to bend over to pick up litter, friendly, willing to interact with people.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wheelchair Ramp/ Make A Difference Day Projects
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Wheelchair Ramp in partnership with Ascension Council on Aging and Shell S.E.R.V.E volunteers. Make a Difference Day projects include the following: magazine and book drives for nursing homes/hospitals. Food drive for local food pantries. Hold a food drive, do home repairs for elderly and disabled citizens and cleanup parks and roadways. Donate food for the needy, pick up litter, and entertain nursing home residents. Pitch in restocking homeless shelters, organizing community cleanups, visiting nursing homes. Collect clothing for the area agencies. Spruce up neighborhoods, roads and parks; raise the spirits of the needy with home repairs. Fill wish lists of poor children in need of clothing and shoes, toothbrushes and school supplies. Bring comfort to sick kids in area hospitals on
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Work clothes and carpentry tools
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: National Make A Difference Day is celebrated on the 4th Saturday in October in Ascension Parish. In 2006 it will be Saturday, October 28th.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Therapeutic Recreation Halloween Social Volunteer - October
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help adults with disabilities enjoy dancing and playing games. Join us for one or more of our dance/socials. Volunteers needed to help participants get involved in dance and games. This is our Halloween dance, so please wear a costume.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers should be 17 years old with some experience or exposure to people with disabilities.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Dance/Social runs from 6:30 - 8pm. Volunteers needed to stay for clean-up (usually lasts only an additional 15 -20 minutes).

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Children's Festival Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with set-up, clean-up and/or children's activities (such as face-painting, games, arts & crafts) at annual Children's Festival under the direction of Hanover County Parks and Recreation staff.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must meet with June Snead, recreation coordinator, to review volunteer duties and expectations.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Event runs from 10am to 2pm. Volunteers may be needed as early as 8am and as late as 4pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Connection Club Volunteer - December
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers needed to help adults with disabilities participate in recreational activities (arts and crafts, sports & games) .
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers should be at least 18 years old and have some experience or exposure with people with disabilities
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Club meets from 10am to 1pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Community Connection Club Volunteer - November
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteers needed to help adults with disabilities participate in recreational activities (arts and crafts, sports & games) plus helping participants with lunch including getting to/from the dining hall on campus of Randolph Macon College.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers should be 18 years old with some experience or exposure to people with disabilities
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Club meets from 10am to 1pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Therapeutic Recreation Social Volunteer - Holiday Social
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help adults with disabilities enjoy dancing and playing games. Join us for one or more of our dance/socials. Volunteers needed to help participants get involved in dance and games.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Volunteers should be 17 years of age, plus have some experience or exposure to people with disabilities.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Dance/social runs from 6:30 to 8pm. Volunteers also needed to help with set-up and clean-up (6 to 8:30pm)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Efest Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Sarasota Bay Estuary Program needs volunteers to staff our booth at Efest on Saturday Nov 15 and sunday November 16 from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm at the Lakewood Ranch polo grounds
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must enjoy talking with the public and want to learn about Sarasota Bay.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We need volunteers from 7:30am to 6:00pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Information Services
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Could include one, but not all, of the following: Translating services; resource and information library; computer access.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Fluent in Spanish.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Will not be every day of week -- will work with volunteer's availability and family need.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Professional Services
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Could include one, but not all, of the following: Accounting services; legal services; alternative therapies; family counseling; individual counseling for primary caregiver, spouse or siblings; haircuts for the family.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Proof of therapy license and other professional credentials where applicable.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Will not be every day of week - will work with volunteer's availability.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Transportation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Transportation to hospital for treatment visits; transportation to school or activities for patient or siblings
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must have current driver's license and proof of insurance if driving own car
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Will not be everyday of week, times will vary depending on patient needs. Will work with volunteer's availability.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Childcare Services
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Babysitting service for family -- could be performed at home or in waiting room of hospital; and/or tutoring for siblings
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: CPR certification preferred
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Days and times will vary by family need -- will not be everyday of week, will work with volunteer's availability

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Home Maintenance Services
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Could include one or more, but not all, of the following services: Housecleaning; laundry services; handyman services; lawn & garden care; pet care; home modifications for disability access; industrial cleaning
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Hours will vary depending on service, but very flexible with volunteer's availability

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Nutrition Services to Home or Temporary Housing
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Grocery delivery to the home or temporary housing of family; prepared meal delivery
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: flexible with volunteer's availability - usually one day a week only!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Assist with fundraiser dinner event
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Spaghetti Dinner fundraiser need volunteers to set-up and serve from 5:00 - 8:00 PM on Friday March 6 2009. Dinner benefits disabled adults. Volunteers must be 15 years & older.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Party Face Painters
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Calling all artists! Face painter needed for children's party on Dec. 6th, 10 - 11:30 a.m. or 12 - 1:30 p.m. or 2 - 3:30p.m., in Arlington Heights, for counseling center serving pregnant women and needy families. Please bring your own painting supplies for the party. Volunteer must be 16 & older.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Wrapper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need volunteers (groups welcomed) to helps us sort and wrap the Christmas items that were donated for the Y-CAP youth; as well as help us decorate the Y-CAP room for the Christmas Party.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Begin at 10:00AM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Trail Blazin' Saturday
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: On the 4th Saturday, get your group together and participate in trail blazing. Help maintain our trails by fixing edge boards, spreading gravel and clearing overgrowth on the three miles of trails that meander through the lake, meadow and forest habitats. In inclement weather, volunteers can assist in the speciality beds on the lawn, by weeding and planting new plants in the beds.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Enthusiastic, enjoy hard work, don't mind getting dirty and love the outdoors.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Saturday, September 27 or Saturday, October 25, 9 a.m. until noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Elves for All Year 'Round
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Elves are needed even after the annual Warren Village Holiday Shops. Gifts that are not distributed at the shop are sorted and stored for distribution to families throughout the year. We need your help setting up the Year "Round Shops for Warren Village families and Warren Village programs. Volunteers will size new clothing and set up for distribution.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Ability to sort and help store gift items away safely. Some volunteers will need to lift items up to 25 lbs. Other volunteers will sort and lift only smaller items.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: One to three shifts available (morning, afternoon or evening) depending on availability of volunteers. Please call to schedule.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fun day with special needs children on their day off of school
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Leap into fun on your day off from school from 9:30 - 3:30 on Tuesday Nov 11th with special needs children. There will be bowling, eating lunch at McDonalds, & going to a movie. Volunteers pay their own way for lunch & a movie. Ages 14 & older. Transportation provided.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: North West Special Recreation - Special Olympics

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Santa and his helpers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Be Santa, or his helper! You'll spend the afternoon taking photos of adorable animals at Petsmart's Pictures with Santa, to benefit Precious Pets Almost Home. There are plenty of things to do: put on The Costume and help pose the pets, take the photos, develop them and get them ready for the customer. It's a blast!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Santa's Mailbag Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Covenant Medical Center is looking for groups and individuals who are interested in helping with our Santa's Mailbag program. Santa's Mailbag is an annual program designed to continue the magic of Santa. Covenant staffs volunteer "elves" to answer all those letters written to the Jolly Man in Red! Beginning on December 5 and continuing through December 20, we are in need of creative, holiday spirited people to help. The North Pole Room will be open from 7:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday during those dates. Appointments can also be made for weekend and after hours time. Treats and holiday music are provided!
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Holiday spirit!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: The North Pole Room will be open from 7:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday during those dates. Appointments can also be made for weekend and after hour times.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HANDS ACROSS THE COUNTY - Face to Face
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Providing care and support to 500 people living with AIDS or HIV and prevention education to the entire Sonoma County Community. Volunteers needed to paint the main office, volunteers with any painting experience a plus!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9-12noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Basket Project
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help assemble boxes for food distribution for Christmas! We need lots of people to help with this event. Please call and register or sign up online if you are interested! Groups are welcome!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8 am - Noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HANDS ACROSS THE COUNTY-BIELLA SCHOOL
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help weeding, planting, spreading mulch/compost and a library project
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9-12noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: HANDS ACROSS THE COUNTY - REDWOOD EMPIRE FOOD BANK
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help sort and pack food into 2lb bags
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9-12noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Spirit Walk Shepherds
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The 14th Annual Spirit Walk is a night-time tour of historic downtown Charlottesville peopled by costumed "spirits" of long-gone residents. Shepherds assist the costumed guides during the tour to ensure the safety of the group.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Some uneven terrain.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Volunteers are asked to work a specific 2 hour shift on either October 17,18, and 19.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Thanksgiving Day Volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We cook and deliver 3000 meals on Thanksgiving Day. This is our 8th year. www.licensetodream.org we need help with drivers to deliver the meals and a few people to help assemble the food.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Must have their own car. Maps and directions supplied.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9 AM till 1 PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Rake A Difference Day Volunteer Team
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Volunteer teams are needed to rake yards for local seniors, persons living with disabilities and families in need. A group leader serves as primary contact. Matches are made through the Volunteer Center office. Raking is completed between October 24 and November 2. Express your interest! Complete registration form by October 10th. Go to www.volunteercvs.org or call 651-439-7434.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Physically Able to rake and lift bags of leaves. Reponsible and Caring.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make a Difference Day 2008: Community Drive for plush animals, blankets and diapers for kids in need
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help us meet the need of children impacted by violence by collecting 500 plush animals, 500 diapers and 500 blankets that day. Our goal is to surpass last year's efforts when 175 volunteers delivered over 3000 items to kids in need. Space is limited. Visit our web site participant agreement forms and further information regarding this unique and powerful project. 4th Saturday in October 10/25 10am-1pm
Location is sent to participants after registration is complete.
All volunteers need to bring donations that day.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: All volunteers need to bring donations.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 10am-1pm Location is sent once you have registered. Space is limited and fills up quickly.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Service Saturday: Eastern Community Food Bank
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We will be sorting and packing food items for the food bank. We will also tour the facility. Sign up is required at any Student Activities Office. There are a limited number of volunteer spaces available.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9am-12pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Emergency Preparedness Exercise Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The City of Alexandria and Arlington County need you to volunteer to help test our ability to deliver medications to residents during a public health emergency. Volunteering takes about 30 minutes on Saturday, November 8, 2008. Just walk into one of the five exercise sites between 9:00 a.m. and noon to pick up simulated medications for yourself, your family and any neighbors you would assist in the event of a real emergency.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We would like as many people as possible to be there at 9:00 a.m. but people can come as late as 12:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Emergency Preparedness Exercise Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The City of Alexandria and Arlington County need you to volunteer to help test our ability to deliver medications to residents during a public health emergency. Volunteering takes about 30 minutes on Saturday, November 8, 2008. Just walk into one of the five exercise sites between 9:00 a.m. and noon to pick up simulated medications for yourself, your family and any neighbors you would assist in the event of a real emergency.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We would like for as many people as possible to be there at 9:00 a.m. but people can come as late as 12:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Thursdays in the Park
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: October 23 & 30 Volunteer Thursdays in the Park \0096 Sycamore Restoration Site at One Mile Recreation Area (2:00 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.). Volunteers will remove invasive plants, and water native plants. Meet at the north end of Caper Acres play area at One Mile

Location.Address2: Acres at One Mile Rec in Lower Park

VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 2 to 4:30 pm on Thursdays

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Downtown Child Care Center (1105 Candelaria N.W.): Collection Drive
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Our year round preschool is in need of art supplies (watercolors, markers, glue, construction paper, etc.). We would also appreciate your used computer and copy paper for the children to draw on.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Santa Fe Habitat for Humanity: Construction
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Come and build with us on one of our projects. We build new construction and we can use your help with framing, drywall, roofing, painting and finish work. Thirty (30) volunteers needed on Friday, October 24, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Oshara Village, Santa Fe. We will provide all tools and materials, as well as refreshments. All skill levels are welcome to construct with us. Volunteers should be prepared to get dirty, wear closed-toed shoes, bring hats, sunscreen, water bottles, and dress in layers. Donations and funds are welcome!

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Mayor's Office of Volunteerism and Engagement

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: z (PROJECT FULL) Habitat Home Construction - Community Service Day 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Habitat for Humanity of Montgomery County, MD Inc. (HfH-MC) is building 24 town homes in Burtonsville, MD! This build consists of two phases, with 12 homes being built in each phase. The first phase began in Summer 2006 and all twenty four homes are scheduled for completion by 2008. These homes are built almost entirely by volunteers and Habitat partner families. No experience is necessary, just a willing attitude, and a desire to help. Please note that we do ask all volunteers to make a full day commitment to HfH-MC (approximately 8:30am-3:30pm- the time may vary depending on the day and the crew). Please arrive on time and plan to stay for the entire day.
Habitat for Humanity-Montgomery County has other volunteer opportunities available in addition to our construction site. Please vi
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: This is a day for individuals, not groups.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Habitat for Humanity Of Montgomery County Maryland, Inc. (Approved SSL MCPS)

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wood Stork Festival - Face Painters
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: There will be a booth set up at the festival for Face Painting! We need face-painters!
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Experience nice, but not required. Must be able to attend a meeting prior to the event - date and location of the meeting will be posted closer to the event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Festival runs from 11am - 6pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD St. Martin's Hospitality Center: Cleaning/Painting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We serve the homeless population. Our website address is http://www.smhc-nm.org. 8-14 volunteers needed to perform touch-up painting of picnic tables, doors, baseboards. Repaint doors, parking lot; reorganize the kitchen area, at 1201 Third Street N.W. All are small areas. Help needed on Friday, October 24, 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. We will provide all materials, refreshments and lunch. Minimum age: 15

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Plant the Wetlands along San Francisquito Creek with Save The Bay (Palo Alto)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Restore this unique wetland habitat that was saved from development in the 1950s and is now home to many native species, including shorebirds and fish such as steelhead trout. Volunteers will plant native species like white yarrow and meadow barley to improve habitat for endangered wildlife. Other activities may include shoreline cleanups, watering and work in our on-site native plant nursery.
Due to the sensitive nature of the restoration site, space is limited and RSVP is requested. Please complete the online registration form for yourself or a group, and note that we will contact you with other potential project dates if we can't fit your group on the project date that you have requested.
If you need more information about this or other events please contact Sarah Lyons, Administr
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: No experience necessary, all ages welcome. Gloves, tools and all instruction are provided. Each event is led by Save The Bay staff, who are certified in CPR and Wilderness First Aid and all site projects have been planned to insure safety.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9:00am-12noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Christmas Present Wrapper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We have Christmas presents for 300 people with disabilities that have no family to wrap .We have the gift wrapping supplies, just need the help.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Get Involved: Connecting to Volunteering in Lubbock
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
We need YOU! We know that YOU have special skills and talents that can better our community, but do you know how or where to serve?
Come spend an hour with us to learn more about our community's needs, explore where volunteers can serve, and discover how YOU can make an impact by volunteering! Everyone in the Lubbock area is invited to attend!
New Volunteer Orientations will be held several times each month at the Volunteer Center of Lubbock's Conference Room, located at 1706 23rd Street (corner of 23rd Street and Avenue Q). To register for one of these orientations, just "express interest" on the right for the date/time that works best for you! For more information, contact Brandi Willis Schreiber at 747-0551 or bschreiber@volunteerlubbock.org.
"You cannot do all the go

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Childcare Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Set-up play area. Greet interact and play with children while parents are completing applicant forms. Clean-up and put away play area. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Enjoy children.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Casa Angelica: Collection Drive (batteries/toiltries/laundry supplies)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are a home for children with pervasive needs. We provide a family-centered program for 16 children and young adults with personalized, active treatment plans designed to enhance each individual's unique gifts through spiritual, educational and social development. To learn more about us, please visit our website at http://www.casaangelica.org. Have your group conduct a collection drive for any of the following items: C and D size batteries, antibacterial liquid soap, body wash, hair detangler, laundry detergent, fabric softener, bleach, 33-gallon trash bags and 13-gallon trash bags.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD People Living Through Cancer: Other
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We provide peer-facilitated support groups and one-to-one contact for cancer survivors and their caregivers,. To learn more about us, please visit our website at http://www.pltc.org. 4-5 volunteers needed to distribute brochures and gift bags to doctor officers and medical centers on October 24 or 25, 10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Volunteers will drive their personal vehicle. We will provide refreshments & lunch.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Either date between 10:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Native Plant Nursery Wednesday Workday with Save The Bay (Palo Alto)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteer in our native plant nursery and learn about local, native plants like coyote bush, jaumea and salt grass as you help us plant these native species into the wetlands. Other activities may include collecting seeds, making plant cuttings and other nursery duties like planting in the demonstration garden.
Due to the sensitive nature of the restoration site, space is limited and RSVP is requested. Please complete this online registration form for yourself or a group, and note that we will contact you with other potential project dates if we can't fit your group on the project date that you have requested.
If you need more information about this or other events please contact Sarah Lyons, Administrative Assistant at (510) 452-9261 x119 or email bayevents@saveSFbay.org.
To reg
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: No experience necessary, all ages welcome. Gloves, tools and all instruction are provided. Each event is led by Save The Bay staff, who are certified in CPR and Wilderness First Aid and all site projects have been planned to insure safety.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Wetlands Restoration Project along San Francisquito Creek with Save The Bay (Palo Alto)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Restore this unique wetland habitat that was saved from development in the 1950s by concerned citizens and is now home to many native species, including shorebirds and fish such as steelhead trout. Remove non-native, invasive species like horehound and Russian thistle to make way for native plants like white yarrow and meadow barley. Other activities include shoreline cleanups, watering and work in our on-site native plant nursery.
Due to the sensitive nature of the restoration site, space is limited and RSVP is requested. Please complete the online registration form for yourself or a group, and note that we will contact you with other potential project dates if we can't fit your group on the project date that you have requested.
If you need more information about this or other event
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: No experience necessary, all ages welcome. Gloves, tools and all instruction are provided. Each event is led by Save The Bay staff, who are certified in CPR and Wilderness First Aid and all site projects have been planned to insure safety.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9:00am-12noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Santa Helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with Santa's visit during recipient intake week. Greet children and parents. Take pictures. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Red Ribbon Campaign Project Manager and volunteers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Person needed to head up the Red Ribbon Campaign and volunteers to help distribute red ribbon display boxes around the Natrona County. The project manager would also be in charge of the distribution of display boxes, overseeing volunteers, PSA's, media releases, helping with the press conference, advertising, working with the "Over the Limit. Under Arrest" campaign committee, working with MADD's Project Manager.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Good communication and interpersonal skills, ability to work independently and in a team environment, must subscribe to the purposes and policies of MADD and comfortable working with people of diverse backgrounds.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Flexible, whenever volunteers have time.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Face Painting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Birds of Prey Foundation needs face painters for our Annual Pumpkin Patch Celebration held at the Rock Creek Farm. We will supply you with paint and brushes--we need your talent. If you enjoy working with children and painting, please join us.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 11 AM to 4 PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Middle Run Tree Planting
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help plant 400 trees in New Castle County's Middle Run Natural Area.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Registration is required for this event. Please contact Catherine Owens (contact info above) to register and learn precise location of tree planting within the park.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: We will be planting and caging trees from 9am-12pm, but feel free to come by for a shorter time if desired.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Project Elf Shoppers
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We will be purchasing Christmas presents for 300 people with Disabilities that have no family.Each shopper is given a list of wants, and then shopper locates the items at a value not to exceed $25, and brings them to a designated register, for Project Elf Coordinator pays for them.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 9am-1pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Make A Difference Day Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Make A Difference Day is the \0093national day of doing good.\0094 It is the largest community service effort in the nation, rallying corporations, government leaders, charitable organizations and everyday Americans into action on one day. It was created by USA WEEKEND Magazine and Points of Light Foundation.
For the eighth consecutive year, HandsOn Santa Clarita, formerly the Volunteer Resource Center of SCV, in cooperation with the City of Santa Clarita will host Make A Difference Day. Make A Difference Day projects are \0093hands-on\0094 and produce visible positive results in one day.
The committee is anticipating that more than 1,000 SCV residents will participate in 40+ projects on Make A Difference Day 2008. Business groups, religious organizations, school clubs, families and individuals

Location.Address1: Projects will take place all over

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: requirements vary by specific project site.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments:
Breakfast Rally @ Valencia Town Center from 8am - 9am
Projects will be from 9 am to 1pm

SponsoringOrganization.Name: City of Santa Clarita Volunteer Opportunities

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Step Out: Walk To Fight Diabetes
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Step Out: Walk to Fight Diabetes, formerly America's Walk for Diabetes, is about changing the face of diabetes in our country\0097by raising funds to help find a cure and by walking a few miles to bring a greater awareness to this devastating disease. Step Out is a whirlwind day packed with energy, fun, support for others and a perfect amount of selfless dedication. We will have a variety of jobs & tasks throughout the day and day before the event with different time slots available to volunteer. Come join in on a great event. The Walk will start finish at the Denver Aquarium on Saturday October 25, 2008. We will need volunteers starting as early as 6:00AM until 3:00PM.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Jobs/tasks that will be available are as follows: Walker Registration, Set-up and clean-up, Breakfast & Lunch service, Walk marshals, Cheer Leaders at the start/finish, Parking lot attendants, Greeters, Rest Stop Attendants, Route markers and much much more!! Event is Saturday October 25, 2008 at the Denver Aquarium. Variety of jobs & time slots available from 6:00AM throughout the day. We will also need some assistance the day before on Friday October 24, 2008 if available.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Jobs/tasks that will be available are as follows: Walker Registration, Set-up and clean-up, Breakfast & Lunch service, Walk marshals, Cheer Leaders at the start/finish, Parking lot attendants, Greeters, Rest Stop Attendants, Route markers and much much more!! Event is Saturday October 25, 2008 at the Denver Aquarium. Variety of jobs & time slots available from 6:00AM throughout the day. We will also need some assistance the day before on Friday October 24, 2008 if available.

VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Race day setup, tear down, serve on specific race committees and cleanup. Step Out is a whirlwind day packed with energy, fun, support for others and a perfect amount of selfless dedication. We will have a variety of jobs & tasks throughout the day and day before the event with different time slots available to volunteer. Come join in on a great event. The Walk will start finish at the Denver Aquarium on Saturday October 25, 2008. We will need volunteers starting as early as 6:00AM until 3:00PM.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Jobs/tasks that will be available are as follows: Walker Registration, Set-up and clean-up, Breakfast & Lunch service, Walk marshals, Cheer Leaders at the start/finish, Parking lot attendants, Greeters, Rest Stop Attendants, Route markers and much much more!! Event is Saturday October 25, 2008 at the Denver Aquarium. Variety of jobs & time slots available from 6:00AM throughout the day. We will also need some assistance the day before on Friday October 24, 2008 if available
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Different time slots available from 6am to 3pm

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: MDD Rio Grande Community Farm: Landscaping/Yard Work
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Our mission is to connect people, food and public land by demonstrating sustainable urban agriculture and community food security; creating education and training opportunities; celebrating the traditions and culture of agriculture; and providing an urban wildlife habitat. Our website address is http://www.riograndefarm.org. We could use the help of 5-25 volunteers on Friday and/or Saturday, October 24 or 25, 8:00 a.m. to noon. Volunteers will help with clean up of Los Poblanos fields located at 1701 Montano Road N.W. This will be our annual breakdown of vegetable fields. Volunteers will take down trellis, clean out weeds, store equipment, etc. This projects involves physical activity; volunteers should bring work gloves and beverages. Minimum age: 16
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Friday and/or Saturday, 8:00 a.m. to noon

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Keeping the Coalition Office Clean !!!
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Coalition to End Homelessness is looking for a volunteer to clean the agency offices. Duties will include keeping the floors shiny, emptying waste baskets and general cleaing in offices and restrooms.
After registering : you MUST contact Mrs. Paulette Pryor (954)-792-4000 Ext.229 or by email: ppryor@help4homeless.org

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Grayson's Gift Super Kids Night
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: A monthly gathering at Chick-fil-A of families of children with disabilities. Volunteers needed for setup and takedown of Sign In Table, MC games and playing with kids.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Neat Stuff (FX) (YVC Friendly)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help sort, count and distribute clothing, school uniforms, and other accessories at Neat Stuff Inc., where abused, neglected and other at-risk children can go on a free shopping spree. Help them get the \0093stuff\0094 they need for school or play. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 13.
YVC FRIENDLY: Youth volunteers can attend this project without an adult, if they are already a member of the Youth Volunteer Corps Program. To be a member of the YVC, please attend a HOM101 Orientation.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Fall Volunteer Naturalist
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with environmental education by leading school groups on hike at the Howard County Conservancy - the county's only environmental education center.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Available some weekdays

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: The Boulevard Boo! Parade & Carnival
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
We are looking for volunteers to assist with the parade, judging and carnival. We will need barricade volunteers to assist with street closure, staging managers, judging and volunteers to help at the carnival.
1. Barricade Volunteers (9 AM to 2 PM) This job requires 65-75 volunteers.
2. Staging Guides (9 AM to 2 PM): In There are 5 staging areas needing 1-2 volunteers each. This job requires 15-20 volunteers.
3. Water Dispersal (9 AM to 2 PM): This position requires about 5 volunteers to help load water on the Golf Cart for other volunteers to distribute water.
4. Golf Cart Drivers (9 AM to 2 PM): These volunteers will be responsible for delivering the water throughout the parade and assisting in loading and off loading.
5. Parade Guides (9 AM to 2 PM): This j

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Translator
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide good customer service to participants of Holiday Bureau. Help those who need it with English communication. Especially need individuals who speak Spanish. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors, and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses & individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Spanish speaking skills.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Specific times yet to be determined.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Santa Helper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Assist with Santa's visit during the recipient intake week. Greet children and parents. Take pictures. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors, and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Specific times are yet to be determined.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Match Coordinator
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Using information from our database, match recipients and sponsors for this program. Assist in collection of data. Work closely with the Holiday Bureau Coordinator. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors, and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Specific times are yet to be determined.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Registration Assistant
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide good customer service to participants of Holiday Bureau. Assist recipients. Clarify information on their applications. Welcome children and offer toys while parents fill out forms. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors, and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Compassion, confidentiality and good communication skills.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Specific times are yet to be determined.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday Bureau Greeter
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Provide good customer service to participants of Holiday Bureau during registration periods. Welcome recipients. Provide information and answer questions. Spanish speaking abilities are appreciated. The Holiday Bureau was designed to brighten the holidays for people in need. We match families, seniors, and adults with disabilities to organizations, businesses and individuals who want to share their good fortune.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Communication skills and interest in helping others.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Specific time periods have yet to be determined.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Community Volunteer Service and Senior Centers

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Ghost Tour Cook
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Ghost Tours focus on the history of the Wyoming Territorial Prison State Historic Site and the history of the City of Laramie. Ghost Tours, as the name would suggest, also incorporates a more ghastly aspect of history. Volunteers help out behind the scenes by providing food for tour guides and performers during Ghost Tours. Ghost Tour Cooks volunteer to help provide food for the 80+ volunteers for one night during the 7 day event.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: October 18th, 23rd, 24th, 25th, 29th, 30th, and 31st.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: Wyoming Territorial Prison State Historic Site

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Get Involved: Connecting to Volunteering in Lubbock
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
We need YOU! We know that YOU have special skills and talents that can better our community, but do you know how or where to serve?
Come spend an hour with us to learn more about our community's needs, explore where volunteers can serve, and discover how YOU can make an impact by volunteering! Everyone in the Lubbock area is invited to attend!
New Volunteer Orientations will be held several times each month at the Volunteer Center of Lubbock's Conference Room, located at 1706 23rd Street (corner of 23rd Street and Avenue Q). To register for one of these orientations, just "express interest" on the right for the date/time that works best for you! For more information, contact Brandi Willis Schreiber at 747-0551 or bschreiber@volunteerlubbock.org.
"You cannot do all the go

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Bad Dates Lighting Assistant at Theatre Memphis
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Helps light designer rig the instruments. Assists light designer during tech. May run the light board during performance.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach you. While it is preferable for the consistency of the show that crew members are available for all the listed dates, it is only mandatory to be available for half. Please visit the Theatre Memphis web site at www.theatrememphis.org
Everyone who volunteers with Theatre Memphis will get a comp voucher for a free ticket to the shows for which they have helped.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Tech times vary, but are mostly in the evening b/t 6:30-10:30. Performances are Wed/Thurs. 6:30-10:30 PM, Fri/Sat 7-11PM, Sun 1-5PM. Please call Amy Salerno Hale for a detailed schedule.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Miami Children's Museum Arts and Crafts (FX) (YVC Friendly)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Miami Children\0092s Museum Arts and Crafts! Join us for an evening of arts and crafts at the Miami Children\0092s Museum. Volunteers will participate in artsy activities with the children who are visiting the museum. (3-5 volunteers)
Volunteers will MEET at the front entrance of the museum (under the cone)for the Volunteer Leader.
Project Location: Downtown Miami
YVC FRIENDLY: Youth volunteers can attend this project without an adult, if they are already a member of the Youth Volunteer Corps Program. To be a member of the YVC, please attend a HOM101 Orientation.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Center Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Are you a new Volunteer Center Agency Partner? Are you a nonprofit organization who has never been an Agency Partner and you're curious about membership benefits? Or have you been an Agency Partner for years but aren't quite sure if you're utilizing all our services? Then sign up to attend one of our Volunteer Center Orientations! Come learn about membership benefits and how to take advantage of them, discover other services the Volunteer Center offers, and network with fellow nonprofit organization peers. Come with all the questions you've ever had about our programs and services! This orientation is open to all area agency staff and board members and will be held at the Volunteer Center of Lubbock Conference Room - located at 1706 23rd Street (corner of 23rd Street and Avenue Q) -
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:30 a.m. - 9:30 a.m. the third Tuesday of each month

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: EcoFest Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
EcoFest Santa Cruz is a FREE environmental educational outreach event for the public.
EcoFest Santa Cruz is an event to publicize and commemorate the City of Santa Cruz\00C2’s numerous environmentally focused programs. Public and private entities will be invited to participate in this event through hosting display booths, participating in public presentations and lectures, children\00C2’s activities, outdoor displays and demonstrations. The \00C2“EcoFest Santa Cruz\00C2” event is scheduled for November 15, 2008, located within the Civic Auditorium and outside on Church Street. The event will bring together community groups from a variety of backgrounds in a festival setting to celebrate past triumphs and future goals.
The City of Santa Cruz, along with a collaboration of governm
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Friendly, Responsible, Dependable. Ability to lift objects greater than 50lbs; to stand for extended periods of time; to communicate well with general public; to work well with others.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: EcoFest Santa Cruz is scheduled for 10AM to 5PM. Volunteer Training TBA.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Tutoring Children at HANDY
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
HANDY, Inc is looking for volunteers to assist with its tutoring program. The program consists of helping youth learn and study different subjects each day as well as assist individuals with some FCAT prep.
Volunteer resposibilities will be to assist tutors with photo copying and setting up for tutoring sessions while helping other youth with any assignments that they may not comprehend.
And additional orientation and a background check will be required before a volunteer can become a mentor.
After registering you MUST contact: Linsey Brewster/Latoria Seet 954-523-7210 ext 201 and 205 954-709-4416/954-588-2387 handyrh@bellsouth.net/handyls@bellsouth.net

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Chicago Usher at Theatre Memphis
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Shows patrons to their seats before the performance starts.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach you. While it is preferable for the consistency of the show that crew members are available for all the listed dates, it is only mandatory to be available for half. Please visit the Theatre Memphis web site at www.theatrememphis.org
Everyone who volunteers with Theatre Memphis will get a comp voucher for a free ticket to the shows for which they have helped.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Wed- Thurs, ushers are needed from 7 \0096 9 :30 PM Sat, ushers are need from 7:30- 10 PM Sun, ushers are needed from 1:30- 5 PM

VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Assistant Stage Manager (all rehearsals & shows) 1-3 Floor (all Shows) 1 Pin 0-2 Spot 1 Sound (all Shows) 0-2 Dressers
Assistant Stage Manager Assists the Stage Manager. Manages the backstage area during tech & performance
Stage (Floor) Crew Responsible for moving props & scenery during the show.
Pin (Rigging) Crew Flies the hanging scenery during tech and performance.
Spotlight Technician Runs the follow spot during tech and performance.
Sound Technician Runs the sound cues, sound & microphone levels during tech & performance
Dresser Helps keep the dressing rooms neat and organized. Helps with difficult costume changes.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach y

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: PetSmart Dog Adoption Days - 4th Saturday
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
PetSmart Adoption Days @ Cumming Marketplace
Every 2nd and 4th Saturday of the month we hold "Adoption Days" where HSFC pets are transported to the PetSmart located in Cumming, Ga. in hopes of finding good, loving, and permanent homes!
New to volunteering with the Humane Society of Forsyth Co.? Please visit the Volunteer Now link on our web page. There you can fill out an application before the event. We look forward to hearing from you!
Note: Saturday's 11 - 3 (double check www.forsythpets.com volunteer calendar for possible cancellations.)
Exisiting volunteers, those who have attanded our volunteer orientation, can contact Angela Morris at: sean_ang@bellsouth.net or Deb Torbitt at: dtorbitt@hotmail.com

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: LIFE Senior Services Holiday Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Share the holidays with LIFE's Case Management Clients! We have a variety of opportunities: 1. Thanksgiving morning or Christmas Eve morning meal deliveries to clients' homes. 2. Stocking and gift deliveries to clients' homes. 3. Provide a gift or gifts.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Please contact LIFE in October or early November. Our program helps approximately 450 older adults and our planning begins in August.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Thanksgiving and Christmas Eve meal deliveries occur in the morning. Hours for gift and stocking deliveries can be arranged by the volunteer. Gift purchases need to be made by early December and delivered to 5950 E. 31.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Chicago Audition Assistant at Theatre Memphis
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Helps manage actors and actor information at auditions.
Ours is a very educational theatre, so if you have an area of interest, but not much experience, we will be happy to teach you. Everyone who volunteers with Theatre Memphis will get a comp voucher for a free ticket to the shows for which they have helped.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Food Setup and Food Server
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Food Setup: Setup dining area and serving area.
Food Servers: Serve food from buffet line to needy and homeless guests to our monthly Loaves & Fishes luncheon.
Other tasks may include: washing dishes, taking out trash, busing tables, cleaning tables.
You are very welcome to work both jobs or just one.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Be able to stand for 4 hours.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Setup takes place 7:30am-10am Serving takes place 10am-2pm.
