VolunteerOpportunity.Title: River Clean Up in Santee
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: 10/11/08 9am-Noon--River Cleanup in Santee at Mast Park. Join the Friends of Santee River Park for a cleanup at Mast Park. Mast Park is a beautiful and special area along the San Diego River and an important stop along the San Diego River Park Trail. Come experience nature and all that this area has to offer while giving back to the environment. This is a great family and group activity for those interested in helping the San Diego River to be healthy again. All tools and supplies are provided. No experience necessary, community service hours can be verified for those that need them. Volunteers will meet in lower parking lot at Mast Park is located on Carlton Hills Blvd just south of Carlton Oaks Dr. For more info or to RSVP call 619.297.7380 or email volunteer@sandiegoriver.org

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Urban Farm Stand - South Natomas
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We are looking for volunteers to help run our exciting new Urban Farm Stand and Community Marketplace. This food access project will bring convenient access to healthy fruits and vegetables to low income communities. Volunteer opportunities include helping with setup and take down of equipment, tables, produce, etc. and interacting with the community, staffing the information table, and helping engage community members in fun activities (e.g., nutrition quizes, giving away stickers, etc.) Will also be working with youth iterns. The Urban Farm Stand will be located at 2201 Northview Drive in South Natomas and will operate every Thursday Evening from July through October.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Viva Vizcaya! (FX)
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help Vizcaya maintains its historical gardens for all of Miami to enjoy. Volunteers will have the opportunity to landscape and beautify the grounds. Family-friendly: minimum age with an adult is 16. Spanish-speaking volunteers especially welcome.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Volunteer Center Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Are you a new Volunteer Center Agency Partner? Are you a nonprofit organization who has never been an Agency Partner and you're curious about membership benefits? Or have you been an Agency Partner for years but aren't quite sure if you're utilizing all our services? Then sign up to attend one of our Volunteer Center Orientations! Come learn about membership benefits and how to take advantage of them, discover other services the Volunteer Center offers, and network with fellow nonprofit organization peers. Come with all the questions you've ever had about our programs and services! This orientation is open to all area agency staff and board members and will be held at the Volunteer Center of Lubbock Conference Room - located at 1706 23rd Street (corner of 23rd Street and Avenue Q) -
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 8:30 a.m. - 9:30 a.m. the third Tuesday of each month

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Life Walk 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Life Perspectives provides practical resources and information about healthy relationships, social responsibility, and other issues that address the value of human life. We are looking for 40 volunteers to assist with our annual fundraising event Life Walk 2008 on October 18th.
Set up Crew \0095 Hang signage \0095 Set up for various table w/ small displays & materials \0095 Prepare for the picnic lunch
Registration Crew \0095 Receive walkers & check in accordingly
Clipboard Crew \0095 Approach walkers prior to arrival to registration table and have them complete form attached to clipboard Picnic Crew \0095 Set up and serve picnic lunch for 150
Tear Down Crew \0095 Assist staff w/ tear down of event

Description.b: Garden Upkeep! We need a small group of volunteers to help upkeep a small garden area. The youth group at Mercy Housing made a beautiful garden and needs some helpful community members to help with the maintenance! Tasks will include; weeding, raking, tilling the compost (if needed), and other general tasks for garden upkeep!

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Ronald McDonald House Holiday Party
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Bring your group or organizaton and provide an activity or arts and crafts project for the Ronald McDonald House Holiday Party.
We also are looking for groups to provide entertainment.
This Open House takes place rain or shine. We provide tours and a good time to all who come (350 to 1,000 people).

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: BOC@Tomorrow's Rainbow
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help out around the farm with ongoing chores such as feeding, mucking, landscaping, habitat repairs etc. Project for BOC residents only

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: BOC@Adopt-A-Street
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: BOC has officially adopted a street in Deerfield Beach which they will maintain by picking up litter, debris, etc. from the road. Project for BOC residents only

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: BOC@Friends Ranch
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Help out around the farm with daily chores. Grooming and care of horses, stall cleaning, watering and general ranch maintenance. Project for BOC residents only.

SponsoringOrganization.Name: The Florida Research Institute for Equine Nurturing, Development and Safety, Inc

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Train the Trainer Orientation
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Volunteer Broward is seeking confident and reliable volunteers to become trainers at several New Volunteer Orientations. Four trainers per orientation are needed to educate our community on responsible volunteerism and familiarize them with the mission and vision of Volunteer Broward. Trainers will be aware of projects happening in Broward County and offer guidance to those individuals interested in participating.
Volunteer Broward will hold 6 Train the Trainer workshops per month at our NVO locations. Trainers must be willing to commit a minimum of three hours per month and may take on more if desired.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Family 9Health Fair Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Medical and Non Medical Volunteers needed for 1, 2, or 3 days during the Family 9Health Fair at Dick's Sporting Goods Field. The fair will take place Friday, October 17 - Sunday, October 19th and volunteers are needed from 7:00 AM - 1:30 PM.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Stuff the Bus Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Help Stuff the Bus for women and children sheltered at Friendship Home! Join in with the community for this annual event stuffing three Star-Tran buses with supplies needed in shelter!
Often, when a woman leaves for shelter, she does not have the time to take with her the simple necessities of daily living. "Stuff the Bus" helps Friendship Home to provide for these needs and for any items that a woman needs to rebuild her life and a home free from fear.
This event spans various hours during April 27-30. All volunteer shifts are two hours. Volunteers will hand out needs lists to shoppers, assist shoppers in placing items in the buses, sell raffle tickets and act as a goodwill ambassador for our agency mission.

Location.Address1: Lincoln Wal-Mart Stores and Sam's Club

VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Ability to work outdoors; ability to stand for an extended period; ability to lift 20 pounds.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon event in April of 2009 Exact dates and times TBA

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Christmas Bells and Red Kettles - 2008
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The Salvation Army is looking for volunteers to ring bells at Christmas. We also need enthusiastic, reliable and patient volunteers to help count money donations collected by The Salvation Army bellringers in red kettles. This opportunity will help you to get into great Christmas Spirit and make you a part of the Salvation Army Christmas Team. Children and parents are welcome!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Different time shifts available

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Angels Among Us Christmas 2008 Program
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: We need volunteers with cheerful Christmas Spirit to help register local low-income families for Christmas assistance with food and toys. Volunteers' duties will include: interviewing the families, filling in family applications and gift wish lists, entering data into computer data base (Basic computer knowledge is needed. Computer training is available!).
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: We need Spanish speaking volunteers!
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Monday, Tuesday: 9am - 1pm. Wednesday, Thursday - 4 - 8pm.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Board Member
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Participate in activities of volunteer nonprofit board, attend all monthly meetings, and serve on committee.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: 1 lunch time monthly mtg (1 1/2 hrs long) and various activities and other committees

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Rescue Volunteer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Respond to emergency search and rescue calls for Boulder County. On call 24/7. Work with police and fire departments. Must be physically able to perform rescue tasks.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: As many hours as one can volunteer

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Shake, Rattle & Stroll 5K/1K Walk in Washington Park
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Shake, Rattle & Stroll 5K/1K Walk on Sunday, June 14,2009 offers a wide range of volunteer opportunities. Enjoy a morning in Wash Park and help raise Parkinson's awareness by filling one of the following volunteer positions: Set-Up, Snack Distributor, Goodie Bag Distributor, Course Marshals, Parking Marshals, Tee Shirt Distributor, Information Distributor, Pledge Collector and Clean-Up. Which ever position you choose to fill, you will be helping the Parkinson Association of the Rockies raise awareness and ensure that race day participants have a fun and safe time. You will work with our volunteer coordinator.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Some heavy lifting may be required.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: June 14, 2009. Set-up will begin at 7am, walk to begin at 9am and clean-up afterwards.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Blizzard Bag Shopper
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: Fill Blizzard Bags with ready-to-eat food that will be given to Meals on Wheels clients. The food is used in emergencies when volunteers are unable to deliver hot meals because of unsafe road conditions. Interested families will be given a "grocery list" of necessary items to fill one of the bags.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: Cost to the volunteer: Approximately $20-25 for a bag of groceries (canned goods and non-perishable food).
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Please call to request shopping list. Deliver groceries to Meals on Wheels office during office hours during the first week of December.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Share Christmas Dinner
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The IRC would like to ask Charlottesville families to invite a refugee family to their homes to share Christmas dinner. We will match volunteers with a refugee family. You can take the time to learn about each other's customs and to enjoy each other's company. It should be a fun and festive learning experience.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You will need to supply /prepare the meal.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Whenever you plan to have your holiday meal.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Share Thanksgiving Dinner
VolunteerOpportunity.Description: The IRC would like to ask Charlottesville families to invite a refugee family to their homes to share Thanksgiving dinner. We will match volunteers with a refugee family. You can take the time to learn about each other's customs and to enjoy each other's company. It should be a fun and festive learning experience.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: You will need to supply the meal.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Whenever you plan to have your holiday meal.

VolunteerOpportunity.Title: Holiday/Winter Hot Meal Deliverer
VolunteerOpportunity.Description:
Deliver hot lunch time meals to homebound clients during the winter, including Thanksgiving and winter breaks from school. Drive once, twice or as many times as you like. Bring the kids!
Meals on Wheels needs substitute drivers this winter as well as volunteers who can take a regular shift - one day per week.
VolunteerOpportunity.SpecialInstructions: One person with valid driver\00BFs license, current automobile insurance, dependable vehicle, and good driving record. Volunteer's ability to work independently, ability to communicate with Meals on Wheels\00BF staff about any concerns, unusual situations or major changes you observe regarding the health, safety and well-being of Meals on Wheels\00BF clients and desire to share a friendly and caring attitude with Meals on Wheels\00BF clients.
VolunteerOpportunity.Comments: Meal delivery takes less than 2 hours. Volunteer should be available from 11:00-1:00 on chosen day.
